title: EMIR/MiFIR Regulatory Reporting Assistance -- Construct 3 EMIR/MIFIR (UK FCA) files
description:
I'm looking for an experienced financial data analyst with expertise in EMIR & MiFIR regulatory reporting to help populate three structured report files (Collateral, TradeExport, MIFIR) based on provided guidelines and trade data. The ideal candidate should:

Understand EMIR & MiFIR reporting requirements, including key fields like UTI, LEIs, collateralization, and transaction lifecycle events.
Extract and map data from provided trade, entity, and collateral datasets to ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
Validate and format data per ISO 8601 (timestamps), regulatory classifications (ISINs, counterparty types), and action types (NEWT, MODI, CANC).
Ensure data integrity by cross-referencing reporting templates with EMIR/MiFIR field descriptions and industry guidelines.
Experience in Excel, financial data processing, regulatory compliance, and transaction reporting is required. Familiarity with CSV-based reporting, trade repositories (e.g., DTCC, Regis-TR), and UK (FCA) financial regulations is a plus. Looking for someone detail-oriented who can ensure accuracy and completeness in the reporting process.

Someone who has done this before, will be very easy task, within a day.
To just know what and how to populate the cells in the templates for EMIR MIFIR reporting (FCA) .

title: Business Analytics Tutor
description:
Hi, we are looking for some business analysts who have real world business analytic and data science project experience to guide our college students practise the project.

Please show me some of your past data analytics projects, and during the job you will guide the intern to complete that project again.  It doesn't have to be a big project, but it should be production level and complex enough for the students to finish in about 8 weeks assuming the students are college graduate. They should work on one internship project, not smaller separate assignments. The project should have real world use, or it is something you have built and designed for your past employer, however, do not disclose any confidential information of the customers.

It is important that you have the data for the interns to work on (not a public data set). Also, must have some type of coding rather than purely excel projects.
Overall the job should be easy if you have some relevant projects in mind.

These are your duties:
- 30-minute weekly Zoom meetings with interns
- Extra up to 30min zoom meeting weekly if the interns are unclear on what to work on

Time commitment: about 1 hours per week per student.

We are based in California, so we prefer those who are comfortable working in US time zone.

If the students like working with you, we want to have you long-term. You can take multiple students to mentor, and we will pay you separately for mentoring each one.

Thank you.

title: Account Executive
description:
KENTECH Consulting Inc. is an award-winning background technology screening company. We are the creators of innovative projects such as eKnowID.com—the first consumer background checking system of its kind—and ClarityIQ, a high-tech/high-touch investigative case management system.

MISSION
We're on a mission to help the world make clear and informed hiring decisions.

VALUE
In order to achieve our mission, our team embodies the core values aligned with it:
core-values

Customer Focused: We are customer-focused and results-driven.
Growth Minded: We believe in collaborative learning and industry best practices to deliver excellence.
Fact Finders: We are passionate investigators for discovery and truth.
Community and Employee Partnerships: We believe there is no greater power for transformation than delivering on what communities and employees care about.
IMPACT
As a small, agile company, we seek high performers who relish the idea that their efforts will directly impact our customers and help shape the next evolution of background investigations.


Role Overview
Are you highly organized, detail-oriented, and skilled at ensuring smooth communication across departments? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where accuracy and efficiency are critical?

KENTECH Consulting Inc. is seeking a customer-focused Intake Specialist to serve as the first point of contact in our background investigation process. In this role, you will play a vital role in case intake, coordination, and data validation, supporting timely and accurate service delivery for our clients.

Key Responsibilities

✔ Case Intake & Data Management – Serve as the initial point of contact for incoming background check requests, ensuring accurate data capture and case setup.
✔ Departmental Coordination – Work closely with Investigative Analysts and Verifications teams to facilitate seamless handoffs and consistent service.
✔ Data Validation & Accuracy – Review client-submitted information, address missing details, and ensure complete, error-free records.
✔ Case Management System Updates – Maintain accurate intake records in ClarityIQ or other case management systems.
✔ Prioritization & Time Management – Manage intake tasks based on client needs, service standards, and deadlines.
✔ Client Communication & Support – Engage with clients to clarify initial case details and foster proactive, customer-first interactions.
✔ Process Improvement – Contribute to ongoing efficiency enhancements in intake workflows and client satisfaction initiatives.

Qualifications & Experience

✔ 1+ years of experience in intake, customer service, or administrative roles (background in healthcare, social services, legal, or background screening is a plus).
✔ Strong attention to detail – Ability to ensure accurate data entry and record-keeping.
✔ Effective written & verbal communication – Client-facing experience preferred.
✔ Tech-Savvy – Proficient in Microsoft Office, Google Suite, and familiarity with case management or CRM systems is a plus.
✔ Ability to adapt to evolving processes in a dynamic, deadline-driven environment.

Soft Skills

🔍 Critical Thinking – Ability to evaluate information accurately and make informed decisions.
🗣 Clear Communication – Strong verbal and written skills for client and team interactions.
🔎 Attention to Detail – Commitment to thorough and precise data management.
🤝 Team Collaboration – Willingness to work cooperatively across departments to ensure seamless operations.
⚡ Problem-Solving – A proactive approach to resolving challenges and optimizing intake processes.

title: Remote Energy Monitoring Analyst
description:
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Energy Manager or Analyst to remotely evaluate energy consumption data collected from sensors attached to individual circuits at customer sites, primarily factories and industrial facilities. Our clients operate heavy machinery such as ovens, compressors, HVAC systems, mixers, and grinders.

Responsibilities:

Weekly evaluation of energy consumption reports provided via our cloud-based platform.

Identify energy-saving opportunities, inefficiencies, trends, and potential issues from the data.

Provide clear, actionable insights and recommendations every Monday in a concise summary format that we can share directly with our customers.

Communicate effectively with our team to provide feedback that can help enhance our energy monitoring product and reporting capabilities.

Requirements:

Proven experience as an Energy Manager, Energy Analyst, or similar role.

Strong understanding of industrial energy usage, energy efficiency, and cost-saving strategies.

Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret energy data and identify actionable insights.

Ability to clearly communicate technical insights in an easily understandable manner.

Proficient with remote/cloud-based platforms and tools.

Independent worker comfortable operating remotely with minimal supervision.

Initial Engagement:
This project will begin with a trial analysis for a single customer. If the collaboration yields positive results and value, there is potential for ongoing, long-term work involving regular weekly analyses for multiple customers.

We look forward to collaborating with a knowledgeable professional who can help our customers optimize their energy efficiency and support our continued product evolution.

title: Data Architect
description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION

Data Architecture, Data Modeling and Data warehousing experience a MUST

WHAT YOU’LL DO
• Define and design future state data architecture for risk data products.
• Partner with Technology, Data Stewards and various Products teams in an Agile
work stream while meeting program goals and deadlines.
• Create user personas to support various business initiatives.
• Engage with line of business, operations, and project partners to gather process
improvements.
• Lead to design / build new models to efficiently deliver the risk results to senior
management.
• Evaluate Data related tools and technologies and recommend appropriate
implementation patterns and standard methodologies to ensure our Data
ecosystem is always modern.
• Collaborate with Enterprise Data Architects in establishing and adhering to
enterprise standards while also performing POCs to ensure those standards are
implemented.
• Provide technical expertise and mentorship to Data Engineers and Data Analysts
in the Data Architecture.
• Develop and maintain processes, standards, policies, guidelines, and governance
to ensure that a consistent framework and set of standards is applied across the
company.
• Create and maintain conceptual / logical data models to identify key business
entities and visual relationships.
• Work with business and IT teams to understand data requirements.
• Maintain a data dictionary consisting of table and column definitions.
• Review data models with both technical and business audiences.
YOU’RE GOOD AT
• Design, document & train the team on the overall processes and process flows
for the Data architecture.
• Resolve technical challenges in critical situations that require immediate
resolution.
• Develop relationships with external stakeholders to maintain awareness of data
and security issues and trends.
• Review work from other tech team members and provide feedback for growth.
• Implement Data security policies that align with governance objectives and
regulatory requirements.
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
Essential Education
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Bachelor's degree in information science, data management, computer science
or related field preferred.
Essential Experience & Job Requirements
• 12+ years of IT experience with major focus on data warehouse/database related
projects
• Expertise in cloud databases like Snowflake/RedShift, data catalogue, MDM etc
• Expertise in writing SQL and database procedures
• Proficient in Data Modelling- Conceptual, logical, and Physical modelling
• Proficient in documenting all the architecture related work performed.
• Hand on experience in data storage, ETL/ELT and data analytics tools and
technologies e.g., Talend, DBT, Attunity, Golden Gate, FiveTran, APIs, Tableau,
Power BI, Alteryx etc
• Experienced in Data Warehousing design/development and BI/ Analytical
systems
• Experience working projects using Agile methodologies
• Strong hands-on experience with data and analytics data architecture, solution
design, and engineering experience
• Experience with Cloud Big Data technologies such as AWS, Azure, GCP and
Snowflake
• Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and Meta Scrum
with cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Master, Architects, and data
SMEs)
• Review existing databases, data architecture, data models across multiple
systems and propose architecture enhancements for cross compatibility and
target systems
• Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills to present
architecture, features, and solution recommendations

title: VC / PE Analyst: Portfolio Company Review
description:
We are seeking an experienced financial analyst with a background in private equity or venture capital to assist with an ad hoc project related to an early-stage investment in a mobility start-up.

Our investment was made through a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV), and we need someone to consolidate recent shareholder memos and financial updates into a consolidated email for our investor group.

Responsibilities:
- Review and analyze the chain of communication to investors from the portfolio company over the last few quarters.
- Reconcile the value and capital structure from two mergers in which we were involved, where payments were made in the stock of the acquiring companies.
- Consolidate all relevant updates and financial data into a clean, 1-2 page email memo that can be sent to our SPV investors.

Requirements:
- Strong experience in private equity or venture capital, particularly in analyzing early-stage investments.
- Familiarity with valuation, capital structures, mergers, and stock-based compensation.
- Excellent analytical and communication skills.
- Attention to detail and ability to work independently with no supervision.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Previous experience in private equity and VC

title: AML Analyst
description:
The AML (Anti-Money Laundering) Analyst is responsible for identifying, analyzing, and mitigating risks associated with financial crimes, including money laundering, terrorist financing, and fraud. This role involves conducting transaction monitoring, customer due diligence, investigations, and ensuring compliance with AML regulations. The analyst works closely with compliance, risk, and law enforcement teams to safeguard the organization from financial crime risks.

Key Responsibilities:
Transaction Monitoring & Investigation:
Monitor and analyze transactions for suspicious activities, potential money laundering, and financial crime risks.
Conduct investigations into flagged accounts, transactions, and customer behaviors.
Prepare Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs) and escalate cases as needed.
File Large Virtual Currency Transaction Reports (LVCTRs) and escalate cases as needed.

Customer Due Diligence (CDD) & Know Your Customer (KYC):
Perform risk-based customer due diligence, enhanced due diligence (EDD), and ongoing monitoring.
Review AML, PEP, Sanctions and Adverse Media flags at the time of user onboarding and through an ongoing review.
Assess and verify customer identities, business activities, and sources of funds.
Review and update customer risk profiles based on transaction patterns and regulatory requirements.

Regulatory Compliance & Reporting:
Ensure compliance with AML regulations, including FINTRAC, and other applicable standards.
Maintain accurate records and prepare reports for regulatory bodies and internal audits.
Assist in audits, regulatory reviews, and compliance risk assessments.

Policy Implementation & Risk Mitigation:
Support the development and enhancement of AML policies, procedures, and internal controls.
Identify emerging financial crime risks and recommend mitigation strategies.
Work with compliance and risk teams to improve monitoring tools and processes.

Training & Collaboration:
Educate employees on AML regulations, fraud prevention, and financial crime detection.
Collaborate with internal teams and law enforcement agencies in financial crime investigations.
Stay updated on regulatory changes, industry best practices, and emerging money laundering risks.
Required Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in finance, law, business, or a related field.
Experience in AML compliance, transaction monitoring, or financial crime investigations.
Strong knowledge of AML regulations, KYC requirements, and financial crime risk management.
Familiarity with AML software, transaction monitoring systems, and case management tools.
Strong analytical, investigative, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and report-writing abilities.

Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications such as CAMS (Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist) or CFCS (Certified Financial Crime Specialist).
Experience in cryptocurrency compliance, fintech, or digital asset risk management.
Knowledge of data analysis tools for financial crime detection.
This role is critical in ensuring the organization’s compliance with AML regulations and protecting it from financial crime risks.
skills: ['Family Law', 'Legal Documentation', 'Anti-Money Laundering', 'State Bar of California', 'New York State Bar Association', 'Law']

title: Finance Manager & Controller (Bilingual FRENCH-ENGLISH)
description:
Financial Controller



Job title: Financial Controller  

Location: Remote
Terms: 3 years full-time contract
Salary/rate: $1000 - $2000 depending on the experience
Reporting to: CEO/ Finance Manager


Company Introduction :

About us:

Our company has currently 3 main locations: France, UAE, Hong Kong. But overall we are a fully distributed company, and we like it like that. Our AMOOVers are spread in 9 countries at the moment and we expect this number to grow in the future. AMOOVers work from wherever they want


AMOOV Vision:

To be the most loved and used mover in the world and make 100,000+ international moves annually



AMOOV Core Values:



Below you will be introduced the 6 AMOOV values. As a whole, they represent our compass needle to our vision & mission:


As an acronym, you can think of our values as:  F O “r” T I C H (slang for strong).

Focus:  Visualize & paint, focus & execute

Ownership & speed . for actions: We do what we Say & say what we do, with speed

Team Ship: Collaborate and innovate as a team

Innovative Mindset: There is a way to do it better: find it. Thomas Edison

Customer obsession: Absolute dedication on providing the greatest experience

Hungry for growth: The more you give, the more you get


Requirements:

Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Financial Controller, FP&A Analyst, or Management Controller, preferably in the supply chain, SME, or freight forwarding industries.

Strong ability to identify and implement process improvements.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across departments.

Hands-on approach with a willingness to dive into the details when necessary.

Leadership experience, managing 1-2 direct reports.

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, or a related field (not necessarily in Accounting).

You speak English and French fluently

You are a great relationship builder, sales at heart.

You are a master at negotiating



Preferred Skills:

Industry experience in supply chain, SME, or freight forwarding.

Proficiency in financial software and tools (e.g., Excel, ERP systems).

Analytical mindset with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.



Other works requirements:

1) Stable internet connection of at least 10 Mbps.
2) A headphone with a microphone (preferably a noise-canceling one).
3) Reliable PC device (at least 8 GB RAM). Mac not accepted.
4) Power bank and internet and data package back-up (3G/4G/5G) (if your wifi is down).

AVAILABILITY and SCHEDULE: Full-time in Paris Time Zone (Central European Time).




About the role:

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Financial Controller to oversee and optimize our financial operations. This role is ideal for a hands-on professional with strong business acumen and a proven track record in financial planning, analysis, and continuous improvement. The Financial Controller will work closely with managers, accountants, and business stakeholders to drive performance and ensure the company’s financial health.


Job Scope:



Develop, implement, and oversee the company’s financial plan, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Lead budgeting, forecasting, cash management, and financial analysis to support decision-making.
Ensure strong financial controls, compliance, and internal processes to prevent revenue loss or liabilities.
Oversee all accounting operations, including AR, AP, collections, invoicing, and project accounting within Xero.
Optimize financial processes, transaction fees, and international transfers to improve efficiency.
Provide insightful management reports and KPIs to track and enhance business performance.
Collaborate with managers, accountants, and operational teams to align financial strategies with business goals.
Manage and mentor a small finance team, fostering accountability and continuous improvement.
Actively support finance operations and ensure seamless integration of new entities.





We Support Growth:

Supporting AMOOVers career growth benefits the team—and it benefits our company. The team members will always have an opportunity to grow and learn in their chosen career path and we support and encourage them realize their full potential.

For an Financial Controller, possible evolution path:

• Finance Manager
• Operational roles
• Markets expansions opportunities

Depending on great performance, interests and abilities.

Who are we looking for?

AMOOV culture is one of multiculturalism. Any AMOOVer should speak at the very least 2 languages.

We are a global organization, that wants to make an impact in the world. We firmly believe AMOOVers have a role to play in a “new globalization”, by connecting people and countries. As old tensions are revived worldwide, or new tensions appear, more than ever, we believe in connecting the dots.

An AMOOVer is driven by helping others and attentive to micro-details. She or he is an empathetic team player, obsessed about going the extra-mile for people, no matter if that person is a client, a colleague or a partner.

If those values resonate, we encourage you very much to apply.

At AMOOV, we have big and audacious goals. That requires AMOOVERS to be OK with not being comfortable in their role, as it will require constant change and improvements. Such is the growth path.

A last & important point: we want people that are ambitious in life and in their work. We commit in helping all AMOOVers achieve their goals. In return, we strongly believe in meritocracy and in the mantra “The more you give, the more you get”.

Slackers, go on your way.




You will be asked to answer the following questions when submitting a proposal:

Describe how your experience and aptitudes make you the right fit for this role
skills: ['People Management', 'Business Plan', 'Corporate Governance', 'Financial Analysis', 'Invoice', 'Financial Projection']

title: Data Analyst: Markets and Trading
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY: TT International is a leading UK-based company, consistently ranked among the top three in the industry for global event ticket sales. Established over a decade ago, the company operates from its headquarters in London, UK.


ABOUT THE TEAM: The risk team analyzes and executes a pricing strategy for tickets based on multiple factors such as the ticket’s value, sales velocity, existing inventory, etc. All members have distinct roles yet interchangeable activities. Therefore, individual effort reflects highly on the team’s performance.


ABOUT THE ROLE

1. Overview: The primary responsibility of this role is to analyze data from various ticket-selling platforms, identify trends, prevent errors, and optimize profits. Unlike static data roles, this position demands individuals who can thrive in a fast-paced environment, making quick and effective decisions based on dynamic markets.

2. Working Hours:
a. Morning shift - 07:00-16:00 GMT (6-day workweek)
b. Evening shift - 14:00-23:00 GMT (6-day workweek).

3. Location: Remote

4. Key responsibilities:
a. Manage risk activities across multiple ticket platforms, conducting spot checks, identifying price changes, spotting errors, transferring stock, and other relevant operations.
b. Adjust pricing and ticket data with a high level of accuracy, collaborating closely with the operations team and adhering to established procedures.
c. Analyze current stock risks, forecast sales, and implement necessary price changes based on your analysis and team communication.
d. Participate in team meetings and discussions.
e. Provide ad-hoc support if needed.

5. Required skills:
a. Degree-level education (preferably in STEM), or equivalent experience.
b. Strong IT proficiency.
c. High attention to detail along with big picture awareness.
d. Strong numerical skills.
e. Good command of the English language.
f. Good organizational skills.
g. Good communication skills.
h. Diligence, reliability, and cooperativeness.
i. 1-year experience in market trading, data-entry, or similar roles.

6. Positions open: 2 (1 for morning and evening shifts each)

title: Meta Ads Manager
description:

About the Role:

We are looking for an experienced Performance Marketing Analyst who can provide high-value insights beyond basic reporting. Weekly Performance Reports – Provide structured reports focusing on trends, anomalies, and strategic recommendations.

Audience & Segmentation Analysis – Examine demographic shifts, geographic performance, and device trends.
Funnel & CRO Review – Investigate landing page drop-offs, scroll depth, and assisted conversions across platforms.

Strong analytical skills with expertise in Excel, Google Sheets, and Data Studio.
Ability to identify trends and explain them with actionable insights.
Familiarity with audience segmentation, ad fatigue, and creative performance metrics.

What We Offer:

Long-term collaboration (weekly or monthly reports).
Work with a fast-growing performance marketing agency.
Flexible work hours – results matter, not when you do them.
The opportunity to shape real ad strategy, not just report numbers.

How to Apply:

We are looking for sharp, analytical minds who can deliver more than just data—if you love diving into the numbers and uncovering hidden opportunities, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Data Analyst for Product Name Matching – Fuzzy Matching & Data Cleansing
description:
We are looking for a data analyst or data scientist with experience in data cleansing, fuzzy matching, and text similarity analysis to compare and identify duplicate or near-duplicate products between two datasets. We have an excel file with fragrance product data on 12,000 products and we need the duplicates removed between the two sources below (CDPH & EWG)

🎯 Goal:

Compare CDPH (California Department of Public Health) dataset and EWG (Environmental Working Group) dataset
Identify and flag potential duplicate products based on product name similarity.
Provide an actionable report of matched products with a confidence score.

📂 Dataset Details:
The two datasets have different naming conventions and lack a unique identifier like UPC or Product ID.
CDPH dataset contains: Product Name, Brand, UPC, and Ingredient List.
EWG dataset contains: Product Name and Ingredients but no unique identifiers.
Challenge: Product names may differ (e.g., "Dove Body Wash" vs. "Dove Nourishing Body Cleanser").
🛠️ Expected Work Process:
Data Preprocessing

Clean and standardize product names (lowercase, remove extra spaces, punctuation, common words like “Eau de Parfum”).
Identify and remove unnecessary stopwords.
Fuzzy Matching / Similarity Analysis

Use fuzzy matching (Levenshtein Distance, Jaccard, Cosine Similarity, or other NLP techniques).
Implement TF-IDF and nearest neighbor search for optimized comparisons.
Use brand matching to enhance accuracy where available.
Flag possible duplicates with a confidence score.
Validation & Reporting

Deliver a final report (CSV, Excel, or Google Sheets) listing:
CDPH Product Name
EWG Matched Product Name
Match Confidence Score (0-100)
Include a summary of findings and any false positives observed.

📈 Expected Deliverables:
✅ Cleaned & Processed Dataset with standardized product names.
✅ Matched Product List with confidence scores.
✅ Python script or methodology documentation to replicate the process.
✅ Recommendations on improving future matching.
skills: ['SQL', 'LLM Prompt Engineering', 'datasets', 'text matching', 'Computer Vision', 'Data Cleaning', 'Python', 'Machine Learning']

title: Data Analyst / Business Strategist for Market Optimization in Construction Bidding
description:
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled data analyst or business strategist with expertise in market analytics, predictive modeling, and competitive intelligence to help us optimize our bidding and operational efficiency in a niche segment of the construction industry.

Our business operates in a highly competitive, project-based environment where pricing, supply chain dynamics, and competitor behavior play a crucial role in profitability. We believe that a data-driven approach can give us a significant edge in the market, similar to how sports betting professionals and financial traders leverage statistical models to find inefficiencies.

What We Need:
Market Analysis & Predictive Modeling

Develop a data-driven pricing strategy that dynamically adjusts to market conditions.
Identify historical patterns in bidding success and competitor behavior.
Model builder preferences and optimize pricing accordingly.
Competitive Intelligence Dashboard

Track bid outcomes and refine pricing strategies based on win/loss rates.
Build a real-time competitor profiling system to detect pricing trends and strategic shifts.
Develop a probability-weighted bidding system to optimize profitability.
Risk Management & Cash Flow Optimization

Implement a data-backed risk allocation strategy for project selection.
Model cash flow cycles and retention payment impacts to optimize financial planning.
Identify pricing inefficiencies in materials and supply chain costs.
Ideal Candidate:
Experience in data science, business intelligence, or financial modeling.
Strong understanding of pricing models, market inefficiencies, and predictive analytics.
Bonus: Background in sports betting analytics, financial trading, or procurement optimization.
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, or any other relevant data visualization tools.
This is an exciting opportunity to apply high-level data analytics to a real-world industry challenge with massive potential. If you’re a numbers-driven problem solver who enjoys uncovering hidden opportunities in markets, we’d love to hear from you.

Confidentiality: Due to the competitive nature of this initiative, further details will be provided after signing an NDA.

Budget: Open to discussion based on experience and project scope.

title: Marketing Data Architect & Analytics Specialist
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Marketing Data Architect & Analytics Specialist to join our team and lead a critical project focused on optimizing and maintaining our marketing performance data. This role will be pivotal in ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and accessibility of our media and web analytics data, including offline conversion events. You will be responsible for designing and implementing robust data architecture solutions, enhancing our Google Analytics 4 (GA4) implementation, creating insightful data visualizations, managing clickstream and tag data, and conducting in-depth SQL-based data analysis.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Data Architecture & Management:**
    * Design and implement scalable and efficient data architecture solutions for marketing performance data.
    * Develop and maintain data pipelines for collecting, processing, and storing media, web, and offline conversion data.
    * Ensure data integrity and quality through data validation, cleansing, and monitoring.
    * Manage and optimize data storage and retrieval processes.
* **Google Analytics 4 (GA4) Expertise:**
    * Lead the implementation, configuration, and optimization of GA4.
    * Develop and maintain custom events, dimensions, and metrics within GA4.
    * Ensure accurate tracking of website and app user behavior.
    * Integrate GA4 with other data sources, including CRM and offline conversion systems.
* **Data Visualization & Reporting:**
    * Create compelling and actionable data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio, or Qlik.
    * Develop standardized reporting templates and automated reporting processes.
    * Present data insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
* **Clickstream & Tag Management:**
    * Manage and optimize clickstream data collection and analysis.
    * Implement and maintain tag management systems (e.g., Google Tag Manager).
    * Ensure accurate tracking of marketing campaigns and user interactions.
    * Troubleshoot tag and clickstream related data issues.
* **SQL & Data Analysis:**
    * Write complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data from various databases.
    * Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
    * Develop and maintain data models and schemas.
    * Analyze data to improve marketing campaign performance, and web site conversion rates.
* **Offline Conversion Tracking:**
    * Implement and manage offline conversion tracking processes.
    * Integrate offline conversion data with online marketing platforms.
    * Ensure accurate attribution of offline conversions to marketing campaigns.
* **Data Governance:**
    * Help to establish and enforce data governance policies and procedures.
    * Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).

Project Overview

We specialize in bridging the worlds of blockchain and geography. As part of our ongoing projects, we want to enhance our geolocation data so it can be mapped seamlessly onto financial datasets. What We Need

- Data Cleaning & Processing: Review and refine existing geolocation datasets to ensure completeness and accuracy.

- Collaboration & Reporting: Work closely with our team to share progress, document findings, and suggest improvements for ongoing data management.

- Data Visualization Experience (Nice to Have): Know-how to create clear, insightful maps and visual representations of location-based data.

- Effective Communication: You’ll be collaborating with a remote team, so timely updates and clear communication are a must.

Deliverables

- Documentation & Scripts: Clearly commented Python scripts (or equivalent) for data cleaning, transformation, and validation.
Integration Plan: Recommendations and steps for smoothly merging geolocation data with our financial databases.

Why Work With Us

- Innovative Mission: Be a part of revolutionizing global finance through better crypto and geospatial data integration.

How to Apply

title: Sports Data Visualization Specialist - NFL Analytics
description:
OVERVIEW

We're building data-driven content around football analytics that requires more than just numbers—it needs compelling, insightful visualizations that tell a story. The most engaging NFL content combines deep statistical analysis with clear, intuitive visual presentation. We need someone who can transform complex player and team metrics into visualizations that both casual fans and hardcore analysts can appreciate.

JOB SUMMARY

We're looking for a talented Sports Data Visualization Specialist who can create compelling, advanced statistical visualizations for NFL data. You'll combine technical skills in data analysis with creative visualization techniques to produce content that elevates our analytical insights and engages our audience.
PROJECT SCOPE (Part-time, hourly basis)
You'll be responsible for:

• Creating advanced, explanatory data visualizations for NFL player and team performance
• Developing custom charts, graphs, and visual frameworks that make complex stats accessible
• Using both traditional visualization tools and cutting-edge AI to enhance visual storytelling

WHAT YOU’LL DO

1. Advanced Visualization Creation

o Design quadrant charts, scatterplots, and custom visualizations showing player/team comparisons
o Develop visual frameworks that explain complex football concepts
o Create clear, branded visualizations that stand out from typical sports graphics
o Combine multiple data points into cohesive visual stories

2. Data Analysis & Interpretation

o Work with raw NFL statistics to identify meaningful patterns and insights
o Utilize appropriate statistical methods to process and analyze football data
o Translate technical findings into visualizations that highlight key takeaways
o Incorporate context and football knowledge into visual presentations

3. Tools & Technologies

title: Airbnb Short-Term Rental Pricing Strategy in Google Sheets (Dynamic Formula + Automation)
description:
I am seeking an experienced Google Sheets developer (or data analyst with strong spreadsheet skills) to create a dynamic pricing strategy model for short-term rentals on Airbnb. The sheet aims to integrate various data inputs—occupancy, average daily rates (ADR), and comp set percentile positions—into a streamlined, automated Google Sheets environment.

I previously worked with another freelancer on this project, but due to timing, we were unable to finalize the solution. I now need a reliable expert who can pick up and improve upon existing google sheet files and deliver a robust, user-friendly tool that my team and I can easily maintain.

Background

Objective: Build an automated system in Google Sheets to project short-term rental pricing across weekdays, weekends, and holidays while factoring in occupancy and “comp set” percentile positioning. There are three more tabs that are laid out but need formulas to connect the backend data dump as well.

Existing Assets:
Multiple partially completed Google Sheets with tabular logic, occupant-based formulas, and references to comp set percentile data.
A script meant to handle CSV imports (e.g., 12 to 18 months of historical and upcoming data) but needs debugging and enhancement.
Loom videos demonstrating the initial approach, formulas, and advanced tasks (e.g., capturing the “relevant price percentile ADR,” pulling in occupancy data, etc.).
CSV files containing raw occupancy and revenue data for multiple listings.

What I Need Done:
Data Import & Parsing
Finalize or rebuild the script that ingests CSV data (12–18 months’ worth), correctly handles duplicated months, and appends or overwrites existing data as necessary.
Ensure the import script can be triggered on-demand by a button or menu item in Google Sheets.
Dynamic Pricing Formula

Create (or refine) formulas that incorporate separate logic for weekdays vs. weekends/holidays.

Dashboard & Visualization

Develop a dedicated “Dashboard” tab pulling from the processed data to display (90% done):

Testing & Validation

Thoroughly test the final formulas and scripts using sample CSV data for accuracy and ease of use.
Provide clear instructions or Loom videos explaining how to maintain and adjust the system.

Deliverables
One fully working Google Sheet:
Automated CSV Import Script
Clean, well-labeled pricing logic and formulas for accurate data analysis and adjustments.

Ideal Freelancer
Expert in Google Sheets (queries, array formulas, scripts in Apps Script).
Familiar with short-term rental revenue management (occupancy, ADR, comp sets, dynamic pricing concepts).
Excellent communication—willing to provide Looms or detailed instructions on how to use the tool.
Proactive problem-solver who can suggest best practices for automation and clarity.

Timeline: Prefer a 2–3 week turnaround, with frequent check-ins or milestone deliveries to ensure alignment.

How to Apply
Relevant Experience: Share any related Google Sheets, formuals, and automation you’ve completed.

Availability: When can you start, and how soon could you deliver a first draft?

We’ll schedule a short introductory call after reviewing proposals to clarify the scope, walk you through the partial Sheet we have, and confirm next steps.

Thank you for your interest. I’m excited to find the right freelancer to help finalize and elevate this Airbnb short-term rental pricing strategy model!
skills: ['Automation', 'Google Sheets', 'JavaScript', 'Google Apps Script', 'Google Workspace']

title: Research Deck
description:
We are seeking a highly focused and results-driven Remote Market Research Analyst for a **critical, time-sensitive project** to develop a concise, investor-focused presentation that outlines targeted sales opportunities for our supermarket-focused SaaS solution. This project must be completed and delivered within **three working days** of the contract being awarded. The focus is on pinpointing specific, actionable opportunities within the global supermarket sector.

**Deliverables:**

* **List of Major Global Retailers (Exclusion List):**
    * A comprehensive list of the largest global retailers (e.g., Walmart, Tesco, Aldi), including their sub-brands and owned companies, to facilitate immediate exclusion from targeted sales efforts.
* **Targeted Supermarket List:**
    * A detailed list of supermarket chains within identified target countries, along with their respective sub-brands and related entities.
* **Geographic Opportunity Map:**
    * A clear and visually compelling map highlighting the geographic distribution of identified supermarket opportunities.
* **Investor-Focused Presentation:**
    * A concise and impactful presentation that includes:
        * The exclusion list and targeted supermarket list.
        * The geographic opportunity map.
        * Data-backed analysis demonstrating the potential for rapid customer acquisition and revenue growth.
        * Focused competitive landscape analysis within targeted supermarket regions, highlighting our product's differentiators.
        * Clear and easily understood charts and tables.
* **Data Accuracy:**
    * Strive to deliver the most accurate opportunity assessment possible, acknowledging that data availability may limit absolute precision. All data should be clearly referenced.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Urgent Opportunity Identification (Global Supermarkets):**
    * Analyze the characteristics of supermarkets to identify suitable business profiles.
    * Conduct focused online research to identify geographic regions and specific supermarket chains that match these profiles.
    * Focus on identifying regions where similar supermarket businesses are present and where the lack of in-house IT development for stock optimization would make our SaaS solution valuable.
    * Identify supermarkets that would benefit from improved on-shelf stock levels based on point of sale and delivery data.
* **Rapid Targeted Sales Opportunity Presentation Development (Remote):**
    * Create the deliverables listed above within the 3 day timescale.
* **Focused Competitive Landscape Analysis (Supermarkets):**
    * Identify key competitors within the identified supermarket opportunity regions, focusing on solutions that address stock optimization and replenishment.
    * Identify how our product differentiates itself from the competition within the identified opportunity regions, specifically in its ability to optimize on-shelf availability based on real-time data.
* **Rapid Remote Communication:**
    * Communicate research findings and recommendations effectively through online channels.
    * Deliver the finalized presentation and all deliverables in a clear and concise manner within the 3 day deadline.

**Project Terms:**

* This is a one-off, remote project with a fixed deadline of three working days from contract award.
* Fixed project fee.
skills: ['Market Research', 'Presentation Design', 'Business Presentation', 'Graphic Design', 'Microsoft PowerPoint']

title: Real Estate Data Engineer & Analyst | Scrape & Analyze Zillow, Redfin for High-ROI Deals
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer + Data Analyst to build the foundation of a powerful real estate deal-finding system, focused on uncovering high-ROI investment opportunities for both low income housing and medium-term rentals.
The core of this project is not just web scraping—it's about using deep data analysis across multiple platforms to help us identify undervalued properties and profitable markets based on dynamic, adjustable investment criteria.
We are looking for someone who can help us build a system where we can input a zip code and receive a list of investment-worthy properties that align with our financial models, rental strategies, and location preferences.

Project Goals

✅ Scrape property data from Zillow and Redfin.
✅ Scrape external data such as:
-Hospital data (number of beds, hospital size, proximity to properties).
-Section 8 housing data (voucher amounts, area pricing, demand).
-Neighborhood scores (Walk Score, Bike Score, Transit Score).
✅ Analyze combined datasets to identify ideal properties based on:
-Investment potential (Cash-on-Cash Return, Cap Rate, IRR, GRM, NOI).
-Proximity to hospitals and key employers.
-low income housing rent comparables and area demand.
-Days on market, property condition, and pricing trends.
✅ Make all filters, thresholds, and assumptions easily adjustable (bedroom count, days on market, price range, rehab costs, etc.).
✅ Deliver clean, organized datasets (CSV, Excel, or database) and easy-to-use reports that help us make smart buying decisions.
✅Create powerful visualizations

This is is the tip of the iceberg with this project, looking for someone to manage and accomplish this for the long run to reach our full vision for this project.


❓Looking at these websites, are you able to scrape all the data:
1) https://www.huduser.gov/portal/datasets/fmr/fmrs/FY2025_code/select_geography_sa.odn
2) https://www.ahd.com/state_statistics.html

Analyzing pricing structures for each country and identifying cost discrepancies.
Comparing offers based on data volume, network coverage, and pricing models.
Compiling a comprehensive report summarizing the best supplier per region.
Providing actionable insights to optimize our procurement strategy.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail are essential. A background in cost analysis, supplier management, or telecom industry experience is preferred.

If you have expertise in data-driven pricing analysis and supplier comparison, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Business Research Analyst / Proposal Writer / Business Plan Developer
description:
The Business Research Analyst/Proposal Writer/Business Plan Developer is responsible for conducting in-depth research, analyzing data, and creating comprehensive business plans, proposals, and reports. This role involves gathering and interpreting market data, identifying trends, and providing actionable insights to support decision-making. The individual will also develop compelling proposals and business plans to secure funding, partnerships, or new business opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Research and Analysis:
• Conduct market research to identify industry trends, customer needs, and competitive landscapes.
• Analyze data from various sources (e.g., financial reports, surveys, market studies) to provide insights.
• Perform SWOT analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) to evaluate business opportunities.
• Monitor and report on economic, regulatory, and technological changes affecting the business.

2. Business Plan Development:
• Develop detailed business plans outlining goals, strategies, and financial projections.
• Create executive summaries, operational plans, and marketing strategies.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to align business plans with organizational objectives.
• Ensure business plans are realistic, data-driven, and tailored to the target audience.

3. Proposal Writing:
• Write and edit proposals for grants, contracts, or partnerships.
• Tailor proposals to meet the requirements of clients, investors, or funding agencies.
• Include clear value propositions, project timelines, budgets, and deliverables.
• Ensure proposals are compliant with guidelines and submitted on time.

4. Financial Analysis:
• Prepare financial models, forecasts, and budgets to support business plans and proposals.
• Analyze financial data to assess the viability of projects or initiatives.
• Provide recommendations to optimize costs and improve profitability.
5. Collaboration and Communication:
• Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g., marketing, finance, operations) to gather input and align strategies.
• Present research findings, business plans, and proposals to senior management or external stakeholders.
• Communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner.
6. Documentation and Reporting:
• Maintain accurate records of research, proposals, and business plans.
• Prepare reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders.
• Ensure all documents are professionally formatted and error-free.
7. Continuous Improvement:
• Stay updated on industry best practices, tools, and technologies.
• Identify opportunities to improve research methodologies, proposal processes, and business planning.
________________________________________
Skills and Qualifications:
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Marketing, or a related field. A Master’s degree (e.g., MBA) is a plus.
• Experience: 2+ years of experience in business research, analysis, proposal writing, or business planning.
• Analytical Skills: Strong ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
• Writing Skills: Excellent written communication skills with the ability to create clear, concise, and persuasive documents.
• Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), data analysis tools and financial modeling software.
• Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy in research, analysis, and documentation.
• Time Management: Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
• Interpersonal Skills: Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with teams and stakeholders.
skills: ['Market Research', 'Financial Modeling', 'Business Analysis', 'Market Analysis', 'Finance & Accounting', 'Marketing Strategy']

title: Financial Analyst Needed for ROI & Impact Calculations for Client Case Study
description:
Hello! We’re looking for a financial/data analyst who can help us quantify the business impact of a recent software implementation project. Our goal is to create a compelling case study that goes beyond anecdotes and clearly communicates ROI, cost savings, time savings, and other quantifiable results.

Key Tasks

Review & Assess: Examine our existing project details (e.g., time saved, error reduction, new revenue potential).
Data Gathering: Help formulate questions or data requests for our client if we need additional information to make accurate calculations.

ROI & Benefit Calculations:
Estimate cost savings (e.g., time, labor, material waste).
Project potential revenue impact (e.g., additional sales due to faster product releases).
Factor in any intangible benefits if they can be reasonably measured.

Deliverables:
A concise, clear summary of your findings (e.g., a short report or spreadsheet).
Insight into methodology (how you arrived at the numbers).
Suggestions on how to present these figures in a case study (charts, bullet points, etc.).


About Us

We’re a no-code/low-code development consultancy specializing in Airtable and related tools.
We recently helped a large brand streamline their processes, and we want to highlight real, data-driven outcomes in our marketing materials.

What We’re Looking For

Experience in financial analysis, ROI modeling, or similar quantitative assessments.
Strong communication skills: ability to explain calculations and assumptions clearly.

title: Board Certified Behavioral Analyst (BCBA)
description:
Location: College Park, GA (Remote/Telehealth)
About Guiding Hands ABA Therapy:
Guiding Hands ABA Therapy is committed to providing exceptional Applied Behavior Analysis
(ABA) services to children with autism and their families. We strive to foster meaningful progress
in our clients’ lives by combining expertise, compassion, and innovation. Join us in making a
difference!
Job Summary:
As a Telehealth BCBA at Guiding Hands ABA Therapy, you will provide high-quality ABA
treatment, support, and training to maximize client progress through telehealth services. Your
role involves leadership, coordination, and the supervision of a dedicated team of Registered
Behavior Technicians (RBTs) and Behavior Technicians. This fully remote position requires
expertise in developing individualized treatment plans, overseeing behavior interventions, and
ensuring effective training for families and staff.
Responsibilities:
Clinical Duties:
● Develop, monitor, and modify individualized treatment and behavior intervention plans
tailored to telehealth delivery.
● Conduct initial and ongoing remote assessments of client skills and needs.
● Provide telehealth-based parent training, ensuring open communication and support for
generalization and progress.
● Oversee clinical documentation, ensuring compliance with insurance and HIPAA
requirements for telehealth services.
● Conduct regular data analysis, progress reviews, and care adjustments through virtual
platforms.
Supervision and Training:
● Provide virtual leadership and supervision for RBTs and other direct care staff.
● Conduct remote RBT competency assessments and ensure ongoing compliance with
BACB requirements.
● Offer virtual staff training and professional development sessions to enhance team
capabilities.
Administrative Duties:
● Maintain accurate electronic records, schedules, and treatment notes in the practice
management system.
● Ensure timely submission of telehealth-related documentation for audits and billing
purposes.
● Collaborate with families, therapists, and other stakeholders via video conferencing to
coordinate care.
Operational Excellence:
● Meet productivity and billable hour expectations through telehealth service delivery.
● Identify and address clients’ additional support needs, such as high-risk behaviors or
family training, using virtual resources and tools.
Qualifications:
● Master’s degree in ABA, Special Education, Psychology, or a related field.
● Current BCBA certification from the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB).
● Minimum of 2 years of BCBA experience, including remote/telehealth services.
● Proficient in using ABA assessment tools and best practices within a telehealth
framework.
● Strong communication, organizational, and leadership skills suitable for remote
interaction.
● Knowledge of HIPAA regulations and insurance requirements specific to telehealth
services.
● Reliable internet connection and technology to deliver telehealth services effectively.
Preferred:
● Supervisory experience with RBTs and completion of the BACB Supervision and
Experience module.
● Experience in addressing high-risk behaviors and developing specialized programming
remotely.
Why Join Us?
● Competitive Pay
● Flexible fully remote work environment.
skills: ['Supervision', 'Data Visualization', 'BCBA Certified', 'Data Analysis', 'Microsoft Power BI', 'Neo4j', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Senior Growth Data Analyst (Short-Term Project, Ecom & Performance Marketing Focus)
description:
Senior Growth Data Analyst

We’re building out a channel-level performance scoring model for our marketing audit framework and need a sharp, data-driven strategist to get it right. This isn’t just about crunching numbers—it’s about structuring a rating system that actually reflects performance and ties directly to business impact.

This is a project (~1-2 months) focused on developing a quantitative scoring model that can be tested against real data, refined, and ultimately used to diagnose weak points across Paid, CRM, SEO, and CRO.

What You’ll Be Doing
Build a structured scoring system for channel audits that’s actually useful, not just a checklist
• Define weightings for each metric so we’re measuring what really moves the needle
• Validate the model using historical data and stress-test it against live audits
• Work with channel leads to ensure scoring makes sense in the real world
• Make sure it’s scalable so it can be automated later

What We’re Looking For
• 5+ years in growth analytics, marketing data science, or performance marketing strategy
• Knows multi-channel performance metrics inside out (CAC, LTV, ROAS, AOV, retention, etc.)
• Experience building scoring models or rating systems that have been used to drive decisions
• Can balance statistical rigor with real-world execution
• Ideally, solid with SQL, Python, or R to test and validate data
• Bonus if you’ve worked with Tableau or similar BI tools

description:
Data Analyst (BigQuery, JSON, BI) | K-12 Education Analytics

About Innovare:
Innovare is an education-focused analytics company helping K-12 schools and districts make data-driven decisions to improve student outcomes. We are seeking a data analyst with expertise in BigQuery, JSON, and BI tools (Looker Studio) to help us analyze and visualize key education performance metrics.

Who We're Looking For:
We need an analytical problem solver with experience in education data systems, K-12 success metrics, and performance tracking. If you have a strong background in data analytics and a deep understanding of K-12 education ecosystems, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:
- BigQuery & Data Management: Query, clean, and model large datasets in Google BigQuery for efficiency and scalability.
- JSON & API Data Integration: Develop JSON-based scripts for data transformations, API integrations, and interoperability with K-12 systems (e.g., Aspen, PowerSchool, Clever).
- Data Visualization & Reporting: Create impactful dashboards in Looker Studio to help educators and administrators track student achievement, attendance, intervention effectiveness, and funding allocations.

      - Student achievement trends (i-Ready, MAP Growth, state assessments)
      - Equity and intervention impact tracking (MTSS, Title I, ESSA compliance)
      - School funding and performance ratings
- Cross-Team Collaboration: Work with product, engineering, and customer success teams to align data analytics with school improvement strategies.
- Effective Project Management: Using Asana, organize, prioritize, and execute projects with clear timelines, milestones, and deliverables to ensure seamless integration with team priorities.

Required Qualifications:
- Experience working with K-12 data systems (Aspen, PowerSchool, Clever, ClassLink, i-Ready, MAP Growth, etc.)
- 3+ years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or data engineering
- Strong SQL and Google BigQuery expertise
- Proficiency in JSON for API integrations and structured data handling
- Ability to translate complex datasets into actionable insights for educators and administrators
- Strong communication and problem-solving skills

Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have):
- Experience with Ed-Fi, OneRoster, or other education data interoperability standards
- Python for data automation and analysis
- Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience

Project Scope & Duration:
- Contract-based project with potential for long-term collaboration or full-time opportunity
- 20-30 hours per week to start, with opportunities to expand

title: Data Analyst - FP&A
description:
About the Role
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Analyst, Strategic Finance and Reporting to join our Finance team. This role plays a crucial part in supporting the company’s strategic initiatives by delivering actionable insights, developing reliable revenue, expense, and churn forecasts, and providing deep analytical support to drive business growth and cost savings.
As a key member of our team, you will be working closely with cross-functional partners in Sales, Marketing, Finance, People’s Team, and Operations to ensure the accuracy and integrity of customer and revenue data. You will leverage your expertise in Salesforce, SQL, and Excel/Google Sheets to create, maintain, and optimize our revenue and  performance reports, while identifying and explaining budget-to-actual variances.
If you thrive in fast-paced, data-driven environments and enjoy working at the intersection of data analytics, forecasting, and business strategy, this role is for you.


Key Responsibilities
Revenue & Churn Forecasting:
Build, refine, and maintain revenue and churn forecasting models, adapting them based on market conditions, business needs, and evolving data trends.
Continuously improve forecasting methodologies to enhance accuracy and predictability.
Conduct variance analysis to identify discrepancies between forecasts and actual results and provide actionable insights to key stakeholders.
Data Integration & Analytics:
Integrate data from Salesforce, Redshift, Tableau, and other data sources to ensure reliable inputs for forecasting models.
Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Operations teams to gather and validate data for accurate decision-making.
Perform deep-dive analyses to uncover trends, anomalies and understand the root causes and driving factors.
Reporting & Decision Support:
Develop and maintain dynamic dashboards and reports to track GTM KPIs, sales performance, and revenue and cost trends (e.g. ARPU, Gross Margins, LTV, Headcount Costs, OpEx, etc)
Present forecasting results, key insights, and recommendations to senior leadership in a clear and concise manner.
Provide strategic guidance by leveraging data to support budgeting, goal-setting, and revenue growth initiatives.
Process Optimization & Data Quality:
Ensure high standards of data accuracy, governance, and integrity in all reporting and analytics efforts.
Identify opportunities to streamline reporting processes, automate workflows, and enhance analytical efficiency.
Act as a subject matter expert on forecasting methodologies, reporting best practices, and analytics tools within the organization.


Qualifications & Skills
2-4 years of experience in Go-to-Market Analytics, Sales Forecasting, or Sales Performance & Reporting, preferably in a SaaS environment.
Proven experience in sales forecasting, financial modeling, budget-to-variance analysis, and revenue reporting.
Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets, including complex formulas, pivot tables
Experience with CRM platforms (Salesforce) and data warehousing solutions (Redshift) is a plus.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to data quality.
Ability to communicate complex data-driven insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to thrive in fast-paced, high-growth environments

title: Real Estate Underwriter & Investment Analyst | Fast-Growing Company | Career Growth Potential
description:
We’re Not Just Looking for Another Freelancer—We’re Looking for a Key Player in Our Vision!

Imagine this: You’re not just crunching numbers. You’re helping build an investment empire—one deal at a time. You’re the foundation of a company that’s scaling fast in real estate, and your analysis determines which deals we take, which properties we acquire, and ultimately, how we grow.

Who We Are:
We’re a fast-moving real estate investment firm, actively buying houses and properties in multiple markets. We don’t just flip houses—we build wealth. We acquire off-market deals, analyze their potential, and make high-stakes investment decisions.

Who You Are:
You’re not just looking for another gig—you want to be part of something bigger. You want to see the impact of your work, help shape an investment strategy, and grow with a company that values your skills.

What You’ll Be Doing (Day-to-Day):
• Underwriting Land & Residential Deals → Pulling comps, analyzing ARV, and making data-backed investment recommendations.

• Creating “Buy or Pass” Reports → Presenting clear, easy-to-read analysis for investment decisions.
• Optimizing Deal Flow → Streamlining our underwriting process to make it faster & more efficient.
• Collaborating with Leadership → You’ll work directly with me (the founder) to refine our acquisition strategy.

The Right Candidate Will:

✅ Have Strong Experience in Real Estate Valuations → You understand market trends, comps, & investment analysis.
✅ Think Like an Investor → You don’t just analyze deals—you understand how they fit into a bigger financial picture.
✅ Be Hungry & Growth-Oriented → You see this as a long-term opportunity, not just a side gig.

Compensation & Growth:
• $4-6 /hr (Based on Experience) with potential for increased hours & full-time role as we scale.
• Room for career growth → As we grow, you grow. Future leadership roles in acquisitions possible.

If this excites you, apply now! Send me a message with:
1️⃣ Your experience in real estate underwriting.

We’re looking for someone to start ASAP. Let’s build something big together.

title: Senior Data Scientist – CPG Revenue Analysis & Trade Promotion Optimization
description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our team and drive data-led decision making in the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) space. In this role, you will lead complex analytic studies, develop and deploy advanced machine learning models, and provide strategic insights to optimize revenue analysis, trade promotion management, and trade promotion optimization. You will work closely with cross-functional teams—including data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders—to integrate AI/ML solutions into our software products and elevate our data environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Analytical Leadership: Lead multifaceted analytic studies on large datasets using exploratory mathematical and statistical techniques.
Data Experimentation: Conduct experiments with various data sets to uncover novel solutions to challenging data problems.
Solution Implementation: Develop, test, and deploy data-driven models and solutions that effectively leverage AI/ML to optimize business operations.
Collaboration: Work closely with Data Engineers and Analysts to build robust data environments and integrate machine learning models into our software products.
Strategic Development: Formulate methodologies for project prioritization, scheduling, and the implementation of machine learning solutions.
Insight Communication: Clearly communicate data insights and strategic recommendations to stakeholders and clients, ensuring complex information is understandable and actionable.
Requirements:

Education: PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (PhD preferred).
Experience: 5-10 years of professional experience with a proven track record of building and deploying statistical and machine learning models at the enterprise level.
Technical Expertise: Deep knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical programming languages such as R and Python. Proficiency with SQL and data processing tools like Hive or Pig.
Data Proficiency: Strong skills in data engineering, visualization, and storytelling to translate complex datasets into actionable insights.
Problem Solving: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, with experience decomposing complex business challenges and implementing quantitative solutions.
Cloud Technologies: Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud—with a preference for Azure experience.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication and project management skills, with the ability to work independently as well as within a team.
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the consumer goods industry or similar sectors (e.g., Health and Beauty Care, OTC Pharma, or Grocery/Big Box retail).
Background in large-scale operations (e.g., experience at companies like Google or Amazon) or with leading consultancy firms building data science solutions for CPG clients.
Proven experience in building trade lift models and/or marketing mix models.
Familiarity with price promotion and assortment optimization software.
Certification in Data Science, Machine Learning, or Artificial Intelligence is a plus.
If you are a strategic thinker passionate about leveraging data to drive business success in the CPG industry, we’d love to hear from you. Please submit your resume along with examples of your previous work or case studies relevant to trade promotion and revenue analysis.

title: Seeking Financial Expert to Develop a 5-Year Budget & Growth Plan for Cybersecurity & Tech Firm

Our investor is already committed to funding the business, and we aim to reach $10M revenue within 5 years (on paper). We need a realistic, data-driven plan that breaks down:

Budget requirements to reach $10M revenue

This role is not about over-promising growth but about delivering a solid financial structure that justifies the investment and optimizes business decisions.

📌 Who We Are Looking For

title: AI-Powered Business Intelligence and Data Analytics System
description:
Problem:
A mid-sized insurance & healthcare company is struggling with data management, reporting, and customer interaction. Their existing system:
• It has scattered data sources (databases, spreadsheets, third-party APIs).
• Relies on manual reporting, causing delays in business decisions.
• Has a customer service team overloaded with queries that could be automated.
• Lacks a centralized AI-driven data warehouse for analytics and predictions.
They now want to fully automate their data workflows, chatbot-driven interactions, and real-time business intelligence.

Project Overview:
This project aims to build a complete AI-powered ecosystem integrating:
1. Chatbot for customer support & data querying (Azure OpenAI + RAG).
2. Automated ETL pipelines (for structured/unstructured data).
3. Centralized Data Warehouse (Azure Synapse for real-time insights).
4. Power BI Dashboards (for business analytics & decision-making).

Functional Requirements:
1. AI-Powered Chatbot (Customer & Internal Use Cases)
     • Customer Queries:
           o Customers can chat with an AI chatbot to ask about policies, claims, coverage, or
                     medical reports.
           o The chatbot can pull data from a centralized warehouse using RAG (Retrieval-
                     Augmented Generation).
           o Example: “What is my insurance claim status?” → Chatbot fetches real-time data.
     • Internal Queries for Employees & Analysts:
           o Employees can ask, "Show me the total claims processed last month", and the chatbot
                     retrieves live Power BI insights.
           o AI can generate reports & trends on demand.
     • Technical Stack:
           o Azure OpenAI (GPT-4) for NLP
           o Azure AI Search for RAG-based document retrieval
           o Azure Blob Storage for document management

2. Data Integration & ETL Pipelines (Automated Workflow)
     • Extract Data:
           o Data from multiple sources (SQL databases, APIs, CSVs, and PDFs).
     • Transform Data:
           o Clean, validate, and structure data using Python (Pandas, PySpark).
           o NLP-based extraction from unstructured medical reports & claims.
     • Load Data:
           o Store transformed data in Azure Synapse (Data Warehouse).
     • Automate Pipelines:
           o Use Azure Data Factory to schedule & orchestrate ETL workflows.
3. Data Warehouse (Centralized Storage & Query Engine)
     • Business Use Case:
              The company wants a real-time analytics platform to track:
           o Total claims processed per day/month/year
           o Customer retention trends
           o Risk analysis for fraud detection
           o Predictive analytics for customer churn
     • Technical Stack:
           o Azure Synapse Analytics (for scalable querying).
           o Data Modeling for optimized performance.
           o Role-based Access Control (RBAC) for data security.
4. Power BI Dashboards (Decision-Making Analytics)
     • Business Executives Dashboard:
           o High-level KPIs, revenue, customer trends.
           o Fraud detection & claim approval analytics.
     • Operational Dashboard for Agents:
           o Live insights on pending claims and new policies.
           o Customer interaction logs from chatbot queries.
     • Technical Stack:
           o Power BI Embedded to integrate dashboards into a web-based business portal.
               
End-to-End Workflow:
1. Chatbot collects data from users (queries, medical reports, policies).
2. Azure AI Search fetches relevant documents (RAG for chatbot).
3. ETL pipelines process data and load it into Data Warehouse.
4. Azure Synapse provides real-time queries on structured data.
5. Power BI visualizes insights for decision-makers.

Ideal Team Requirements:
     • AI/ML Engineer: (Chatbot, RAG, OpenAI, NLP).
     • Data Engineer: (ETL, SQL, Azure Synapse, Power BI).
     • Full-Stack Developer: (API & Frontend for chatbot & dashboards).
     • DevOps Specialist: (Cloud deployment, security).
skills: ['Data Visualization', 'SQL', 'Business Intelligence', 'Data Analysis', 'Microsoft Power BI', 'Neo4j', 'Artificial Intelligence', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Geospatial analysis and visualization, part one of a long-term engagement
description:
This is the first part of a much bigger project that will eventually grow to include significant geospatial analysis and web scraping, data exploration, processing and analysis, creating interactive visualizations and dashboards, running advanced regression/ML algorithms, and creating AI agents. It will function somewhat as an interview, because I would like this person to stay on for the ongoing engagement.

This project will be used to help us identify real estate investment opportunities and so data accuracy is critical. We need someone who is focused on the impact and quality of the analysis more than we need speed. As such, I would like your estimate of what it costs to complete this, but would prefer to pay by the hour, to improve alignment, and encourage discussion and collaboration between us while you work.

I don’t expect one person to be able to be able to do all of these, but the more coverage one person can provide the better. Relatedly, I’m interested in people who have existing relationships with other developers/data analysts who they can work with to take on more of the project as a team, to the extent needed.

For the initial project, I want to develop a raster map of the United States with each point containing the total population within a 3-mile radius of said point.

I’m open to suggestions for how to approach this, but my initial thinking is as follows:
• Pull population data from the US Census by Census Block (or open to suggestions for better sources)
• Pull Census Block polygons/boundaries, which I assume are also available on the Census website
• Convert population numbers to population densities.
    o The census tracks block areas with and without water areas included. Ideally, you can convert water areas to “zero population” in the raster, and show the remaining points as the population density excluding bodies of water.
    o I’m very much open to suggestions for better ways to estimate population densities.
• With a pixelized map of the population density of the United States, add together the resulting population within three miles of each point.

Again if you see a better way to accomplish this, please let me know!

I will eventually want to take a more advanced approach here to estimating the distributions of populations within Census Block groups, so would like to hear any suggestions you might have on ways to approach this.

As part of this project, I will want a copy of your code and an overview of how it works.

title: Healthcare Financial Analyst Needed – Pro Forma for Anesthesia Hospital Contract
description:
I am looking for an experienced healthcare financial analyst or CPA with expertise in hospital anesthesia contracts to create a pro forma financial model for an anesthesia service agreement that requires a stipend.

The financial data is already compiled; I need assistance in structuring and presenting it in a professional pro forma format that aligns with hospital expectations.

Scope of Work:
Develop a hospital anesthesia pro forma that includes:
Revenue projections (payer mix, case volume, reimbursement)
Expense estimates (staffing, overhead, malpractice, etc.)
Stipend justification and financial gap analysis

Breakeven analysis
Ensure the model is hospital-friendly and structured for presentation to hospital executives.

Provide benchmarking insights (if available) for anesthesia stipend justification.

Deliver the pro forma in Excel and PDF formats, with clear assumptions and justifications.

Ideal Candidate:
Experience creating hospital pro formas, ideally for anesthesia contracts

Strong healthcare financial modeling skills
Familiar with anesthesia reimbursement structures and stipend-based contracts

Proficient in Excel and financial forecasting

Previous work with hospitals or anesthesia groups is preferred

Budget & Timeline:

Please submit your bid with estimated hours required.

Looking for a quick turnaround (preferably within 1-2 weeks).

If you have experience with anesthesia contracts or similar hospital-based financial models, please attach samples of past work or describe your relevant experience.
