title: Market Study and Feasibility Analysis for Contractor Garages & Storage Development
description:
Market Study, Feasibility Analysis, and Marketing Plan for Contractor Garages & Storage Development

Description:
We are seeking an experienced market research analyst or consultant to conduct a comprehensive market study, feasibility analysis, and marketing plan for a contractor garage & storage development project in Chamblee/Brookhaven, GA. The objective is to validate market demand, analyze competition, determine optimal unit pricing, and develop a go-to-market strategy.

Project Scope:
1. Market Study & Competitive Analysis

Assess demand for contractor garages & storage facilities in the target region.
Identify key competitors, their unit sizes, pricing structures, and occupancy rates.
Provide data on market trends, customer demographics, and target industries.
Conduct a detailed breakdown of local competitors, including:
Unit layouts and configurations
Vacancy rates and occupancy trends
Most popular unit sizes by square footage
Pricing per unit and cost per square foot
2. Feasibility Study & Financial Modeling

Evaluate site suitability, zoning considerations, and potential development constraints.
Conduct a cost-benefit analysis for different unit configurations (e.g., 1,000–2,200 sq. ft. units).
Provide an ROI projection, including estimated rental income, breakeven points, and financing recommendations.
3. Marketing & Pre-Leasing Strategy

Develop a pricing and positioning strategy to ensure competitiveness in the market.
Recommend the most effective marketing channels (digital, direct outreach, partnerships, etc.).
Provide guidance on pre-leasing efforts to secure tenant commitments before construction completion.
Ideal Candidate:
Proven experience in real estate market research, feasibility studies, or commercial property development.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret market data and provide actionable insights.
Experience in contractor-focused or industrial storage facilities is a plus.
Ability to deliver a clear, data-driven report with financial projections and marketing recommendations.
Deliverables:
Market study report with competitor analysis & demand trends.
Feasibility study & ROI modeling with financial projections.
Marketing & leasing strategy to maximize tenant acquisition.
Please include examples of past market studies, feasibility reports, or real estate research projects in your proposal.
skills: ['Market Research', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Business Intelligence', 'Financial Analysis', 'Data Analysis', 'Market Analysis', 'Marketing Strategy']

title: Data Analyst/Engineer for petroleum reservoir engineering workflow and asset evaluation
description:
Job Description:

We are a growing oil and gas mineral and royalty company seeking a skilled Data Analyst/Engineer to support our petroleum reservoir engineering workflow and financial analysis needs. We need a sharp, technical professional to streamline our processes, sync information across the organization, perform financial analysis, and help craft quarterly and annual presentations.

Our core tools include ComboCurve for reservoir engineering workflows and Excel for evaluating raw CSV outputs (well-level online cash flows and aggregate projected cash flows). The ideal candidate will combine coding expertise with financial acumen to enhance our deal evaluations, automate workflows, and provide actionable financial insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and organize raw CSV data from ComboCurve (well cash flows, aggregate projections, etc.)
Perform financial analysis on deal flows, including cash flow projections, ROI, and valuation metrics
Automate repetitive tasks in deal evaluation and financial modeling using scripts or tools
Sync and streamline data across the organization for consistency and accessibility
Create data-driven, financially focused quarterly and annual presentations for stakeholders
Collaborate with me (COO) to optimize workflows and refine financial decision-making processes
Professional Skills Required:

Coding: Proficiency in Python, SQL, or Spotfire for data manipulation and automation
Financial Analysis: Expertise in evaluating cash flows, ROI, NPV, IRR, and other financial metrics
Data Analysis: Ability to process large datasets, including CSV files from reservoir outputs
Excel: Advanced skills for financial modeling, data evaluation, and organization
Data Visualization: Capability to create clear, professional visuals highlighting technical and financial insights
Automation: Skill in scripting to streamline repetitive data and financial tasks
Database Management: Basic knowledge of syncing and structuring data across systems
Problem-Solving: Analytical mindset to improve workflows and financial outcomes
Communication: Ability to present technical and financial findings in an executive-friendly format
Bonus Skills (Preferred):

Familiarity with ComboCurve or petroleum reservoir engineering workflows
Experience in oil and gas financial analysis or mineral/royalty valuations
Proficiency with visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau for financial reporting
Who You Are:

A self-starter comfortable working remotely and independently
Able to collaborate with a busy executive to prioritize tasks and deliver results
Passionate about blending data mastery with financial insight to drive efficiency
How to Apply:

Please submit:

A brief cover letter explaining your experience in data analysis and financial modeling
Your resume or a link to your portfolio/LinkedIn
Examples of past work (e.g., scripts, financial models, or presentations) if available
Your hourly rate or preferred compensation structure
Applications must showcase both technical skills (e.g., Python, SQL) and financial analysis experience to be considered. I’m excited to find a talented partner to streamline our data and elevate our financial strategy—let’s get to work!

title: Request non-public business dataset with predictor features for a target metric
description:
I am requesting a dataset for a data analysis project intended for inclusion in my professional portfolio, such as on my resume, LinkedIn, etc.   I require a dataset which has the following characteristics:
1. It has not been published publicly.
2. It is non-confidential.
3. The data originate from a real business.  To protect confidentiality, the dataset can be modified by multiplying each feature by a unique constant, shifting dates by an integral number of years, or changing class labels provided self-consistency is maintained in the dataset.  Ideally the dataset is unaltered.  If you suggest other transformations of the data, please so state in your proposal.
4. The dataset is structured and consists of continuous and categorical features and at least one corresponding target metric, which is of practical interest in business (e.g. customer features and conversion status).
5. At least a few of the features are expected to be significant or important predictors of the target metric.  Ideally, some of the features are known to be significant or important predictors of the target metric.

title: IT Business Analyst for Child Development Screening App
description:
We are looking for an experienced IT Business Analyst to help define requirements for a mobile app focused on early childhood developmental delay detection. The app includes interactive cognitive and motor skill exercises for children, with features like advanced animations, background services, and a parent/teacher dashboard. The analyst should create a detailed technical specification, ensuring scalability and future iOS support.

Responsibilities:

Define the project scope and gather detailed requirements for the app’s core features (cognitive tests, dashboard, gamified UI/UX, animations, security).
Create functional and technical documentation for developers.
Suggest best practices for mobile development (Kotlin, future migration to Flutter/React Native).
Requirements:

Experience in IT Business Analysis for mobile applications.
Strong understanding of Android (Kotlin) and cross-platform technologies (Flutter/React Native).
Knowledge of EdTech, HealthTech, or Child Development applications is a plus.
Ability to create technical documentation and workflows.
Familiarity with visualization tools (e.g., Miro or Visio).

Deliverables:

Technical Specification Document (TSD).
Wireframes/User Flows (optional).
Scalable architecture suggestions and migration strategy.

functional flow:

User Registration/Login: Parents, teachers, and caregivers create accounts or log in securely to access the app.

Dashboard: Once logged in, users access a simple, user-friendly dashboard where they can track the child's progress and see test results.

Interactive Tests: The app offers a range of interactive tests for cognitive skills, including color perception, motor skills, dyslexia, dyscalculia, and more. Children engage with these tests in a gamified manner, making them fun and easy to use.

Test Results: After completing tests, users (parents/teachers) can view the results, with detailed feedback and analysis.

Security Measures: Data is encrypted, and user authentication ensures privacy and security.

Background Services: The app continuously monitors and stores test progress and results in the background, syncing in real-time.

Advanced Animations: Engaging animations make the tests more enjoyable for children and visually track progress.

title: django developer for GA4 and GSC Data Integration
description:
We are seeking a skilled django developer with proven experience in extracting data from Google Analytics (GA4) and Google Search Console using Python and seamlessly loading it into SQL databases. The ideal candidate should be proficient in implementing OAuth 2.0 authorization processes to securely access user data. You will play a critical role in enabling efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, empowering our data-driven decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:
1.Data Extraction and Integration:
- Develop and maintain Python scripts to extract data from Google Analytics (GA4 preferred) using Google Analytics APIs.
- Extract and process data from Google Search Console APIs for website performance insights.
- Load the extracted data into SQL tables, ensuring data integrity and consistency.
- Build ETL pipelines to automate data fetching and storage processes.
2.Authorization and Security:
- Implement OAuth 2.0 authorization to securely access user data from Google Analytics.
- Handle access tokens and refresh tokens for continuous and secure data fetching.
- Ensure the application complies with security and data privacy standards.
3.Data Transformation and Analysis:
- Process and structure raw Google Analytics data for analysis and reporting.
- Collaborate with data analysts and stakeholders to deliver actionable insights.
4.Optimization and Maintenance:
- Monitor data extraction and loading processes for performance and reliability.
- Troubleshoot and debug API integration and SQL queries as needed.
- Maintain detailed documentation for developed solutions and workflows.

Required Skills and Experience:
- Strong proficiency in Python, with hands-on experience using libraries like google-auth, google-analytics-data, google-searchconsole and requests.
- In-depth knowledge of Google Analytics APIs, specifically for GA4.
- Comprehensive understanding of OAuth 2.0 authorization workflows.
- Experience with Google Search Console APIs for extracting website performance data.
- Experience handling access tokens, refresh tokens, and secure storage mechanisms.
- Experience building ETL pipelines for large-scale data processing.
- Familiarity with database systems such as Azure SQL Server.
- Strong troubleshooting skills for debugging API integrations and SQL-related issues.
- Ability to document processes and create user guides for implemented solutions.
- Team-oriented with the ability to work independently when needed.

Preferred Qualifications:

title: Head of Growth | Strategic Revenue & Acquisition Leader
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE:
We’re seeking a dynamic Head of Growth to drive revenue by optimizing customer acquisition, retention, and expansion. Your mission is to identify, scale, and leverage high-impact growth opportunities, fostering a culture of experimentation and results-driven innovation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Own and optimize both paid and organic acquisition channels (Meta, Google, SEO, partnerships).
2. Lead Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) initiatives across key customer touchpoints.
3. Implement and scale CAC-efficient acquisition strategies.
4. Increase customer Lifetime Value (LTV) through targeted email, SMS, loyalty, and repeat purchase campaigns.
5. Develop and execute retention strategies to boost repeat purchases and optimize post-purchase experiences.
6. Lead continuous A/B and multivariate testing across ad creatives, landing pages, and product positioning.
7. Drive incremental revenue growth through innovative experiments.
8. Collaborate cross-functionally to test and implement new acquisition and engagement strategies.
9. Own and manage growth KPIs, ensuring accurate reporting and actionable insights.
10. Partner with data teams to forecast growth impact and optimize budget allocation.
11. Establish and refine attribution models and comprehensive reporting systems.
12. Manage, coach, and build a high-performance team of growth marketers, media buyers, email marketers, and data analysts.
13. Cultivate a results-driven culture focused on continuous growth and innovation.

QUALIFICATIONS FOR SUCCESS:
1. Proven track record driving significant growth in customer acquisition, retention, and revenue.
2. Expertise managing and scaling performance marketing channels effectively.
3. Strong background in CRO, A/B testing, and growth experimentation.
4. Exceptional analytical skills, capable of turning data insights into strategic decisions.
5. Experience leading and developing high-performance growth teams.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE IS:
1. Decisive: Makes swift, data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment.
2. Reliable: Consistently delivers sustainable growth while balancing efficiency.
3. Adaptable: Quickly pivots strategies based on real-time insights and market changes.
4. Engaged: Passionate about fostering a culture of continuous improvement and experimentation.

KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs):
Maintain Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) at or below target thresholds.
Achieve blended ROAS targets.
Increase Landing Page Conversion Rate (CVR) by 15%+ YoY.
Grow Customer Lifetime Value (LTV) by 20%+ YoY.
Improve customer retention rate (repeat purchases) by 10% YoY.
Drive new customer revenue growth by 30% YoY.
Ensure a growth experimentation win rate of 25% or higher.

COMPENSATION:
- Competitive compensation based on experience.

- Performance-based incentives linked to growth outcomes.

- Clear pathway for professional development and team expansion opportunities.


Apply today and lead our strategic growth initiatives, shaping our future success!

title: PowerBI Designer
description:
Job Title: Power BI Designer (Mid-Level)
Location: Remote
Job Type: Full-time / Contract


Job Summary
We are seeking a talented Power BI Designer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data visualisation, dashboard design, and Power BI development to support business intelligence initiatives. This role requires a balance of technical skills, analytical thinking, and creativity to deliver impactful reports and dashboards for data-driven decision-making.


Key Responsibilities
- Design and develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to provide business insights.
- Work with stakeholders to understand reporting needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
- Optimize data models and DAX calculations to improve performance and efficiency.
- Implement best practices for data visualization to ensure clear, actionable insights.

- Ensure data security and governance policies are adhered to within Power BI service.
- Provide training and documentation for end-users to effectively use dashboards and reports.
- Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to enhance reporting capabilities.

Knows how DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) works.
- Experience working with SQL databases, writing queries, and optimising data models.
- Understanding of ETL processes and data modeling techniques.
- Familiarity with Microsoft ecosystem (Azure, Excel, SharePoint, Power Automate, Project Online).
- Experience designing user-friendly and visually compelling reports.
- Ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.


Preferred Qualifications
- Experience with Power Automate & Power Apps for workflow automation.
- Familiarity with Agile or Scrum methodologies for BI development.
- Exposure to Python or R for data analysis (optional but beneficial).


Certifications (Preferred but Not Mandatory)

title: Senior Data and Reporting Analyst
description:
FULL TIME ROLE
About Fundo Loans
At Fundo Loans, we are the top fastest growing companies in all of Australia, for the last 3 years in a row. We offer innovative and flexible lending solutions to support individuals across Australia. We’re driven by data, technology, and a passion for helping our customers achieve their financial goals. As we grow, we are looking for talented professionals to join our team and contribute to our mission of delivering smarter financial services.

Job Summary
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data and Reporting Analyst to join our
team. This role will focus on leveraging data to enhance decision-making, streamline
operations, and ensure compliance with regulatory standards. You will be responsible for
managing and optimizing reporting frameworks, developing loan performance and payment reports, and providing
actionable insights to drive business growth.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and automated reports to monitor loan
portfolio performance, key lending metrics, repayment trends, and customer
behaviours.
• Collect, clean, and analyze data from internal and external sources to support business
objectives and regulatory compliance.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve loan approval processes, reduce
default rates, and enhance customer retention strategies.
• Perform credit risk analysis to assist in the development and refinement of lending
models and criteria.
• Design and implement data collection and cleansing processes to ensure data accuracy
and reliability.
• Ensure data accuracy and integrity through robust validation and quality assurance
processes.
• Provide actionable insights and recommendations to support strategic initiatives, such
as customer acquisition, retention, and risk mitigation.
• Create ad-hoc reports to support executive decision-making and respond to
compliance or audit inquiries.
• Use statistical methods and machine learning techniques to forecast loan performance
and detect potential risks.

• Support compliance efforts by ensuring data-driven practices align with Australian
regulatory requirements.

Key Qualifications
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Information Systems,
Finance, or a related field.


• Experience:
o 3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in lending or
financial services.


• Technical Skills:
o Proficiency in Python, R and SQL for advanced data analysis and ETL
processes.
o Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
o Advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables, macros, and advanced formulas.
o Knowledge of data management and reporting tools.
• Domain Knowledge: Familiarity with lending operations, loan performance metrics,
and Australian financial regulations.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication skills to present data insights effectively to both technical
and non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications
• Advanced degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Finance).
• Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure).
• Knowledge of Python or R for advanced data analysis for ETL processes and tools.
• Knowledge of Australian financial regulations, including responsible lending
guidelines and compliance requirements.

Join Us
At Fundo Loans Pty Ltd, we’re not just lending—we’re shaping the future of financial
services in Australia. Be part of our journey to empower individuals with smarter, data-driven solutions. We focus on innovation, compliance, and data-driven growth while coming up with strategic initiatives.

title: Immediate Start: Power BI Data Engineer & Project Manager
description:
Startup Mode | Build Fast, Iterate, and Deliver an MVP in Real-Time Strategy Intelligence

I am building a power BI dashboard and reports that draws on market data + academic journals to synthesise themes and predict trends.

The reports are on both market and behavioural intelligence.

I’m looking for a Power BI Data Engineer & Project Manager who’s ready to own the build of a new Power BI Analytics reporting system, as well as take on the project management side of things which includes to recruit the team, and execute fast. This is a startup-style project, and we’re building a working MVP in one week—so you’ll be making both technical and strategic decisions as we go.

You’ll be responsible for:
✅ Building the data infrastructure—pulling in peer-reviewed research & market intelligence and structuring it for analysis.
✅ Recruiting & onboarding team members—hiring a Data Scientist, Power BI Developer, and Intelligence Analyst from Upwork to help you with the build and managing their hour allocations.
✅ Overseeing project execution—allocating tasks, solving problems, and ensuring everything moves efficiently toward delivery.

⏳ Time Frame: 7 Days | Working MVP to onboard first test users
📌 Deliverables: Structured datasets, ML-ready models, Power BI dashboards, and executive-ready PDF reports.
📊 Possible Tools & Tech: SQL, Python (Pandas, BeautifulSoup, API requests), Power BI, Cloud Storage (AWS).

You will be managing the build, bringing in other expertise where needed.

There is an expectation you won't complete this alone and will instead be comfortable recruiting and instructing team members.

🔹 Your Role: What You’ll Be Doing
💡 Day 1-2: Infrastructure Setup & Team Hiring
✔ Set up SQL storage & data pipelines for structured storage.
✔ Connect APIs for peer-reviewed research & market data sources.
✔ Post job ads & recruit Data Scientist, Power BI Developer, and Intelligence Analyst.
✔ Onboard team members and allocate their 32-hour blocks effectively.

💡 Day 3-4: Data Structuring & Initial Processing
✔ Work with the Data Scientist to structure peer-reviewed & market data.
✔ Ensure data is clean, validated, and ready for Power BI integration.
✔ Unblock dependencies so team members can work in parallel.

💡 Day 5-6: Refinement, QA & Power BI Integration
✔ Conduct QA on structured data and validate ML model inputs.
✔ Support the Power BI Developer with data integration & visualization setup.
✔ Ensure data models are accurate, scalable, and business-ready.

💡 Day 7: Final Review & Delivery
✔ Validate final datasets, dashboards, and ML outputs.
✔ Ensure Power BI dashboards are fully functional & executive-ready.
✔ Oversee final report integration with the Intelligence Analyst.
✔ Prepare for user testing & next iteration planning.

🔹 What You’ll Need
✔ Experience in Data Engineering & Project Management → You’re comfortable working across technical execution & team management.
✔ Power BI & SQL Expertise → You can structure data for real-time dashboards.
✔ Python (Pandas, BeautifulSoup, API requests) → For data collection & cleaning.
✔ Upwork Hiring & Team Onboarding → You’ll recruit & manage the 3 core team members (Data Scientist, Power BI Developer, Intelligence Analyst).
✔ Agile Mindset → This is an MVP, so you can move fast, iterate, and adapt based on feedback.

🔹 Why Join?
🔥 Build something real, fast.
🚀 You’ll run the entire execution & MVP launch.
💡 Direct impact—your work powers strategic decision-making tools for real users.
⚡ No bureaucracy, no fluff—just getting it done.

If you thrive in startup-style execution, love both data & strategy, and want to ship a working product in a week, let’s go. 🚀

title: Review of paper for Electrochemistry
description:
I have one paper that need to submitted soon. This paper is about electrochemical sensor that detects nitrate, phosphate, and potassum. We have also developed soil battery and low power electroncs.
The energy generated from the soil battery, powers the low power electroncis and this low power electroncis reads the data from the electrochemcial sensor. The senor and the electrocnis is
optimized such a way that it has the capability to correct the sensor drift due to temperature variance.

I need constructive review feedback to improve the mansucript quality. The target is to publish paper 1) ACS Environmental Science & Technology /ACS Electrochemistry (First priority)
2) ACS Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry (Second priority)
3) IEEE transactions on agrifood and electronics (last option)
The supplementary do not have much important data, so you might not need it for judging of this paper.
I need someone who has good experience in electrochemistry background having proven publication track record in top electrochemistry journal such as Electrochemica acta, Sensors and Actuators B
Biosensor and bioelectronics, ACS analytical Chemistry, Applied Materials and Interfaces RSC Analyst/Advance, LOC, ECS journals, (ACS, RSC, and advanced family journals)
Deliverables :
Constructive feedback so that if the feed back is taken to improve the paper, even a very harsh reviewer (who is willing to reject most of the paper) will very much likely to accept this paper.
Also, if you suggest any experiment in the feedback , please give reference to some article who has done this so that I can do it on my end.

title: Marketing Research Analyst - Mobile Fuel Delivery
description:
We are seeking an experienced and resourceful Market Research Analyst to lead an in-depth study into the diesel mobile fuel delivery market in Australia. This research will focus on understanding customer fuel preferences, analyzing competitor strategies, and assessing regulatory and operational frameworks. Your work will inform our strategic plan for entering and differentiating our diesel fleet fueling service, particularly for government and commercial fleets.

Key Responsibilities:

Market Analysis:

Conduct detailed research on the Australian mobile fuel delivery market, with an emphasis on diesel fueling for fleet and government vehicles.

Identify and segment key customer groups (e.g., government fleets, public transport, commercial fleets) and quantify market size and growth potential.

Competitive Analysis:

Analyze existing competitors in Australia, including service models, pricing strategies, technological solutions, and market positioning.

Benchmark global models (e.g., Booster Fuels, EZFill) and identify gaps/opportunities for a differentiated diesel service in Australia.

Regulatory & Stakeholder Engagement:

Research and map relevant Australian regulations (e.g., AS1940, AS2809, local zoning laws) that impact mobile fuel delivery operations.

Contact and interview relevant government agencies (e.g., SafeWork NSW, Environmental Protection Agencies) and industry bodies to understand regulatory challenges and potential approval pathways.

Reach out to fleet operators, government departments, and private companies to gather insights on their current fueling practices, pain points, and requirements.

Reporting & Recommendations:

Synthesize research findings into comprehensive reports with actionable insights and strategic recommendations.

Develop a detailed market entry plan, including pilot program design and potential technology integrations (such as AI-driven compliance and tracking systems).

Required Qualifications & Skills:

Proven experience in market research, preferably within the fuel, energy, or transportation sectors.

Strong knowledge of the Australian regulatory environment, particularly regarding fuel storage, transportation, and environmental compliance.

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to conduct interviews, negotiate access to data, and build relationships with government agencies and industry stakeholders.

Demonstrated analytical skills and proficiency in synthesizing complex information into clear, actionable insights.

Ability to work independently and manage project timelines effectively.

title: Create a financial tear sheet for investor to acquire staffing business.
description:
Job Title: Tear Sheet Creator for Staffing Firm Acquisition

Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced financial analyst or investment writer to create a tear sheet for our staffing firm acquisition. The tear sheet will be used to present key financials, market positioning, and investment potential to potential financiers.

Responsibilities:
• Compile and structure a one-page tear sheet that highlights the financials, business model, and growth potential of the staffing firm.
• Format data into a professional and visually appealing layout for investors.
• Extract key financial insights, EBITDA, margins, and growth trends from the provided financials.
• Include a brief market overview, key differentiators, and competitive positioning.
• Ensure that the document is clear, concise, and compelling for investment purposes.

Requirements:

* Experience in investment analysis, finance, or business acquisitions.

title: Data Analyst – Customer Analytics
description:
About the Role
We are looking for an Intermediate Data Analyst – Customer Analytics to join our analytics team. This role is highly technical, requiring expertise in SQL, data modeling, and visualization tools to build robust data infrastructure and reporting solutions. The ideal candidate is comfortable working with large-scale datasets, optimizing data pipelines, and ensuring high-quality data for customer and revenue analytics.
Key Responsibilities
Write, optimize, and maintain SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze large datasets efficiently.
Develop and maintain data models that support customer segmentation, revenue tracking, and GTM analytics.
Design, build, and optimize dashboards and reports using Looker and Apache Superset to provide scalable insights. Tableau or PowerBI experience is a plus.

Implement data validation processes to ensure accuracy, consistency, and timeliness of reporting.
Support data transformations using DBT and Redshift to enhance analytics capabilities.
Maintain and optimize data pipelines, ensuring smooth data flow between different sources and reporting tools.

Qualifications & Skills
2-4 years of experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role.

Experience with data modeling and structuring datasets for efficient querying and reporting.

Strong proficiency with Google Sheets, including advanced formulas and data visualization. Proficiency with Excel is a plus, but experience and advanced knowledge of Google Sheets is preferred.
Exposure to DBT for data transformations and ETL pipeline optimization is a plus.
Experience handling large-scale datasets, ensuring efficiency and performance tuning.
Experience working with CRM platform data such as Salesforce or HubSpot is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on data accuracy, governance, and high-quality standards.

title: Financial Analyst Needed to Identify Discrepancies in Line of Credit
description:
About Us:
We are a small business that has been operating for four years. Recently, we underwent a partnership change, and we are now focused on ensuring financial transparency and accuracy in our operations. We are looking for a detail-oriented professional to help us reconcile our financial records and identify discrepancies in our line of credit (LOC).

The Problem:
After a recent review, we discovered that $40,000 is missing from the available credit in our LOC. We need help tracing and reconciling every order to ensure that vendor costs and accrued interest are properly reimbursed into the LOC. Our workflow involves paying vendors via bill.com (linked to the LOC) within 30 days, while customers take up to 90 days to pay. Once customers pay, we transfer only the vendor cost and accrued interest back into the LOC.

Key Responsibilities:

Review and reconcile all orders to ensure vendor costs and interest are accurately reimbursed into the LOC.

Trace transactions to identify where the $40,000 discrepancy originated.

Work with our accounting system (bill.com) and bank statements to match payments and transfers.

Provide a clear report of findings and recommendations to prevent future discrepancies.

Collaborate with the team to streamline the workflow and improve financial tracking.

Requirements:

This is a unique opportunity for a talented individual to play a key role in bringing our high-level vision to life, under my guidance and direction.

Key Responsibilities:
Drafting the Commercial Components of the PPM: Work closely with me to develop the PPM’s sections focused on the fund’s commercial strategy, including the investment thesis, target returns, fee structures, and risk factors. We have a template in place as a starting point.
Fundraising Marketing Materials: Create compelling marketing presentations and materials to support the fundraising process. This includes investor pitch decks, executive summaries, and other related content.
Financial Analysis & Projections: Conduct detailed financial modeling, including projections for fund performance, cash flow analysis, and ROI estimates.
Fund Strategy Development: Assist in outlining the fund’s strategy, investment criteria, and risk management approach. Ensure alignment with the overall goals and vision of the fund.
Collaboration: Work closely with me, bringing high-level concepts and strategies to life while ensuring all work is aligned with the fund’s objectives.

Familiarity with investor relations and fundraising strategies.
Experience with financial software or tools such as Excel, Google Sheets, and other modeling tools.
Having an MBA is a strong plus

Project Scope and Timeline:

Compensation:

Company Overview:
We are a healthtech company developing virtual specialty physician services and seeking a consultant to help define our pricing strategy. We aim to balance market competitiveness, payer reimbursement potential, and patient affordability while ensuring sustainable revenue growth.

Role Overview:
We are looking for a Healthcare Pricing Consultant with expertise in telehealth, reimbursement models, and digital health economics to develop a data-driven pricing strategy for our virtual specialty physician services. This is a part-time, hourly consulting role with flexible hours.

title: Marketing Analyst
description:
Love diving into data to uncover insights that drive marketing success? We’re looking for a Marketing Analyst to track performance, optimize campaigns, and manage our presence on SpareFoot—all while working remotely!

About the Company:

This role is with a leading self-storage company that provides secure and convenient storage solutions across multiple locations. Focused on customer satisfaction and operational excellence, the company leverages technology and data-driven strategies to optimize storage management and enhance the customer experience.

Your Mission: Day to Day Responsibilities

Data & Analytics – Collect, analyze, and ensure accuracy in marketing data from Google Analytics, CRM systems, Google Ads, and SpareFoot.
Performance Tracking – Monitor key KPIs like CTR, CPC, conversion rates, and ROI. Optimize Google Ads and oversee SpareFoot rankings daily.
SpareFoot Management – Maintain and optimize facility listings, improve rankings, and collaborate with revenue teams for pricing adjustments.
Reporting & Insights – Create reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate insights and improve strategy.
Strategic Decision-Making – Identify trends, analyze consumer behavior, and recommend budget allocations.
Collaboration & Testing – Work with marketing, revenue, and data teams. Run A/B tests on campaigns and landing pages.
Tool Management – Optimize analytics tools (Google Analytics, Tableau, Power BI). Ensure proper tracking with Google Tag Manager.
Forecasting & Budgeting – Support forecasting models and campaign budget planning based on past performance.

Your Toolbox: Skills to be Successful

2+ years in marketing analytics, digital marketing, or a related role
Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Ads & data visualization tools
Advanced Excel (pivot tables, v-lookups) & experience with SQL/Python (a plus)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and ability to translate data into insights
Detail-oriented, results-driven, and able to manage multiple projects
High-speed internet and a dedicated home office setup are required
Must be available 9 AM-5 PM CST

Your Perks: What's in it for you

Working completely remote
Location independence
15 Paid leave days
Quarterly bonus
Yearly salary increase policy
Long-term position with the opportunity to grow in a stable and growing Agency
Great opportunity to grow
You’ll be joining a high-level and fast-paced team

Why Adaptive Teams?
At Adaptive Teams, we don’t just fill positions – we create pathways to success. Whether you’re a seasoned pro or just starting out, we’re here to help you grow, innovate, and make an impact. If you’re looking for exciting opportunities and, a team that’s as passionate as you are, this is the place to be.

If this sounds interesting to you please proceed with your application and provide the answers to the questions below.
1. How many years of experience do you have analyzing marketing data (Google Analytics, CRM, ad performance, etc.)?
2. Which of the following tools have you used extensively? (Google Analytics, Google Ads, Tableau, Power BI, SQL, Python, Google Tag Manager)
3. Have you managed Google Ads or similar paid advertising campaigns?
4. Are you available to work within US hours?
5. What is your expected monthly salary for a full-time role, in USD?
6. What's your country of residence?
skills: ['Marketing Analytics', 'Influencer Marketing', 'Email Marketing', 'Social Media Marketing', 'TikTok', 'Digital Marketing', 'Marketing Strategy']

Vizio AI is a fast-growing tech company specializing in Data Analytics, AI-Powered Automation, and Web Development. We help businesses make smarter decisions by leveraging data-driven insights and interactive dashboards.

📩 How to Apply?

title: AI Auditor – AI Risk, Bias & Security Compliance
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled AI Auditor to join our team on a project-by-project basis. You will be responsible for conducting AI risk and bias assessments, evaluating algorithmic fairness, and ensuring AI models align with compliance frameworks.

Your insights will be invaluable in ensuring our client's AI solutions are effective, ethical, and aligned with best practices. If you have experience in compliance and auditing within AI, we want to hear from you!

Our business model focuses on helping businesses and government agencies ensure their AI systems are fair, secure, and compliant with global AI regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR, ISO 42001, etc.). We also aim to contribute to the emerging areas of AI Policy/Regulatory Development.

Job Responsibilities
-AI Model Auditing – Evaluate AI algorithms for bias, fairness, and transparency
-Risk & Impact Assessments – Assess AI security vulnerabilities and ethical risks
-Algorithmic Accountability – Ensure AI systems follow regulatory & ethical standards
-Bias & Fairness Detection – Apply testing methodologies to identify discrimination in AI outputs
-AI Governance & Explainability – Ensure AI models meet explainability & accountability guidelines
-Technical & Compliance Documentation – Prepare audit reports with findings and

Background: AI engineers, machine learning specialists, data scientists, or cybersecurity analysts
-Expertise in AI Auditing: Experience with AI bias detection, algorithm explainability, and model validation
-Familiarity with AI Regulatory Frameworks: Knowledge of ISO 42001, NIST AI Risk Management Framework, GDPR, and EU AI Act
-Tools & Techniques: Proficient in AI auditing tools (Fairlearn, AI Fairness 360, SHAP, LIME, etc.)
-Compliance Mindset: Strong understanding of AI governance, security risks, and ethical considerations

Preferred Qualifications
-Experience auditing AI models in regulated industries (finance, healthcare, government, etc.)
-Previous work with AI risk assessments or compliance audits
-Familiarity with global AI policies & standards
-Ability to translate AI audit findings into business recommendations

Compensation & Engagement Terms
✔ Project-based work – Payment structured upon client engagement

title: Top Social Media Firm Seeks Full-Time, Remote Account Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly ambitious A+ full-time Account Manager to join our team who will be responsible for providing an exceptional client experience through close collaboration with some of the largest creators on social media and leading multiple teams to produce the highest level of output and results for each of our clients.

This is a DREAM job for any high-performing Account Manager due to the massive growth opportunity and innovative service changing the landscape of social media strategy that has generated billions of views for many of the top creators and brands on socials.We are also one of the few companies offering a revenue share in each client you manage, creating uncapped earning potential based on great performance.

Media Scaling works with large brands and creators, guaranteeing up to 1 billion real, organic views on social media in just 180 days. As a company, we have generated over 5 billion organic views on social media, posted more than 250,000 times across platforms, and gained over 24 million followers and subscribers for our clients.

Our company’s Core Values are Greatness, Integrity, and Creativity. The company's mission is to work with the world’s top experts and entertainers. We have the belief we are the best in the world at what we do. If you have unshakable determination, unrelenting ambition, and a standard of nothing less than greatness, you will be a perfect fit with the Media Scaling culture.

Responsibilities:

Provide an exceptional experience to each of our clients, being their primary point of contact on behalf of the company
Own each of your client team's output and results: Take ownership of each team's performance and ensure that goals and targets are not only met, but exceeded.
Uphold the branding of each client: Having a deep understanding of brand to make sure we match and strengthen each client’s brand through the thousands of posts we create each month per client, consistently attracting more of their ideal audience and customers.
Embody the Media Scaling core values: Live out the core values and reinforce them to each of your teams to consistently produce exceptional results.
Lead Team Growth Calls: Conduct growth calls with each client team under your management to discuss growth strategies, provide updates, and maintain a trajectory to exceeding targets with each client.
Provide ongoing and comprehensive reporting updates: Prepare and share progress and results-driven reports to each client and Media Scaling’s upper management on a daily basis.
Conduct 1-on-1 calls with each of your direct reports on a monthly basis for stronger team building and top-level results.
Ensure all internal systems are up to date: Monitor and ensure that all scheduling tools are updated, with content planned at least three days in advance.
Willingness to have hard conversations: We care deeply for every member of our team, each client’s experience, and the overall unmatched success of the company, and must have hard conversations when necessary to ensure every member of our team is meeting our standard of greatness.
Identify leverage: Identify high-leverage, low-hanging fruit initiatives that can produce large, incremental improvements in systems and results. We are looking for innovators who will come in and spot value to make our company better.
Work closely with editors, social media managers, copywriters, designers, data analysts, and more to make sure each of our client’s teams are performing at the highest level.
Improve conversion strategies for each client: Have a deep understanding of marketing and conversation from top to bottom of funnel, helping each client to drive more leads and sales for their brand and businesses.
Own the data: Be extremely data-driven, consistently looking at our internal tracking systems and insights across all social accounts, making sure they are up-to-date, and identifying value opportunities for increased performance.
Be organized with Notion task & project management: Be skilled when it comes to time, task, and project management, using tools such as Notion and your calendar to plan & prioritize for optimum efficiency.

Requirements:

Previous account manager experience for an agency or online service provider communicating with and leading high-net-worth clientele
Conversion-driven marketing experience to drive more leads and sales through social media
Strong understanding of brand strategy, content strategy, and social media platforms
Excellent communication and social skills
Exceptional organizational and time management abilities
A keen eye for design
Analytical mindset
Creative thinking and abilities
Strong attention to detail
Proficiency in project management tools and platforms.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Ability to inspire others through strong values, a lifelong commitment to rapid growth, and the ambition to be the best.
Around-the-clock communicator

title: Power BI / Fabric/ MS SQL/ Lakehouse / Azure Data Scientist or Analyst Needed
description:
We are an analytics company in the legaltech space. We've worked with a front end analytics developer to develop a number of very sophisticated reports in Power BI. He has also developed our data models in PowerBi, permissions, lakehouses, Fabric instances, and integrated PowerBI with an MSSQL data warehouse. Some of the visuals are written in Python and embedded in PowerBI. All of this gets embedded in web pages and our CTO has developed JS scripts to interact with the visuals and reports.

So the setup is complex. He's overbooked and no longer can meet the demands of our sprints. We need someone who can quickly review the codebase, structure and setup and get into a sprint cadence of 3-4 weeks. One of the critical issues we are facing is the way he set it up, all of the data models and visuals are under his personal user account as a superadmin. The very first task is to restructure the accounts and system so that there is a shared permissions structure at an enterprise level - so that multiple admins and moderators can have permissions to change the data models, visuals, reports, etc., without triggering any security freezes.  

There are also performance issues so we can use help improving the performance of the reports, which are fairly slow.

If you have the expertise to quickly learn the structure by reviewing the models, measures, python code, permissions, etc, and you have the bandwidhth, interest and passion for a very excited, groundbreaking project, please apply. We would start late Feb/ early March.

Ideally you will work along side him and we'll have him stay on and help with front end stuff and knowledge transfer. Or it's possible you will have to go it alone with very little information if he can't commit to tighter deadlines. We need someone who is super adept and confident to work in either scenario.
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Data Analysis', 'Microsoft Power BI', 'IBM SPSS', 'Neo4j', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Econometrics Small Case Study (Assignment) – Undergraduate Level (R & Data Analysis)
description:
I am looking for an experienced econometrics tutor or data analyst to solve and answer a case study for an introductory econometrics course at the undergraduate level. The case study involves quantitative analysis, regression modeling, hypothesis testing, and data interpretation using R.

The case study is focused on explaining firm profitability using a dataset extracted from Compustat, containing financial data of U.S. non-financial companies. You will be required to conduct statistical analysis, create visualizations, and provide detailed answers to the questions outlined in the case study.

Scope of Work:
- Compute summary statistics for key financial variables.
Perform correlation analysis and visualize relationships between variables.
- Conduct univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis (OLS).
- Test hypotheses using statistical significance tests (including one-sided tests).
- Examine industry effects by incorporating dummy variables into regression models.
- Implement binary response models (LPM & Logit) to analyze dividend payments.
- Provide interpretable and well-structured answers to each question, including regression equations, interpretations of coefficients, and discussion of model fit.
- Deliver a well-documented R script that produces the required outputs.

Requirements:
- Background in econometrics, statistics, and data analysis.
- Proficiency in R programming (packages such as lmtest, sandwich, ggplot2, margins, stargazer, etc.).
Experience with regression modeling, hypothesis testing, and data visualization.
- Ability to explain results in a clear, structured, and academic manner.
- Familiarity with heteroskedasticity correction and other regression assumptions.

Deliverables:
1. Written Report (PDF): Well-structured responses to all case study questions, including tables and figures.
2. R Script (Commented): Fully reproducible code that generates all results and visualizations.
Deadline:
The final submission is due on February 24, 2025, 13:00 (Amsterdam time), so I require the completed work by February 24, 2025, to allow for any revisions.
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Quantitative Analysis', 'Data Analysis', 'IBM SPSS', 'Neo4j', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Amplitude Expert – Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Martech Stack Leader)
description:

If you’re a data engineering powerhouse with a deep understanding of Amplitude, growth analytics, and martech integrations, this is your chance to own the full implementation and evolution of our martech stack.

• Integrate Amplitude with our growth stack (CRM, attribution tools, automation platforms, etc.).

• Define and enforce best practices for data governance, instrumentation, and experimentation.

Why Join Us?

title: XML Conversion Expert
description:
Contractor Role: Less than 30 hours per week
Remote Work
5 days a week

Job Summary:
The XML Conversion Analyst is responsible for analyzing, converting, and validating structured and unstructured data into XML formats. This role involves transforming various file types (such as Word, PDF, and HTML) into XML using industry standards like NISO JATS, DITA, TEI, LegalDocML, or other relevant schemas. The ideal candidate should have experience in XML transformation, scripting, and automation for efficient data processing.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Conversion & Transformation:
Convert legacy documents (Word, PDF, TXT, HTML, etc.) into XML using XSLT, XQuery, or other transformation tools.
Implement XML tagging, validation, and schema compliance for various content formats.

XML Schema Management:
Work with DTD, XSD, Schematron, and other schema definitions to ensure data integrity.
Validate XML against schemas and troubleshoot errors.

Automation & Scripting:
Develop scripts and automation workflows for large-scale XML conversion.
Use technologies like XSLT, XPath, Python, Java, VBA, or PowerShell to streamline the conversion process.

Quality Assurance & Validation:
Perform QA checks, debugging, and validation to ensure XML outputs meet industry standards.
Review and correct structural and logical inconsistencies in converted XML files.

Collaboration & Documentation:
Collaborate with IT teams, content managers, and developers to improve XML workflows.
Document processes, best practices, and troubleshooting guidelines for XML conversion.

Industry Standards & Compliance:
Ensure adherence to JATS, DITA, DocBook, LegalDocML, DITA OT Toolkit or other XML-based standards.
Stay updated with emerging trends in structured document workflows and XML publishing.
skills: ['DITA OT Toolkit', 'Automation', 'JavaScript', 'Zoho Creator', 'Conversion to XML', 'API', 'Make.com', 'PHP', 'Python']

title: Financial Projection Expert Needed for 360Me Investment Round
description:
About Us

360Me is an AI-driven health optimization platform that personalizes nutrition, activity, and wellness insights through wearable devices and adaptive AI. Our system integrates real-time biometric data to deliver tailored health recommendations across nutrition, stress management, physical activity, and data security. As we prepare for our next investment round, we need a strong financial model to support our growth strategy.

Project Scope

We seek an experienced financial analyst or consultant to develop a comprehensive financial projection for 360Me’s fundraising efforts. The scope includes:

Financial Modeling
Revenue projections based on multiple business models
Cost structure analysis (fixed, variable, and operational costs)
Cash flow forecasting for the next 3-5 years
Profit & Loss (P&L) statements and Balance Sheet projections

Investment Scenario Planning
Multiple funding scenarios with expected investor ROI
Dilution and equity impact modeling

Market & Competitive Analysis (Financial Impact)
Benchmark key financial metrics
Validate key assumptions with market data

Investor-Ready Financial Deck Support
Convert projections into investor-friendly presentations
Provide insights to enhance fundraising narratives

Ideal Candidate
Proven experience in financial modeling and investment fundraising
Strong knowledge of startup financials, SaaS metrics, and growth projections
Experience working with VCs, angel investors, or private equity
Expertise in Excel, Google Sheets, and financial forecasting tools
Ability to deliver clear, well-structured financial reports

Deliverables
Full financial projection model (Excel/Google Sheets)
Key financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)
Scenario analysis (base, optimistic, and conservative)
Summary report and investor-friendly financial slides

How to Apply
Share relevant past projects or portfolio samples
Describe your approach to financial projections for startups
Provide your estimated timeline and pricing

If you’re a financial expert who can help us secure investment with a strong financial projection, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Non Organic Download Analytics
description:
We are seeking an experienced Analytics Specialist to drive insights from non-organic download campaigns. In this role, you will be responsible for tracking and analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) related to our marketing efforts, specifically from external video content (e.g., TikTok). The ideal candidate will work closely with our development team to ensure accurate data integration and reporting, leveraging existing tools like Adjust, Mixpanel, and AppsFlyer.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- **Campaign Tracking & Analysis:**  
  - Monitor and analyze non-organic download data originating from video content (e.g., TikTok campaigns).
  - Track metrics such as downloads, activations, active subscribers, and revenue generated from each video campaign (e.g., Video A).

- **Collaboration with Development Team:**  
  - Work alongside our development team to ensure proper integration of tracking solutions.
  - Provide technical guidance on leveraging existing analytics tools (Adjust, Mixpanel, AppsFlyer) to capture relevant data.

- **Data Integration & Reporting:**  
  - Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide insights into campaign performance.
  - Identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization based on data analysis.
  
- **Tool Management & Optimization:**  
  - Leverage and optimize existing analytics tools rather than building custom solutions from scratch.
  - Stay current with best practices in digital analytics and recommend improvements in tracking methodologies.

**Qualifications:**

- **Experience:**  
  - Proven experience in digital analytics, with a focus on tracking non-organic or performance marketing campaigns.
  - Hands-on experience with tools like Adjust, Mixpanel, AppsFlyer, or similar analytics platforms.
  
- **Technical Skills:**  
  - Strong understanding of digital marketing metrics, tracking, and data integration.
  - Experience working with development teams to implement tracking solutions.
  - Familiarity with API integrations and data aggregation techniques.

- **Analytical Skills:**  
  - Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  - Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  
- **Communication:**  
  - Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  - Ability to clearly present data insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

**Additional Information:**

- This role does not require the creation of new tracking tools; instead, you will optimize and integrate existing solutions.
- Opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment where data-driven decisions shape business strategy.
- Competitive salary and benefits package.

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive marketing success and have a knack for integrating analytics tools, we would love to hear from you!

---

Please send your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience.

title: CFO Support Analyst (Long Term Growth Potential with Company)
description:
I am looking for a long-term, highly analytical CFO Support Analyst to work US Eastern Time Zone hours, to partner with me on financial forecasting, cash flow management, and process automation for e-commerce clients.
If you already have multiple projects, limited availability, or are not used to or available to work on Eastern Time Zone, please do not apply.
About the Role & Clients
I currently have multiple long-term CFO clients who need ongoing financial insights, forecasting, and reporting improvements. These clients are e-commerce businesses with annual revenues ranging from $300K to $2M, and they rely on us to provide:
Cash flow forecasting & variance analysis
Profitability & margin tracking
Financial statement reviews
AI-powered workflow optimization
Most of the work involves financial modeling, forecasting, and automation, but we are also incorporating AI-driven insights and optimizing workflows.

Must-Have Skills & Mindset
Deep expertise in spreadsheets (Google Sheets, Excel, advanced formulas, automation).
Financial acumen (P&L forecasting, cash flow modeling, variance analysis).
Analytical problem-solver – Can interpret financial data and identify key insights.
Tech-forward – Comfortable using AI tools, API integrations, and automation to improve workflows.
Scrappy & independent – Able to figure things out fast using AI, forums, research, and creative problem-solving.
Task-switching ability – Will need to manage multiple clients/projects at once without losing focus.

You analyze, prep, and refine reports → I deliver insights & strategy to clients.
You automate & optimize financial tracking → We reduce manual work & scale faster.
You uncover financial trends & risks → We provide higher-value CFO services.
This role has long-term growth potential, and if we work well together, I see this position evolving into a key leadership role as we scale our CFO services.

Compensation & Expectations
Must be available for 30+ hours per week – I am looking for someone dedicated and long-term.
Initially hourly, with potential for salary or other arrangements after a successful first few months.
Opportunities for increased responsibility & compensation as the business grows.

title: Senior Data Analyst with Revenue Operations Experience
description:
Contractor Scope of Work: Senior Data Analyst

Project Title: Sales Pipeline Analysis

Objective: The objective of this engagement is to analyze our Sales Pipeline data to gain insights into the sales process, including time-to-conversion, conversion rates, and performance variations based on product type and opportunity size. The contractor will conduct a baseline analysis and provide actionable insights based on the findings.

Scope of Work: The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for:

Data Assessment & Understanding:

Reviewing existing Sales Pipeline data sources and structures.

Identifying data gaps, inconsistencies, and potential areas for data cleaning.

Baseline Sales Pipeline Analysis:

Calculating turn-around time between different pipeline stages.

Measuring conversion rates between each stage of the sales pipeline.

Evaluating performance trends and bottlenecks within the sales cycle.

Segmentation & Insights Generation:

Analyzing key sales metrics segmented by product types.

Examining sales performance based on opportunity size.

Identifying any correlations between product type, opportunity size, and conversion efficiency.

Data Visualization & Reporting:

Presenting findings in a clear, concise format using dashboards, charts, and reports.

Providing actionable recommendations to improve sales pipeline efficiency.

Collaboration & Presentation:

Engaging with key stakeholders to understand business needs and context.

Delivering a summary presentation of key findings and insights.

Offering recommendations for process improvements based on data trends.

Deliverables:

A detailed data analysis report summarizing findings and insights.

Visual dashboards showcasing key pipeline metrics.

Recommendations document for improving conversion rates and reducing turnaround time.

Presentation to key stakeholders.

Qualifications & Experience:

Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within sales or revenue operations.

Proficiency in data analytics tools such as SQL, Python, R, Excel, or BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

Strong understanding of sales pipeline metrics and business analytics.

Ability to communicate complex data findings in an understandable manner.

Timeline:

Estimated project duration: 2 Weeks

Milestones and deadlines to be agreed upon at the project kickoff.

Reporting & Communication:

Regular status updates to be provided to the project lead.

Collaboration with sales and operations teams for data validation and insights alignment.

title: Analyst - Consulting Company
description:
Analyst (Part-Time) – Crestline Partners

Location: Remote (Must be available during North American business hours, EST)
Hours: 10-15 hours per week
Compensation: $10 CAD/hour (with potential for increased hours based on performance)
Company: Crestline Partners

About Crestline Partners
Crestline Partners is a boutique consulting firm that helps businesses optimize operations, scale efficiently, and implement strategic financial and business solutions. Our clients range from startups to established companies across various industries. This role is an opportunity to work directly with the founder, gaining hands-on experience in both business development and operational consulting.

Role Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented, proactive analyst to assist with internal business operations and client projects. This role is ideal for someone looking to gain real-world experience in consulting, business analysis, and financial operations, with opportunities to grow into a more senior role over time.

Responsibilities
Internal Business Development & Operations
Assist in developing a business development framework to generate leads and streamline sales outreach.
Organize and maintain Google Drive folders, ensuring easy access to critical documents.
Manage internal P&Ls by gathering and organizing financial data, pulling bank statements, and tracking expenses.
Client-Facing Support
Assist various client businesses with value creation projects, which may include:
Drafting and sending templated emails (e.g., AR follow-ups using invoices from QuickBooks).
Managing internal spreadsheets tracking customer interactions, client service tickets, and marketing lists.
Updating and listing inventory or service offerings on digital platforms.
Reviewing call transcripts, summarizing key insights, and drafting follow-up communications.
Supporting the creation and implementation of SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) to optimize business functions.

What We’re Looking For
Must-Haves:
✅ Comfortable working with financial data (CPA or finance background preferred but not required).
✅ Available during North American business hours (9 AM-5 PM EST) to coordinate with the team.
✅ Strong English communication skills, both written and verbal, and comfortable using phone-based apps like TextNow, TextMe, or their own phone software.
✅ Highly proactive, eager to take initiative, and willing to grow into an expanded role.
✅ Detail-oriented, able to work independently, and good at following structured processes.
Bonus Points if You Have:
➕ Experience working with QuickBooks, Google Sheets, or CRM tools.
➕ Familiarity with consulting, startups, or scaling businesses.
➕ A natural curiosity and ability to problem-solve across various business functions.

Interview Process
We aim to keep our hiring process efficient and transparent:
1️⃣ Application Form: Candidates will be asked to complete a short Google Form outlining their background, skills, and availability.
2️⃣ Initial Interview (15-30 mins): Selected applicants will be invited to a Google Meet video interview with the founder to discuss their experience, skills, and fit for the role.
3️⃣ Decision & Offer: Successful candidates will receive an offer with onboarding details and next steps.

Why Join Crestline Partners?
🌎 Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere while gaining hands-on consulting experience.
📈 Growth Potential: Strong performance will lead to increased pay and hours over time.
🤝 Direct Mentorship: Work closely with the founder, learning the ins and outs of business strategy and operations.
📊 Diverse Learning Experience: Exposure to multiple industries, including finance, tech, real estate, and more.
Please Apply Using the Following Form:

https://forms.gle/YC8VWhmMWhoKV5sz7

title: Data Modeler
description:
Do you enjoy designing efficient data structures? Are you skilled at translating business requirements into scalable data models? Do you thrive in optimizing data for performance and usability?

Join Elixirr Digital as a Data Modeler and help us shape the foundation of our data architecture to drive meaningful insights for our clients and stakeholders!

As a Data Modeler, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing conceptual, logical, and physical data models that enable seamless data integration and analytics. You will collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and business teams to ensure data is structured for accessibility, efficiency, and accuracy.

Discover the opportunity to join our Data & Analytics department and work alongside a team of innovative professionals using cutting-edge technologies to transform raw data into valuable assets!

What you will be doing as a Data Modeler at Elixirr Digital?

• Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure data models align with reporting and analytics requirements
• Define and enforce data governance standards, naming conventions, and best practices
• Optimize data models for performance, scalability, and maintainability
• Work with business teams to understand data needs and translate them into structured data models
• Document data models, relationships, and metadata to ensure clarity and consistency

Competencies and skillset we expect you to have to successfully perform your job:

Strong SQL expertise, adept at writing efficient queries and optimizing database performance
• Ability to independently communicate with clients, understand their requirements, and translate them into effective data models
• Experience working with Microsoft Azure technologies, including Azure Data Factory, Synapse, and Databricks
• Strong understanding of data governance, normalization, and dimensional modeling
• Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams
