title: Director of Operations & Content Strategy - Scale a High-Impact Media Machine
description:
Director of Content Strategy & Operations – Scale a High-Impact Media Machine

I am looking for an elite executor who can take full ownership of my content operations while ensuring that our content is engaging, high-value, and strategically optimized for performance.

This is not a virtual assistant role. This is a leadership position where you will oversee our entire media team, enforce accountability, and ensure that we are not just producing content—but making it perform at the highest level.
Every piece of content must be built with a purpose—whether it’s driving audience engagement, retention, or conversions.
If you have the leadership skills to run an operation and the creative mindset to think like a content strategist, this is for you.

Your Core Responsibilities
1. Content Performance & Strategy
* Oversee not just the execution of content but its effectiveness across multiple platforms.
* Ensure team optimizes raw footage into videos, articles, tweets, and pictures for maximum engagement, watch time, and retention on YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter (X).
* Ensure all content aligns with our brand voice, storytelling approach, and audience expectations.
* Provide direct feedback to editors, videographer, me, and repurposing specialists based on data-driven insights.
* Stay ahead of trends, platform updates, and algorithm shifts to constantly improve performance.
2. Media Team Leadership & Execution
* Manage a team of me, videographers, editors, data analysts, and repurposing specialists.
* Set clear expectations and hold people accountable—this is a high-performance team, not a casual environment.
* Build a content machine that consistently delivers high-quality, optimized content.
* Manage all communications, deadlines, and workflow so that I don’t have to.
3. Content Tracking, Scheduling & Optimization
* Own the content calendar across YouTube, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, Facebook, and Twitter (X).
* Ensure all content is scheduled, queued, and optimized to perform at the highest level.
* Track content performance and make real-time adjustments based on data.
* Plan and execute live-streaming strategies—decide when and where I go live for maximum impact.
4. Quality Control & Approval Flow
* You learn my style and standards.
* Ensure that nothing reaches me unless it’s already been checked, cleaned up, and meets my standards.
* If team members fail KPIs, you step in first, solve issues, and then bring me solutions.
* Ensure captions, thumbnails, pacing, and edits are designed for maximum engagement.
5. System & Workflow Optimization
* Build seamless backend organization in Google Drive, Notion, Asana, and other tools.
* Remove inefficiencies and bottlenecks—this role is about constant improvement.
* Ensure that we have a 5-week backlog of content so we are always ahead of the game.
6. Communication, Leadership & Proactive Execution
* Provide proactive updates—I should never have to ask for status reports.
* Train, instruct, and enforce execution across the team.
* Manage scheduling, messaging, and priorities as if this were your own media brand.

Compensation & Pay Structure - this is the highest paying role on our team. Congratulations.  The second highest paying job role is $3,000.
* First month: $3,000
* After 30 days: $3,500
* After 60 days: $4,000 (permanent salary cap unless milestones are hit)
* Performance-Based Raise: After 9 months of consistent execution, a 20% pay increase ($4,800/month) will be considered based on performance, execution, and results.

I am open to milestone-based raises for someone who delivers at a high level, leads effectively, and proves they can grow with the company. This isn’t about time served—it’s about real execution and impact.


What This Role Will Do
The Director of Content & Operations will build, automate, and manage the entire content operation. This person will ensure all content is structured, distributed, and optimized for maximum engagement—without needing micromanagement.
You will be responsible for:
* Managing my content ecosystem—overseeing the execution of the entire media team.
* Setting up workflows & automation to ensure zero bottlenecks in the content process.
* Scheduling & publishing content on LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok.
* Ensuring everything is on-brand, engaging, and optimized for audience growth.
* Overseeing performance tracking & insights—working with the Analytics Specialist to ensure we are making data-driven decisions.
* Holding the team accountable—making sure Videographers, Editors, Copywriters, and Repurposing Specialists are executing at a high level.
* Streamlining operations with Notion, Asana, Trello, Google Drive, Slack, and AI tools.
* Managing approvals and quality control—nothing goes live without final review.
* Working directly with me—making sure everything is aligned with my vision, voice, and brand.
* Leading the team with high-level communication and accountability—ensuring we move at the same speed every single day.

Key Skills Required
This is not a VA role. This is a Director-Level Position that requires:
1. Leadership & Accountability – You will oversee an entire team, enforce deadlines, and ensure executionwithout micromanagement.
2. Social Media & Brand Strategy – You must understand how to grow an audience, structure content, and drive engagement across platforms.
3. Process Automation & Workflow Creation – You must be able to build systems in Asana, Zapier, Notion, Google Drive, and scheduling tools to keep content flowing automatically.
4. Content Distribution & Optimization – You need to know what works and why across LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok.
5. Attention to Detail & Brand Consistency – Everything must be on-brand, from copy to visuals to post timing.
6. Data-Driven Decision Making – You will track performance, analyze metrics, and ensure we are making data-backed improvements.
7. Project Management & Execution – You will set goals, break them down into tasks, and ensure deadlines are met without excuses.
8. Ability to Work at High Speed – This is a fast-paced, high-performance role. If you cannot operate at a relentless execution speed, this is not for you.

Who This Role is For
You should apply if you:
* Have 5+ years of experience managing content teams, social media growth, or operations.
* Can run a team & workflow without being told what to do.
* Are obsessed with content, branding, and execution.
* Are highly organized and love building automation & efficiency into workflows.
* Have managed teams of 5+ people in a fast-paced media, social, or content-driven company.
* Understand how to scale and optimize content distribution.

Who This Role is NOT For
This is not a basic VA, social media manager, or content repurposing role.
* If you need constant direction, this is not for you.
* If you can’t move at high speed, this is not for you.
* If you struggle with execution & leadership, this is not for you.
* If you don’t deeply understand content & social media growth, this is not for you.

How to Apply
1. Submit your resume and include examples of your previous work.
2. Tell me how you have built and managed a high-performance content team before.
3. Explain your experience with automation & workflow optimization.
4. Give an example of a content system you’ve built and scaled.

Quick Rundown of Roles
Tevin (Videographer) – Captures high-quality video content daily, ensuring strong storytelling and brand visuals. Uploads footage to the Director of Content Strategy & Operationsfor distribution.
Content Operations Lead (Director of Content Strategy & OperationsManager) – Organizes content, assigns tasks, ensures execution, collects and submits all deliverables to Bennett for review, and handles posting. Manages workflow, tracking, and accountability across the team.
Content Editor – Edits raw footage into short-form (TikTok, Reels, Shorts) and long-form (YouTube) videos. Ensures polished, high-quality edits before submission.
Repurposing Specialist – Extracts key moments from videos and creates additional content (tweets, carousels, audiograms, quote graphics) tailored for different platforms.
Copywriter & Brand Strategist – Writes LinkedIn posts, Twitter threads, Instagram captions, and email copy in Bennett’s voice. Ensures all content aligns with branding and messaging.
Analytics & Insights Specialist – Tracks content performance, analyzes engagement, and provides data-driven insights to optimize future content. Reports findings to Director of Content Strategy & Operationsand Bennett.
Bennett (CEO & Final Reviewer) – Provides high-level strategy, final content approval, and audience engagement. Ensures everything meets the “Bennett Standard” before going live. YOUR ROLE  is the heartbeat of the team – Keeps everything organized, moving, and optimized for execution.

Trial Process – Prove You Can Lead This System
Before hiring someone on full-time, I’m running a paid one-week trial to confirm the right fit. This will be your opportunity to show that you can take ownership, enforce execution, and optimize this system: my hope is that you shine!

Trial Tasks – What You Need to Prove This Week
1. Systems and Workflow Execution
* Set up and refine content tracking, workflow, and storage systems.
* Ensure the videographer follows a structured upload process that is organized and trackable.
* Build a scalable system for the editor so once hired, they seamlessly plug in.
2. Leadership and High-Quality Output
* Prove that under your leadership, the output meets my standards and is something I would personally approve.
* Track daily footage uploads and ensure everything is properly labeled, accessible, and structured.
* Assess the systems you build, then recommend improvements to enhance efficiency and simplify onboarding.
3. Readiness and Content Pipeline
* This operation does not launch until we have five weeks of content ready to go.
* By the end of this week BEFORE END OF FEBRUARY 2025, we should have a fully operational system where every team member knows their role, executes at a high level, and trusts the process. This is the first hire I am making, as I want you building the systems out for the others to come into. I have concepts already mapped out for you.
* Weekly meetings must be structured, productive, and geared toward constant improvement.
4. Managing Me and Executing My Vision
* Schedule a daily check-in with me to update progress and discuss ideas.
* Show that you can handle incoming ideas and requests without letting quality slip elsewhere.
* Take ownership and execute what I give you without needing reminders or constant oversight.
5. Leadership and Team Communication
* Schedule, announce, coordinate, and lead a team meeting.
* Enforce participation and set the tone for the team.
* Demonstrate your ability to gain respect, demand accountability, and drive execution.
6. Ownership and Reporting
* Send me daily progress updates without needing to be asked.
* Identify and resolve bottlenecks before they become issues.

What Happens Next
If you execute at the highest level, you will transition into a full-time role at $4,000 USD per month after a 60-day ramp-up period. If you cannot prove this in a week, this role is not for you.

Who I Am & Where I Come From
* Self-made. Nothing handed. Scaled Park Business Capital from 3 to 40+ people.
* Built sales systems & processes that transform careers, not just jobs.
* I don’t believe in micromanaging—I hire the right people and let them do what they do best.
* I’m not an influencer—just someone who actually wins.

The Vision & Why This Role Matters
This isn’t a personal brand project. This is a media powerhouse.
* The content we create will be seen by millions and shift how people think and operate.
* We aren’t just posting to post—everything is intentional.
* Execution is everything—from how I show up, to how the videographer captures it, to how the editor refines it, to how the team repurposes and distributes it.
If you are lead management and are the 1 in charge of the operations, then every single person on the team needs to feel your presence, your passion, and you need to be able to speak like me, on my behalf- and I need to trust you wholeheartedly. You need to be able to speak like me, think like me, and execute without hesitation.

Think Alex Hormozi, Gary Vee, Andy Elliott, Grant Cardone—this is not just about social media, this is about building a first-of-its-kind sales movement.

This is not a task-based VA job. This is a leadership role in running a high-impact media operation.

If you hesitate, this isn’t for you. If you’re ready to execute at a high level—let’s build something legendary.
Hiring ASAP.

title: data analyst to implement OLAP & advanced prediction for Data Warehousing
description:
I am working on a research paper focused on data warehousing (DW) and efficient querying of large datasets using SQL. The original paper primarily discusses SQL-based implementations but does not explicitly cover Online Analytical Processing (OLAP).
I would like to extend this research by incorporating OLAP techniques to enhance data analysis and multidimensional querying. Additionally, I aim to introduce new predictive insights beyond what is covered in the paper to serve as a contribution to the research.
Project Details:
- I already have the dataset, which was originally collected from four sources: Weather Underground, NASA's Data Access Viewer, Flightradar24 and FlightStats.
- The goal is to structure and process the dataset for OLAP-based analysis.
- Implement advanced predictive analytics beyond what is discussed in the paper.
- Provide insights and recommendations on the best tools and technologies for handling OLAP queries and predictive modeling.
What I Need:
- Assistance in integrating OLAP techniques for multidimensional analysis.
- Developing additional predictive models to generate new insights.
- Guidance on tools and technologies suitable for handling large-scale OLAP queries and predictions.
I have attached the original research paper that I am working on for reference. Please review it and let me know how you can assist with implementing OLAP and introducing new predictive analytics as a contribution to the research.
If you have expertise in data warehousing, OLAP, SQL, predictive analytics, and large-scale data processing, I’d love to hear how you can contribute to this project.
Looking forward to your proposals!

title: Looker Studio expert for advanced sustainability dashboard
description:
Looker Studio expert needed for advanced sustainability dashboard

Project description:
We have a dataset of approximately 30,000 rows based on invoices, containing CO₂ data, supplier information, costs, and various classifications. Our goal is to build an impactful and highly useful dashboard in Looker that not only provides a high-level summary of sustainability data but also enables deep analytical exploration (drill-downs).

What we need help with:
- Strategic setup & integration: You should be familiar with Google Cloud Platform and Looker (data is stored in BigQuery) to ensure a smooth and effective setup. However, getting everything ‘technically perfect’ is less important than ensuring the data delivers valuable insights.
- Dashboard & visualization: Develop a clear and actionable dashboard that highlights key sustainability metrics (e.g., total CO₂, costs, supplier overview) while allowing users to drill down into specific areas for deeper analysis.
- Analytical approach: We need someone who goes beyond the technical setup and can think about what questions the data should answer. You will be expected to contribute ideas on which key metrics, dimensions, and analyses matter most for understanding and improving sustainability efforts.
- Advisory role: Provide input on how to structure and model the data to uncover insights and offer fresh perspectives on sustainability.

Who we are looking for:
- Business & analytical mindset: You understand how to extract real business value from data and can suggest the right types of analyses and data manipulations.
- Technical expertise: Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform, particularly BigQuery and Looker.
- Sustainability knowledge (a plus): Experience with CO₂ emissions data, environmental calculations, or sustainability-related analytics is highly valued.
- Communication skills: Ability to explain complex data insights in a clear and engaging way, both visually and in written documentation.

Key responsibilities:
- Review existing data structure and sources to ensure they are optimized for impactful insights in Looker.
- Set up LookML models and relationships that support meaningful analytics and storytelling.
- Design a dashboard that provides both high-level KPIs and granular drill-downs for further investigation.
- Ensure the dashboard is intuitive and adaptable, allowing for easy updates as new data becomes available.
- Suggest ways to improve data collection and structuring to enhance long-term analytical value.

How to apply:
Please provide:
- A short description of your experience with Looker, BigQuery, and Google Cloud.
- Examples of past dashboards or projects you’ve built—ideally where data was used to drive business decisions, not just for reporting.
- A brief outline of how you would approach this project (key steps and priorities).
- Estimated time requirements and your availability.

Timeline & scope:
- The project can start immediately.
- We aim to have a first working version within a few weeks but are flexible on exact timing.
- If this collaboration goes well, there’s potential for ongoing work.

Budget:
Please provide your hourly rate or a fixed price proposal. We are open to discussing based on your expertise and approach.

We’re looking for someone who can turn data into actionable sustainability insights. If you’re passionate about making complex data meaningful and useful, we’d love to hear from you!

title: HR Manager & Recruiter for a Google Ads Agency with an Ecommerce Brand
description:
Adcubator is the world’s leading Google Ads agency, managing nine figures in ad spend yearly while scaling brands to new heights. We are known for our deep expertise, push vs. pull methodology, and exclusive invite-only client base. Our team operates at the highest level, with a data-driven, structured, and high-performance culture.

We are now looking for a proactive and highly organized HR Manager to establish and optimize our HR operations, from recruitment and onboarding to performance management and employee engagement.

Your Role

As our HR Manager, you will build and implement structured, scalable HR processes to support Adcubator’s rapid growth. You will ensure seamless hiring, onboarding, and team management, all while fostering a culture of ownership, accountability, and high performance.

Key Responsibilities

- Recruitment & Talent Acquisition
- Develop a streamlined, high-performance hiring process to attract and retain top-tier media buyers, analysts, and operational staff.
- Source, screen, and interview candidates (Upwork, OnlineJobs.ph, LinkedIn, referrals, etc.) to maintain a talent pipeline.
- Oversee the hiring process end-to-end, ensuring new hires meet our performance and cultural standards.

Onboarding & Training

- Own the onboarding process for new hires to ensure seamless integration and high retention.
- Implement structured training programs for media buyers and other key roles, ensuring rapid upskilling.
- Maintain ClickUp-based documentation for SOPs, processes, and best practices.

Performance Management & Team Development

- Set up quarterly performance reviews and structured bi-monthly feedback loops for employees.
- Collaborate with leadership to establish KPIs and career progression frameworks for key roles.
- Identify gaps in training, structure, or management and proactively implement solutions.

HR Operations & Culture Building

- Manage HR policies, contracts, and compliance, ensuring smooth operations.
- Establish employee wellness initiatives, including perks like our $50 wellness allowance.
- Develop a feedback system, ensuring transparent communication and issue resolution within the team.

Payroll & Compensation (Coordination with Accounting)

- Oversee contractor payments (currently managed via Upwork, OnlineJobs.ph, direct transfers).
- Work with leadership to evaluate competitive compensation strategies and performance-based incentives.
- Research potential HR tech solutions (e.g., Deel) for compliance and payroll at scale.

Who You Are

Required Experience & Skills:

✅ 3+ years of HR experience in a fast-paced, remote-first company (agency or e-commerce preferred).
✅ Proven experience in recruitment & talent acquisition, hiring high-performance individuals.
✅ Strong ability to implement structure, define SOPs, and scale HR processes.
✅ Experience with onboarding, training, and performance management for remote teams.
✅ Exceptional organization, problem-solving, and leadership skills.
✅ Strong understanding of remote contractor management & payroll processes (Upwork, PayPal, Wise, Deel, etc.).
✅ Ability to create a results-driven work environment while fostering collaboration and transparency.

Bonus Skills:

➕ Experience in Google Ads, marketing, or media buying environments.
➕ Familiarity with ClickUp, Slack, and automation tools.
➕ Knowledge of HR laws & compliance in remote work setups.

Why Join Adcubator?

🚀 Work at the best Google Ads agency in the world, managing top-tier accounts.
🌍 Remote-first culture, with flexibility and a high-performance environment.
📈 Fast-track career growth, working directly with industry leaders.
💰 Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives.
🏋️ Wellness perks ($50 gym allowance, lifestyle flexibility).

How to Apply

If you’re a high-performance HR professional who thrives in a structured, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you. Apply now with:

1️⃣ Your CV & LinkedIn profile
2️⃣ A short cover letter on why you’re a great fit
3️⃣ Your experience with hiring & structuring HR in a fast-growing company

Please be mindful of filling out your application within this link as well: https://forms.clickup.com/36778222/f/132c7e-44535/3LYIJNZBPYHLKJTI60

💼 Apply now & be part of Adcubator’s global expansion!

title: Transportation Researcher Needed for Vehicle Crash Data Analysis
description:
Seek a Transportation researcher to identify gaps in MMUCC (Model Minimum Uniform Crash Criteria) crash data with state-level Law Enforcement Agencies (LEAs) in the US.

Such gaps often stem from issues related to data completeness and data sharing. Here’s a breakdown of the key challenges and potential solutions:

1. Data Completeness Issues
Challenges:
Inconsistent Data Entry: LEAs may not collect all MMUCC-recommended fields, leading to missing or incomplete data.
Varied Reporting Standards: States may have unique crash report formats that don’t align with MMUCC.
Standardized Digital Reporting: Implement state-mandated electronic crash reporting systems with required MMUCC fields.

2. Data Sharing Challenges
Challenges:
Lack of Centralized Systems: Many states have separate databases that aren’t integrated, making cross-agency data sharing difficult.
Interoperability Issues: Different states and LEAs use various reporting platforms that may not communicate with each other.
Data Format Inconsistencies: Differences in how crash data is recorded (e.g., structured vs. unstructured data) create integration challenges.

Deliverable;
Your output will be a technical paper clearly identifying gaps in current MMUCC model data sharing and data completeness within existing software offerings.
Your report will contain the top 3 commercial or government software offerings with a mapping of Core Components of MMUCC Crash Data
with integrate FARS data elements at the crash, vehicle, and person level found on NHTSA’s Fatality Injury Reporting System Tool (FIRST).

Gig pays $25 and must be highly technical for a technical managerial audience.
Output will be a Word document of approximately 20 pages including 4 infographics to explain the standard & gaps where applicable.

title: Development of Integrated Financial Reporting & Operational KPI Dashboard
description:
We are seeking an experienced data analytics professional to design and implement an integrated Financial Reporting and Operational KPI Dashboard. The objective is to create a "single source of truth" for our financial and operational data, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and efficiency across reporting processes.

Project Overview:
This project will be delivered in three phases:

(1) Phase 1: Financial Reporting – Management Accounts & Board Pack

(2) Phase 2: Operational KPI Reporting

(3) Phase 3: Other Departmental Reporting (Details to follow post Phase 1 & 2)

We aim to move quickly with Phases 1 and 2, without Phase 3 delaying project initiation.

Phase 1: Financial Reporting Requirements
Key Deliverables:

- Consolidated Monthly Management Accounts:
- Integrate data from multiple Xero accounts.
- Ensure seamless financial data consolidation without discrepancies.

Profit & Loss Analysis by Department:
- Own Clinics
- Franchise
- Pharma
- Resolve overlap across Xero accounts (e.g., shared data between GAD Operations and GAD Pharma).

Profit & Loss by Own Clinic Locations:
- Manage data across 7 current sites, scaling to 30+ sites within two years.
- Consolidate data coded by location in shared Xero accounts.

Data Controls:
- Implement rigorous controls to validate integration accuracy and completeness.

Phase 2: Operational KPI Dashboard Requirements

Sample KPIs (to be refined during consultation):
- Franchise Operations:
- Sales by location and product type
- Resource utilisation
- Average transactional value
- Customer retention
- Budget vs. prior year comparisons
- Prescriptions issued
- Staff costs by clinic (attendance-based)
- Discounts given

Own Clinics:
- Similar KPIs to Franchise Operations
- Pharma Operations:
- Sales by customer type
- Customer sign-ups, approvals, and pending applications

Additional KPIs:
- Flexibility to incorporate new metrics as needed

Phase 3: Other Departmental Reports

Details will be defined by department heads but may include:
- Franchise Operations:
- Franchisee sign-up progress
- Incident logs (e.g., Health & Safety)
- Staff numbers
- Cancelled appointments
- Active hours

Own Clinics:
- Similar KPIs to Franchise Operations

Pharma Operations:
- Orders processed
- Staff time per order
- Stock levels and ordering recommendations

HR:
- Staff retention rates
- Vacancy progress
- Benchmarking staff remuneration

Current Data Infrastructure Overview:
Primary Data Sources:
- Xero: Financial data (11 accounts, scaling to 30+ in two years).
- Zenoti (POS/CRM): Sales, staff costs, discounts, and partner payments.
- Pharma Website: Third-party orders, stock tracking (via Mintsoft), Stripe payments.
- Shopify: Online sales, Stripe integration.

Current Reporting Workflow:
- Data exported to Google Sheets via Coupler.io.
- Manual data entry for specific KPIs (e.g., staff attendance costs, franchise gross sales).
- Consolidated Management Accounts and Board Packs generated manually.

Key Expectations:
- A centralised, automated dashboard with minimal manual intervention.
- Seamless integration with Xero, Zenoti, Shopify, Stripe, Pharma Website.
- Ability to handle multi-source data consolidation.
- Scalable infrastructure for future expansion.
- User-friendly interface for non-technical stakeholders.
- Robust data validation and control mechanisms.

Proposal Requirements:
Please include the following in your proposal:
- Your approach to developing this dashboard.
- Estimated timeline and cost breakdown.
- Relevant experience with similar projects.

We are excited to hear from professionals with proven expertise in financial and operational data analytics. If you're confident in delivering a robust and scalable solution, we'd love to collaborate.

Looking forward to receiving your proposal!
skills: ['Data Visualization', 'SQL', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Financial Analysis', 'Microsoft Power BI', 'Data Entry']

title: Lead Economic Impact Consultant for Industrial & Energy Sectors
description:
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Economic Impact Consultant to lead a six-month study assessing the economic contribution of a major company's downstream assets and future investments. The study will quantify direct, indirect, and induced economic impacts, assess GDP contributions, employment effects, and In-Country Value (ICV), and provide insights for government discussions on natural gas pricing and allocation.

This role requires an expert-level consultant to lead the economic modeling, analysis, and strategic assessments. A team of analysts will be on the ground to support data collection, ensuring access to local financial, operational, and market data. The consultant will focus on designing the methodology, conducting impact assessments, and engaging with stakeholders at a strategic level.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the Economic Impact Study, defining methodology, research approach, and analysis.
Develop economic models to quantify economic contributions under various scenarios.
Conduct scenario analysis on different operational and investment strategies.
Provide strategic guidance to on-the-ground analysts collecting financial and operational data.
Engage with stakeholders, including industry leaders, policymakers, and investment authorities.
Deliver a comprehensive final report, an Excel-based economic model, and an executive summary presentation.
Present findings to key stakeholders, ensuring alignment with project objectives.
Provide weekly progress updates and address any project challenges proactively.
Qualifications & Experience:
10+ years of experience in economic impact analysis, public policy research, or industrial economics.
Strong background in economic modeling, forecasting, and scenario planning.
Sector expertise in energy, petrochemicals, manufacturing, or infrastructure.
Experience engaging with government, regulatory bodies, or investment stakeholders.
Strong stakeholder engagement and presentation skills.
Proficiency in Excel-based economic models, data visualization, and structured reporting.
Ability to coordinate remotely with local analysts conducting data collection.
Deliverables:
Final Report (Executive Summary + White Paper with Visual Infographics).
Excel-Based Economic Model (Scenario-based impact analysis).
Stakeholder Presentation (Findings summary for leadership & key decision-makers).
Short Video Summary (Optional).
Project Structure & Compensation:
Location: Remote, with coordination of on-the-ground analysts conducting data collection.
Timeline: 6 months (fixed-term contract).
Compensation: Competitive rate based on experience; milestone-based payments preferred.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates should submit:

A brief proposal detailing relevant experience.
Sample reports or case studies of previous economic impact studies.
Availability and rate expectations.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst for Construction Data & Forecasting
description:
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst for Construction Data & Forecasting (Contract)
Job Description:
We are a high-end residential construction company in San Francisco looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze historical project data, develop automated dashboards, and create predictive financial models for future planning.

This is a 3–6 month remote contract with a clear focus on project cost analysis, forecasting, and performance tracking. The ideal candidate has experience in construction or real estate analytics and can deliver actionable insights to improve project efficiency and profitability.

Scope of Work:
Data Analysis & Insights

Review past project costs, labor efficiency, and profitability trends.
Identify patterns in cost overruns, scheduling delays, and subcontractor performance.
Develop predictive models for job costing and future project pricing.
Dashboards & Reporting

Build real-time dashboards for tracking profitability, cost breakdowns, and KPIs.
Use Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, or Power BI for visualization.
Provide summary reports with key insights and recommendations.
Data Cleaning & Automation

Extract, clean, and organize data from JobTread, QuickBooks, and spreadsheets.
Streamline reporting processes to reduce manual data entry.
Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to enhance data accuracy.
Forecasting & Financial Modeling

Create cost projection models to estimate future labor, materials, and profit margins.
Forecast cash flow and budget needs for upcoming projects.
Provide data-backed recommendations for pricing strategy and cost control.
Deliverables:
Interactive dashboards for ongoing project performance tracking.
Data reports & cost analysis summaries with key insights.
Predictive pricing and financial forecasting models.
Automated reporting workflows for long-term efficiency.
Ideal Candidate:
3+ years experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or construction financial analysis.
Experience with construction or real estate data (preferred).
Proficiency in Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, Power BI, or Tableau.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, financial modeling).
Experience working with JobTread, QuickBooks, or construction software (preferred).
Strong ability to interpret financial data, identify trends, and build predictive models.
Clear communicator who can present insights effectively.
Project Details:
Duration: 3–6 months, project-based.
Location: 100% remote.
Budget: Competitive, based on experience.
Hours: Flexible, but must meet deadlines.
How to Apply:
Please submit:

A brief note on your experience with construction analytics.
Examples of past dashboards, reports, or forecasting models you have built.
A short explanation of how you would approach project cost forecasting in construction.
Priority will be given to candidates with construction-specific experience.

We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: HR Analyst Training and Skills Development
description:
I am seeking a skilled professional to train me in becoming an HR Analyst. With 2 years of core HR experience, I am looking to enhance my skills and knowledge in this specific area. The training should focus on key competencies such as data analysis, employee relations, HR metrics, and strategic planning. Your guidance will help me transition smoothly into this role and understand the analytical aspects essential for HR decision-making.

Core HR Analyst Skills:

Data Analysis & Reporting:  This is paramount.  Look for trainers proficient in:

HRIS (Human Resource Information Systems): Experience with specific HRIS platforms like Workday, BambooHR, ADP, Namely, etc., is crucial. Mentioning specific systems you use is a good idea.

Data Manipulation & Cleaning: Skills in Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, macros), SQL, or other data manipulation tools are essential for handling HR data.

Statistical Analysis: Understanding basic statistical concepts (mean, median, mode, standard deviation) and how to apply them to HR data is important for drawing meaningful conclusions.

Data Visualization: Creating clear and compelling reports and dashboards using tools like Excel, PowerPoint, or dedicated visualization software (Tableau, Power BI) is vital for communicating insights.

Metrics & KPIs: Knowledge of key HR metrics (turnover rate, time-to-hire, employee engagement scores, etc.) and how to track and analyze them.

HR Domain Knowledge:  A good trainer should have a solid understanding of HR principles and practices, including:

Talent Acquisition: Metrics related to recruitment, sourcing, and onboarding.

Compensation & Benefits: Analyzing salary data, benefits costs, and compensation trends.

Performance Management: Understanding performance review processes and metrics.

Employee Relations: Analyzing employee feedback and identifying trends.

HR Compliance: Familiarity with relevant labor laws and regulations (e.g., GDPR, EEOC).

Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking:  HR Analysts need to be able to:

Identify trends and patterns: Analyze data to uncover insights and potential issues.

Develop solutions: Propose data-driven recommendations to address HR challenges.

Evaluate the effectiveness of HR programs: Measure the impact of HR initiatives and make
adjustments as needed.

Communication & Presentation Skills:  Being able to communicate complex data clearly and concisely is essential. Look for trainers who can help develop:

Written communication: Creating reports, presentations, and other HR documents.

Verbal communication: Presenting findings to stakeholders and explaining complex data in a simple way.

Additional Skills (Beneficial but not always required for entry-level):

Project Management: Managing HR projects and initiatives.

Change Management: Supporting organizational change efforts.

Business Acumen: Understanding how HR metrics impact the overall business strategy.
When posting on Upwork, be specific!

Target Audience: "I need a trainer for an entry-level HR Analyst." or "I need a trainer for experienced HR professionals transitioning to an analytics focus."

Specific Tools: "My team uses Workday and Excel extensively. Experience with these is a must."

Learning Objectives: "I want the training to focus on data visualization and reporting
techniques." or "I need help understanding HR metrics and KPIs."

Training Format: "I prefer online, one-on-one training." or "Group training for my HR team."
skills: ['Miro', 'Qualitative Research', 'Training', 'HR & Business Services', 'ISO 14001', 'Communications']

title: Monday.com Project Manager for Marketing Agency
description:
We don’t hire good—we hire the best. If you’re ready to deliver exceptional results and thrive in a high-performance environment, read on.

About ScalingFinTech

At ScalingFinTech, we don’t settle for ordinary. We’re on a mission to build the world’s most trusted, innovative agency network, delivering exceptional client experiences and data-driven results that help FinTech companies dominate globally.

We’re redefining how FinTech brands grow by combining cutting-edge AI strategies with a relentless commitment to excellence. Every member of our team is a superstar, and we’re searching for a Project Manager who’s ready to raise the bar even higher.

This role isn’t just about managing projects—it’s about owning the entire client journey and delivering measurable success at every touchpoint. If you thrive under pressure, love wearing multiple hats, and are ready to make a lasting impact, this is your opportunity to join a team of elite professionals shaping the future of FinTech.

About the Role

As our Project Manager, you’ll be at the heart of every client’s journey—ensuring seamless onboarding, flawless execution, proactive support, insightful reporting, and long-term retention. You’ll take ownership of the most critical processes that define the client experience and directly contribute to their success and our growth.

In this role, you’ll need to be agile, resourceful, and exceptionally organized, as you’ll oversee multiple responsibilities simultaneously. As we scale, you’ll have the opportunity to specialize in an area of your expertise, but for now, you’ll be the go-to leader for driving excellence across the board.

What You’ll Do

- Client Onboarding: Lead the onboarding process for new clients, ensuring alignment, clarity, and confidence from day one.

- Project Management: Oversee project execution, manage timelines, and ensure deliverables exceed expectations.

- Client Success: Act as the primary point of contact, addressing client needs, resolving issues, and fostering strong relationships.

- Reporting & Optimization: Oversee the delivery of actionable reports, helping clients see the measurable value of our services and identifying areas for improvement.

- Retention Strategies: Develop and implement strategies to ensure clients remain satisfied, engaged, and long-term partners.

Why ScalingFinTech?

- Be Part of Something Extraordinary: Work with elite professionals delivering transformative results for FinTech’s fastest-growing companies.

- Limitless Growth Opportunities: Take on a multi-faceted role now, and as we scale, grow into a specialized leadership position.

- Innovation at Your Fingertips: Use cutting-edge tools, AI strategies, and data-driven solutions to achieve unparalleled results.

- Global Impact: Help FinTech companies expand internationally, making your work truly meaningful.
A Culture of Excellence: Join a team that’s as committed to your success as you are to delivering results.

What Makes You a Superstar?

We’re not just looking for someone good—we want someone extraordinary. You’ll excel in this role if you:

- Own Organization: You thrive on juggling multiple projects and still maintain flawless attention to detail.

- Build Client Relationships Like No Other: You’re a natural communicator who knows how to earn trust and exceed expectations.

- Deliver Results That Matter: You prioritize measurable outcomes and always find ways to go above and beyond.

- Love Challenges: You embrace high-pressure situations with calm and resourcefulness.

- Think Like an Analyst: You use data to inform decisions and uncover opportunities for optimization.

- Collaborate Effortlessly: You know how to align cross-functional teams and deliver results as a cohesive unit.

- Hunger for Growth: You’re excited to take on a broad role now and grow into a specialized leadership position as we scale.

Qualifications

- Proven Experience: 3+ years in project management, client success, or operations, ideally in an agency or high-growth environment.

- Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in project management platforms (e.g., Monday.com, Asana) and reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel).

- Client-Facing Expertise: Experience managing client relationships and delivering outstanding service.

- Analytical Mindset: Strong ability to interpret data and present actionable insights.

- Startup Ready: Comfortable thriving in a fast-paced, evolving environment with competing priorities.

- Bonus: Experience in FinTech or regulated industries is a plus.

What Success Looks Like

- Clients onboard smoothly and achieve quick wins, building trust and momentum.
- Projects are completed on time, exceeding quality expectations and client goals.
- Reports are delivered with clarity, showcasing measurable results and value.
- Client retention is high, with strong, long-term relationships fostered.
- Internal processes improve continuously through your proactive optimizations.

Are You Ready to Lead the Charge?
We’re building a team of elite professionals, and this is your chance to prove you’re among the best. If you’re ready to own the client journey, deliver game-changing results, and thrive in a high-performance environment, we want to hear from you.

Apply now and help us shape the future of FinTech growth.

title: Competitive Intelligence Analyst for AI WordPress SEO Plugin | Market & Pricing Research
description:

Suggest unique selling points (USPs) to help our product stand out.

✅ Strategic Recommendations

Provide data-driven insights on industry trends and customer needs.

Ideal Candidate:

🎯 Strong analytical skills with the ability to break down pricing structures & feature gaps.
🎯 Understanding of AI-driven automation tools, SEO, and content marketing trends.
🎯 Ability to create clear comparison charts & detailed strategic reports.
🎯 Experience working with startups, product teams, or SaaS businesses is a plus.

Project Scope & Deliverables:

📌 Recommendations for pricing & feature positioning.
📌 (Optional) Presentation or Summary for internal team use.

Budget & Timeline:

⏳ Timeline: Ideally within 1 week.

title: Guide Creation for Opening Group Homes and Assisted Living Facilities
description:
Job Title: Research Analyst for Assisted Living Facility and Group Home Start up

---

Job Overview:  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and dedicated Research Analyst to help lay the groundwork for the successful establishment of an Assisted Living Facility and a Group Home. This role involves comprehensive research into state requirements, cost analysis, and strategic planning to ensure a profitable and compliant business launch. The ideal candidate will provide in-depth insights into industry regulations, pricing strategies, and operational requirements, clearly distinguishing the differences between Assisted Living Facilities and Group Homes.  



Key Responsibilities:

1. Industry Research and Analysis:
   - Conduct detailed research on **state-specific requirements** for licensing, staffing, safety, and operational guidelines for both Assisted Living Facilities and Group Homes.  
   - Investigate local zoning laws**, building codes, and community regulations to identify suitable locations.  
   - Analyze market trends and demand for Assisted Living and Group Homes in the targeted area.  

2. Financial Analysis and Pricing Strategy:  
   - Determine the monthly rate to charge residents by analyzing competitors, cost of living, and state reimbursement rates.  
   - Calculate operational costs, including staffing, utilities, food, medical supplies, and maintenance.  
   - Establish a profitability model considering state funding programs, private pay, and insurance reimbursements.  

3. Compliance and Legal Requirements:  
   - Identify all necessary licensing and permits required by the state and local authorities.  
   - Understand insurance requirements and liability coverage essential for operating the facilities.  
   - Research healthcare regulations and compliance standards, including medication management, emergency protocols, and resident rights.  

4. Service Differentiation and Facility Planning:  
   - Clearly explain the difference between Assisted Living Facilities and Group Homes including the type of care provided, staffing requirements, and target demographics.  
   - Provide recommendations on facility layout, room configurations, safety features, and accessibility standards.  

5. Operational Strategy and Staffing Requirements:  
   - Outline staffing needs, including administrators, caregivers, medical personnel, cooks, and maintenance staff.  
   - Research state-mandated staff-to-resident ratios and necessary staff certifications.  
   - Develop a detailed **organizational chart** to define roles and responsibilities.  

6. **Marketing and Community Integration:**  
   - Develop a marketing strategy to attract residents, highlighting key features and differentiators.  
   - Investigate community programs, healthcare partnerships, and referral networks to establish credibility.  

7.Reporting and Documentation:
   - Compile findings into comprehensive reports with actionable recommendations.  
   - Create a step-by-step roadmap for the successful launch and operation of both facilities.  



Qualifications:
-  Healthcare Management, Public Administration, or related field.  
- **Proven experience** in market research, business planning, or healthcare industry analysis.  
- Strong knowledge of state regulations and compliance requirements in the assisted living and group home sectors**.  
- Excellent analytical and organizational skills with attention to detail.  
- Proficient in financial modeling, cost analysis, and strategic planning.  
- Exceptional communication and report-writing abilities.  

---

Key Competencies:  
- Attention to Detail: Ensures accuracy in research, compliance, and reporting.  
-Analytical Thinking: Ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions.  
- **Communication Skills:** Clearly explains complex regulations and financial information.  
- **Problem-Solving:** Identifies challenges and provides effective solutions.  



Application Process:
To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and a sample of previous research work related to healthcare, assisted living, or group home industries.  



Note:  
This job description is crafted to provide comprehensive research and strategic planning necessary for the successful establishment of an Assisted Living Facility and Group Home, ensuring all legal, financial, and operational requirements are met.

title: Data Analytics and Dashboard Specialist to set up a multi-channel performance tracking dashboard
description:
We are a UK-based Digital Marketing Agency and are seeking a data analytics and dashboard specialist to set up a multi-channel performance tracking dashboard for our B2B marketing campaigns. The dashboard should integrate data from various marketing platforms, ad networks, outreach tools, and website analytics to provide a single source of truth for evaluating campaign performance.

The goal is to consolidate data from LinkedIn, Facebook, Google Ads, Email Outreach (Instantly.ai), Email Retargeting (MailerLite), and LinkedIn Outreach (Skylead) into a real-time, automated dashboard using Databox or an equivalent platform.

Project Objectives:
• Integrate data from all relevant marketing channels (LinkedIn Ads, Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Email, Outreach, and GA4)
• Automate data flow for tracking impressions, CTR, website visits, and conversion rates
• Implement UTM tracking across all sources to accurately measure attribution
• Create a dashboard that provides real-time visibility into marketing performance
• Enable filtering by channel, campaign, and conversion event
• Ensure scalability for tracking client campaigns in the future

Required Integrations:
The dashboard should include the following data sources:

1️. Social & Paid Ads Performance Tracking
✅ LinkedIn Organic & Ads (CTR, Link Clicks, Website Visits)
✅ Facebook Organic & Ads (CTR, Link Clicks, Website Visits)
✅ Google Ads (CTR, Website Visits, Landing Page Performance)

2️. Email & Outreach Tracking
✅ Email Outreach (Instantly.ai) (Sent, Open Rate, Replies, Call Bookings, CTR to Website)
✅ Email Retargeting (MailerLite) (Sent, Open Rate, CTR to Website, Conversion Rate)
✅ LinkedIn Outreach (Skylead) (Connection Requests, Reply Rates, Call Bookings, CTR to Website)

3️. Website & Lead Tracking (Google Analytics 4)
✅ UTM tracking for all campaigns (Source, Medium, Campaign)
✅ Website Visits from each channel
✅ Landing Page Conversion Rate (Lead Magnet Downloads ÷ Visitors)

Key Metrics to Track:
                                
Facebook Organic Posts
LinkedIn Organic Posts
LinkedIn Ads
Facebook Ads
Google Ads
Email Outreach (Instantly.ai)
Email Retargeting (MailerLite)
LinkedIn Outreach (Skylead)

Scope of Work:

Phase 1: Data Integration & UTM Setup
• Ensure all campaign links have UTM tracking
• Integrate Google Analytics 4 to track website visits & conversions
• Connect LinkedIn, Facebook, and Google Ads to Databox (or another dashboard tool)
• Integrate Instantly.ai, MailerLite, and Skylead for email & outreach tracking

Phase 2: Dashboard Creation & Automation
• Build a real-time dashboard that consolidates all marketing data
• Design filters & visualizations for easy tracking (e.g., by channel, campaign, and conversion type)
• Set up automated reports & alerts for key performance indicators (KPIs)

Phase 3: Testing & Optimization
• Verify data accuracy across all platforms
• Optimize dashboard for usability & insights
• Provide documentation or training session on how to use the dashboard

Ideal Candidate:
We are looking for an experienced data analyst, BI specialist, or marketing analytics expert with:
✅ Proven experience setting up Databox, Google Data Studio, or similar dashboards
✅ Strong knowledge of Google Analytics 4, UTM tracking, and campaign attribution
✅ Experience integrating LinkedIn Ads, Facebook Ads, Google Ads, and email platforms
✅ Ability to automate data pipelines & reporting
✅ Excellent communication & willingness to support ongoing client projects

Project Timeline & Budget:
• Required completion time: 1-2 weeks
• Budget: Open to proposals based on experience & scope

How to Apply:
Please provide the following when applying:
1. Examples of similar dashboards you have built (Databox, GA4, or other tools)
2. Your experience with marketing analytics & automation
3. Your availability & estimated timeline for completion
4. Your rate for this project + potential ongoing support costs

Future Work Potential:
This is a long-term opportunity for the right freelancer. If this project is successful, we will require ongoing support for tracking & reporting client campaigns, setting up dashboards for clients, and optimizing marketing performance.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Guide me on a call to build a Make.com Sales Meeting Research Automation Project
description:
*Guide me on a call to build a make.com automation*

Looking for a Make.com expert to guide me on a call to build an automation that:
1. Monitors my Google Calendar for upcoming sales meetings
2. 24 hours before each meeting, automatically researches the prospect and their company
3. Creates a detailed research brief following our template
4. Delivers it via email/Google Doc

Important: I want to build this myself with your guidance during screen-sharing sessions. This is not a project for someone to build independently.

Why This Matters
I sell sales technology software. Before every meeting, I need to understand:
- The prospect's sales organization and processes
- Their current challenges and growth plans
- The leader's background and likely priorities
- Areas where our solution could help them


What We Have Ready
1. Accounts & Access:
   - Make.com account
   - Google Workspace (Calendar + Gmail)
   - Claude API access
   - Google Drive for storage
   - Research brief template

2. Data Requirements:
   - Know exactly what data points we need
   - Have example of ideal output
   - Clear about public data sources
   - Template for final brief

Core Technical Requirements

1. Calendar Integration
Must:
- Monitor Google Calendar for new meetings
- Identify external vs internal meetings
- Extract attendee details
- Trigger process 24h before meeting

2. Data Gathering
Need to collect:
- Company information
- Leader's background
- Sales team structure
- Recent company changes
From public sources like:
- Company websites
- LinkedIn public pages
- Job boards
- News sites

3. Analysis & Processing
Using Claude API to:
- Analyze gathered data
- Identify patterns
- Generate insights
- Structure information

4. Output Generation
Create:
- Structured research brief
- Source citations
- Confidence levels
- Delivery via email/docs

Implementation Process

Working Format
- Screen sharing session
- You guide, I implement
- Focus on understanding

What I Need From You

Required Experience
- Advanced Make.com scenarios
- API integrations
- Data processing
- Error handling
- Teaching/guidance skills

Your Proposal Should Include
1. Your Experience:
   - Similar projects
   - Make.com expertise
   - Teaching approach

2. Technical Plan:
   - Implementation approach
   - Potential challenges
   - Solution architecture

3. Practical Details:
   - Time estimate
   - Cost estimate
   - Availability

Example Output
To understand the depth of research needed, here's an example of what a good brief looks like:

---

Company & Leader Analysis: TechGrowth Solutions
Meeting with: Alex Rivera, Director of Sales Operations

Alex's Journey & Context

Career Progression (All dates/titles from LinkedIn):

1. StartupCo - Sales Ops Analyst (1.5 years)
   [FACT - LinkedIn]:
   - First sales ops role
   - Company had ~50 employees at the time
   
   [INFERRED from company size/stage]:
   - Likely focused on foundational systems and reporting
   - Probably worked with small sales team (10-15 sellers)

2. Enterprise Tech Co - Sales Systems Admin (2 years)
   [FACT - LinkedIn]:
   - Technical sales ops role
   - Worked in enterprise software company
   - Company had 500+ employees
   
   [INFERRED from role & company type]:
   - Focus on sales tech stack and integrations
   - Exposure to enterprise sales processes

3. FastGrowth SaaS - Sales Ops Manager (2.5 years)
   [FACT - LinkedIn + Company Press]:
   - First management role
   - Company raised Series C during their tenure
   - Company grew from 100 to 300 employees
   
   [FACT - Their LinkedIn Posts]:
   - Led ops during major team expansion
   - Built new territory models
   
   [INFERRED from company stage]:
   - Handled comp plan development
   - Built scalable processes

4. TechGrowth - Director of Sales Ops (11 months)
   [FACT - LinkedIn + Job Posts]:
   - First director-level role
   - Currently hiring ops team members
   - Company in post-Series B phase
   
   [FACT - Their LinkedIn Activity]:
   - Posts about scaling operations
   - Engaging with content about sales tech
   
   [INFERRED from role + company stage]:
   - Leading strategic ops initiatives
   - Building out ops function

Role Context & Implications

Current Position Deep-Dive
[FACT - LinkedIn]:
- Director of Sales Ops at Series B enterprise software company
- 11 months in role
- First ops leadership hire at this company

Organizational Context
[INFERRED from Role + Stage]:
- Likely reports to VP Sales/CRO
- Building ops function from ground up
- Only strategic ops decision maker
- "Player-coach" role (both strategic and tactical)

Key Metrics & Pressures
[INFERRED from Role + Company Type]:
- Board/Investor focus:
  * Predictable revenue growth
  * Pipeline metrics
  * Forecast accuracy
  * Sales productivity metrics

[INFERRED from Series B + Enterprise]:
- Sales leadership focus:
  * Reducing 6+ month sales cycles
  * Improving win rates
  * Territory optimization
  * Process standardization

Daily Reality
[INFERRED from Role + Stage]:
Time Allocation:
- 30% Firefighting/reactive work
- 25% Supporting immediate sales needs
- 20% Strategic planning/processes
- 15% Tool evaluation/implementation
- 10% Reporting/analytics

Typical Week:
- Monday: Forecast meetings & pipeline reviews
- Tuesday: Sales team requests & process issues
- Wednesday: Strategic planning & tool evaluation
- Thursday: Stakeholder & team meetings
- Friday: Board/executive reporting

Resource Constraints
[INFERRED from Stage + Role]:
- Limited ops headcount
- Tight tool budget
- Technical debt from startup phase
- Manual processes needing automation
- Competing stakeholder priorities

Political Landscape
[INFERRED from Role + Enterprise Sales]:
- Managing up to CRO/VP Sales expectations
- Balancing experienced AE requests
- Navigating technical vs. sales priorities
- Justifying process changes
- Building credibility with leadership

Core Tensions
[INFERRED from Role + Technical Sale]:
- Speed vs. scalability
- Standardization vs. flexibility
- Quick fixes vs. long-term solutions
- Data quality vs. sales productivity
- Process compliance vs. sales autonomy

Conversation Starters

[Based on Role + Stage Inferences]:
1. "How's the balance between strategic planning and daily operations working out in this growth phase?"

[Based on Career + Company Context]:
2. "Curious about your experience building out sales ops from scratch here versus scaling it at FastGrowth - what's been most surprising?"

[Based on Role Tensions]:
3. "Given your technical background and now managing enterprise sales ops - how do you balance process standardization with sales team flexibility?"

title: Cost Analysis
description:
I am looking for:

Cost-Savings Analysis
1. A cost-savings analysis showing how much my product saves people money by replacing in-home products. (Product list will be provided but much research needs to be done) Please include a spreadsheet showing how the data was calculated, where it came from, and how it was determined, such as, average use per person per day per product, etc. Focus solely on using product prices from Amazon.com. File must be able to be updated by us later if prices fluctuate.

Environmental Footprint Analysis
1. Analysis demonstrating the amount of plastic saved by individuals who invest in my machine who replace in-home products (Same list of products as above).
2. Analysis demonstrating the amount of plastic saved by individuals who invest in my machine who used to drink out of plastic water bottles and now do not.
3. Combined environmental stewardship analysis

Presentation of the data for customers as:
a) An easy to understand 1-pager guide (spreadsheet format) for my customers to understand the products this machine replaces and average monthly savings for a family of 4 (Mother, Father, Sister, Brother) so essentially some products are only going to be used by the Mother and Sister like make up remover, etc. using lower to middle class products (purchased from Walmart, Amazon, CVS, Rite Aid in the analysis to be as realistic as possible)
b) If possible, I would like a 1 pager visual demonstrating the environmental footprint saved by my device but if design is not in your wheelhouse, I'm more interested in the data analysis side of things for this project!

Resources must be branded my brand colors and themes, etc. and must be editable for future changes.

The goal is to show that my product is a "no-brainer" for people to purchase, just with the savings alone! Not to mention all the health benefits.

title: Real Estate Investment Deal Analyst
description:
Job Title: Deal Analyst

Role Overview:
The Deal Analyst will be responsible for conducting comprehensive deal evaluations and due diligence to support investment decision-making. This role involves analyzing market conditions, assessing financial and legal documents, and synthesizing key deal insights. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively within a team of fund managers and legal professionals.

Key Responsibilities:

Deal Evaluation & Analysis:

Conduct in-depth market analysis for potential investments, including demographics, economic indicators, and competitive landscape.

Assess business plans, financial statements, and underwriting assumptions to validate deal projections.

Review and verify key financing terms, ensuring alignment between term sheets and deal expectations.

Due Diligence & Risk Assessment:

Perform holistic due diligence across multiple deal types, including self-storage, mobile home parks, multifamily apartments, medical office buildings, and business acquisitions.

Identify potential risks, inconsistencies, or red flags in deal structures and investment proposals.

Maintain a shared due diligence spreadsheet, updating insights and findings for fund managers.

Collaboration & Communication:

Work closely with fund managers to provide thorough deal assessments and support investment decisions.

Liaise with legal professionals (including paralegals) to ensure legal documents, such as PPMs and subscription agreements, reflect intended deal terms.

Participate in weekly deal review meetings, presenting findings and discussing investment viability.

Process Optimization & Reporting:

Develop structured reports summarizing deal strengths, weaknesses, and overall investment viability.

Manage the inputs for deal analytics models, ensuring accurate financial projections and investor return calculations.

Continuously refine due diligence processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

Expectations & Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in finance, real estate, economics, or a related field (preferred but not required).

Experience in real estate investment analysis, private equity, or fund management is highly desirable.

Strong proficiency in financial modeling, Excel, and data interpretation.

Ability to analyze and interpret market data, business plans, and financial agreements.

Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple deals simultaneously.

Strong communication skills to convey deal insights to fund managers and legal teams.

Detail-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced investment environment.

Time Commitment & Compensation:

Estimated workload of 5-15 hours per deal, depending on deal complexity and due diligence requirements.

Compensation structure to be determined based on deal volume and analyst experience.

Flexibility to scale workload based on fund activity and deal flow.

This role presents a unique opportunity to work closely with experienced fund managers, gain exposure to diverse investment opportunities, and refine deal analysis expertise in a hands-on, collaborative setting. If you are detail-oriented, analytical, and passionate about real estate and investment analysis, we encourage you to apply.
skills: ['Financial Modeling', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Cryptocurrency', 'Business Analysis', 'Content Writing', 'Financial Analysis', 'Blockchain']

title: Experienced Real Estate Analyst Needed – Florida Market Report for Real Estate Investment Fund
description:
I am looking to hire a highly skilled real estate analyst to conduct a comprehensive market study of the Florida real estate market, comparing data from 18 months ago to the present. This report will be used to raise capital for a real estate investment fund, so it must be detailed, investor-focused, and data-driven.

The report should provide a deep analysis of market trends across all property types, including residential, commercial, multifamily, distressed properties, foreclosures, tax deeds, and reverse mortgages. The goal is to identify key indicators of a market shift, highlighting emerging investment opportunities and providing actionable insights for potential investors.

The right candidate must have direct access to reliable real estate data sources and be able to deliver a high-quality, research-backed investment report that will appeal to high-net-worth individuals, institutional investors, and private capital firms.

Key Data Points for the Report (Investor-Focused)
1. Market Trends & Performance Analysis
Active Listings – Inventory growth over the past 18 months
Months of Inventory (Absorption Rate) – Identifying when the market flips from a seller’s market to a buyer’s market
Sales Volume & Home Price Trends – Median sale prices, high/low ranges, and fluctuations over time
Days on Market (DOM) – Measuring how long properties take to sell
2. Investment Opportunity Indicators
Price Reductions & Seller Concessions – Indications of a softening market
Foreclosures & Tax Deed Sales – Volume of distressed sales and tax-delinquent properties available for investors
Institutional & Hedge Fund Activity – Tracking large investor movements in Florida real estate
Cash vs. Financed Purchases – Understanding investor vs. end-user participation in the market
3. Mortgage & Distressed Property Trends
Reverse Mortgage Defaults – Identifying financial distress among older homeowners
Foreclosure Filings & Bank-Owned (REO) Sales – Monitoring distressed assets for investor acquisitions
Mortgage Delinquencies & Loan Modifications – Early warning signs of financial strain in the market
4. Market Analysis by Property Type
Residential (Single-Family, Condos, Townhomes) – Market trends, price movements, and inventory shifts
Commercial Real Estate (Office, Retail, Industrial, Mixed-Use) – Evaluating the impact of remote work and business shifts
Multifamily Properties (2-4 Units & Large Apartment Complexes) – Rental market trends, cap rates, and occupancy rates
Vacant Land & New Construction – Developer activity and new building permits
Distressed & Tax Deed Properties – Volume, availability, and investor demand for undervalued assets
5. Florida-Specific Investment Considerations
Tax Deed Auctions & Property Liens – Opportunities in distressed tax-delinquent properties
Property Insurance Crisis – Rising costs and the impact on market affordability
Zoning & Policy Changes – Local and state legislative changes affecting real estate investments
Economic Indicators – Unemployment, wage growth, and migration trends driving demand
Ideal Candidate:
✅ Experienced real estate analyst with access to MLS, CoreLogic, ATTOM, county tax deed auction data, and foreclosure records
✅ Background in real estate investment research, market forecasting, and financial modeling
✅ Ability to create a high-quality, investor-focused report with compelling data visualization (charts, graphs, tables)
✅ Must cite all data sources and provide transparent methodology
✅ Understanding of foreclosure, tax deed, and distressed asset investing in Florida

Project Scope & Deadline:
Completed report due by February 19th
Deliver a professional, investor-ready report (formatted for presentations and fundraising)
Include detailed insights, forecasts, and risk assessments
Provide clear, actionable investment strategies based on the data
Why This Report Matters:
I believe Florida’s real estate market is undergoing a rapid transition to a buyer’s market, creating unique opportunities for investors. With increasing inventory, longer days on the market, and rising distressed asset availability, now is the time to position a real estate fund for acquisitions.

This report will be a key tool in raising capital from investors who want to take advantage of market shifts. It must clearly outline the risks and opportunities while providing concrete data to support investment decisions.

If you have the experience, data access, and analytical expertise to produce a high-quality real estate investment report, I’d love to work with you!

Please include samples of previous investor-focused real estate reports when applying.
skills: ['Industry Knowledge', 'Real Estate Investment Assistance', 'Cryptocurrency', 'Business Analysis', 'Content Writing', 'Financial Analysis', 'Blockchain']

title: Web Analyst for Startup Project
description:
About Elly Analytics:

Our mission is to make advanced full-funnel analytics accessible and affordable for businesses that can't hire a data analytics team.
The company was founded in 2019 by experts in performance marketing with over a decade of experience. For the last two years, we've been focusing on the US market and have achieved great results.
We've secured a $1 million investment and continue to grow, doubling our size every year. This growth is driven by effective sales channels and strong [client testimonials](https://ellyanalytics.com/case-studies) from the US, showcasing the high quality of our product.
As we keep expanding, we’re always on the lookout for new team members. You can check out our current job openings below.

We are a fully remote company with team members from different countries. Our workflow is flexible, focusing on the results and efforts you put in, rather than controlling your time.
Elly prides itself on having a very open culture. You can freely speak up and be heard by the founders, ask questions, and receive honest answers.
Join the Elly team to grow together in the US market — the biggest, most challenging, and most competitive market in the world.

What you'll need to do:

As a web analyst, you will be part of our Product team and will

- Provide Expert Support for Ongoing Projects:
    - You will be responsible for diagnosing and fixing web analytics issues, particularly those related to Google Analytics and advertising platforms conversion tracking.
    - As a subject matter expert, you may participate in client meetings to offer insights and solutions for web analytics setups.
    - You'll take ownership of the quality and consistency of web analytics data across our entire project portfolio.
- Contribute to Product Development:
    - As a part of our product team, you will use your knowledge and insights from projects to ensure our product evolves to proactively prevent these issues in the future.
- Strengthen the expertise of the Product team by sharing your knowledge and mentoring team members

Requirements:

We're seeking a candidate who meets the following requirements:
—  3+ years in web analytics with a strong portfolio of custom conversion setups.
—  Expertise in Google Analytics 4 and tracking online/offline conversions.
—  Experience configuring advertising platform conversions.
— Possesses upper-intermediate or advanced English language skills and native level of Russian.


Please note that you must be available five days a week and have at least five working hours overlap with the team and clients (PST/PDT time zone).


Perks and Benefits:

— Professional growth: Opportunity to grow to Team Lead level and lead own team;
— Work remotely: Live and work wherever you like!
— Employment: via Deel contract.


Hiring Process:

Do you fit this role and want to join our team?
These are the following steps:

1. Apply for a job →

2. Complete a short survey about your experience →

3. Meet our team at the 1st interview →

4. Meet with our team lead of analysts →

5. Review results with our co-founder →

Be hired and join us!

We value time, so the process takes up to two weeks, and our test assignments are paid regardless of the results.

Elly prides itself on having a very open culture. You can freely speak up and be heard by the founders, ask questions, and receive honest answers.

Join the Elly team to grow together in the US market — the biggest, most challenging, and most competitive market in the world.



  The Role:

As a Power BI Analyst, you will be the creative force behind the visuals of our flagship analytics product. Your work will directly shape how users experience and interact with critical insights, making you an essential part of our product team’s success.

Key Responsibilities:

- Lead the design and development of the Power BI structure for our main analytics dashboard, creating impactful, user-friendly visuals that bring data to life,
- Collaborating with the Product team to continually enhance our analytics product and stay ahead of the curve.
- Occasionally craft custom dashboards and reports for clients, showcasing your ability to tailor solutions to unique business needs.

  Who We Seek:

We’re looking for a talented Power BI Analyst who brings the following to the table:

- Proven expertise in Power BI, with a strong grasp of advanced vizualization techniques, field parameters, calculation groups, and complex DAX measures,
- Experience working with external tools like Tabular Editor,
- Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and transformation tasks,
- Familiarity with marketing analytics, web analytics (GA UA, GA4, GTM), and advertising platforms (Google Ads, FB/Instagram) is a plus but not required,
- Upper-intermediate or advanced English language skills; native-level Russian proficiency is essential.

Please note that you must be available five days a week and have at least five working hours overlap with the team and clients (PST/PDT time zone).


Perks and Benefits:

Competitive salary: Up to $3,500 before tax monthly;

Professional growth: Opportunity to grow to Senior level and lead own team;

Work remotely: Live and work wherever you like!

Home office setup: Laptop, software, and anything else you may need for work;

Professional development: We cover 50% of the costs of relevant educational activities;

Vacation time: Annual leave (twice a year for two weeks) + holidays;

Employment: via Deel contract.


Hiring Process:

Do you fit this role and want to join our team?
These are the following steps:

1. Apply for a job →

2. Complete a short survey about your experience →

3. Meet our hiring team at the 1st interview →

4. Do a live test assignment at the 2nd interview →

5. Review results with our team →

Be hired and join us!

We value time, so the process takes up to two weeks, and our test assignments are paid regardless of the results.

About the Role
IB is a consultancy dedicated to helping UK manufacturers expand into the US market. Familiarity with US market regulations, tariffs, and distribution models.
A strong sense of curiosity and problem-solving ability to navigate complex business landscapes.
Equal Opportunity Statement

Why Join Us?
