title: Real Estate Data Analyst – Property Comps Specialist
description:
APPLICANTS MUST READ THE FULL POSTING AND FOLLOW THE TWO-STEP APPLICATION PROCEDURE. ANY INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL BE EXCLUDED.

Are you detail-oriented, analytical, and passionate about real estate data? Do you have a keen eye for property valuations and enjoy deep-diving into numbers to identify profitable opportunities? If so, we’re looking for you!

Who We Are
Lightning Capital House Buyers is a successful and growing real estate company seeking standout Property Comps Specialist to join our hardworking and dynamic team. We are looking for a skilled Real Estate Data Analyst to help us make accurate and informed decisions.

CORE VALUES
We’re looking for a tenacious person who wants to serve and add value to the growth of our company while bettering their own life! Someone who lives out our core values – Integrity: WE ALWAYS DO THE RIGHT THING, Positive "can do" Attitude, Strives to Exceeds Expectations in Everything We Do, Team Player (Always willing to step in and help out), Results Over Excuses.

Who You Are
You’re not just someone who looks at numbers—you interpret them. You thrive on structure, precision, and uncovering insights that others might miss. Your behavioral strengths align with those of an Artisan, Specialist, or Scholar:

✅ Artisan – You have a keen eye for detail, love perfecting your craft, and enjoy refining your methods to deliver accurate property valuations.
✅ Specialist – You’re methodical, process-driven, and take pride in doing things the right way every time. You value expertise and precision in your work.
✅ Scholar – You love research, deep analysis, and using data to make well-informed decisions. You seek patterns, trends, and logic to guide your conclusions.

Your Key Responsibilities
Comping Properties: Analyze real estate market data to determine accurate property values based on comparable sales.
Data Research & Entry: Pull and organize property data from MLS, PropStream, Zillow, and other platforms.
Market Analysis: Identify trends, potential deals, and ARVs (After Repair Values) to help our acquisitions team make data-backed decisions.
Reporting: Provide clear and concise property analysis reports that guide purchasing decisions.

What You Bring to the Table
Experience comping properties using MLS, Zillow, PropStream, BatchLeads, or similar tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a high level of accuracy in data interpretation.
Ability to work efficiently and meet deadlines in a fast-moving real estate environment.
Familiarity with real estate wholesaling, fix & flip, or buy-and-hold investment strategies is a plus.
Reliable internet connection and ability to work 10 AM – 7 PM EST.

Location: Remote
Work Schedule: Monday-Friday 10 AM – 7 PM EST
Pay: $3 - $6 per hour

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS - 2-STEP PROCESS (ALL APPLICATIONS WILL BE DISCARDED THAT HAVE NOT COMPLETED THESE 2 STEPS)

1. PLEASE SEND AN EMAIL TO ARLYN, THE OPERATIONS ASSISTANT AT OPERATION(at)LCHOUSEBUYERS(dot)COM WITH A SUBJECT LINE: APPLICATION FOR EXPERIENCED PROPERTY COMPS SPECIALIST -UW

ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS:
Please tell us about your property comp experience and the tools/software used in comping.
What are you looking for in your next position?
What interests you about this specific role and our company?

2. PLEASE INCLUDE A PDF COPY OF YOUR UPDATED RESUME IN YOUR EMAIL.

**NOTE: This process allows the cream to rise to the top and lets us know that you pay attention to detail and can follow instructions**

Thank You!

employees

About Us
Perusall is a growing, early stage SaaS company that provides an interactive social learning platform for higher education. Through proprietary technology that transforms reading from
a solitary task into an engaging, social experience, our mission is to ensure that all students come to class prepared, engaged, and motivated to learn. We aim to advance behavioral science and AI research in the service of improving education — using our work at Perusall Labs and previous work at Harvard University to improve the Perusall platform and to help
students, educators, researchers, and society at large.

We are looking for a highly motivated, enthusiastic and skilled Financial Analyst to support our leadership team with financial analysis, forecasting, and reporting on a part-time or
periodic basis. This role will provide financial insights and support strategic decision-making by analyzing financial data, preparing forecasts, and contributing to board presentations
and company reporting. The ideal candidate will have experience in SaaS financial metrics, revenue modeling, and company financial planning, as well as proficiency in modern
presentation tools to create engaging reports for stakeholders

To ensure success as a Financial Analyst at Perusall, you should have a minimum of three years of experience in financial analysis, FP&A or corporate finance. A strong

Job Responsibilities

Key Qualifications and Experience

Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of three years of experience in financial analysis, FP&A or corporate finance

Compensation and Schedule
Flexible hours, based on workload and reporting needs.
Engagement may vary from weekly to periodic support around key reporting cycles. Competitive hourly rate or project-based compensation

Our Story
Perusall began following a major four-year research project at Harvard University; we created the platform to serve students in our classes, and then in 2015 built the business to bring our research to students and instructors everywhere. Perusall is now a profitable business that has served more than 4 million students, 95,000 instructors, at 6,000 educational institutions, in 117 countries.

title: Financial Data Collection (from standard Databases)
description:
I am hiring a freelancer to collect a set of additional variables to match with an existing database.

The existing database (attached) is a Mergers and Acquisitions Announcement database from US public firms with 654 observations.

It has seven variables:
- "AcquirorNameEikon": The name of the acquirer firm (as presented on the Eikon database.
- "ticker": the stock symbol used to identify the firm (in this case, the acquirer);
- "cusip8_comp": an 8-digit code extracted from Compustat that uniquely identifies the firm (in this case, the Acquirer).
- "event_date": the date when the Merger or Acquisition was announced;
- "TranscriptFile": a file name of the corresponding announcement transcript (not important for this study).
- "PrivateTarget": a variable which takes the value 1 if the acquired firm (or Target) is Private and 0 if the acquired firm (or Target) is Public

The variables I need to collect for each observation/event are the following:
- Acquisition premium (only for the events in which the Target is Public (i.e., when PrivateTarget=0)
- Overall number of Mergers and Acquisitions in the US in the quarter of the announcement date (as specified in "event_date")
- Total number of board members of the Acquirer
- Total number of independent board members of the Acquirer
- Binary variable taking the value of 1 if the CEO is also the Chairman of the Board and 0 otherwise)
- Analyst coverage (i.e., count of sell-side analysts issuing earnings forecasts or recommendations for a firm)
- Analyst recommendations (i.e., number of 1 (Strong Buy), ..., and 5 (Strong Sell) from all analysts).

The freelancer will have to find a suitable database from which to extract the required variables (some possible options could be Eikon, SDC, Compustat, etc.) and explain the collection process. For each variable, a column should be added to the attached file with the values for that variable.

This job is to be finished by February 23.

description:
Job Title: Amazon Promo Deals & Storage Cost Optimization Specialist

Job Description:
We are in urgent need of an experienced and highly skilled Amazon Promo Deals & Storage Cost Optimization Specialist to help minimize long-term storage fees, optimize inventory, and implement effective promotional strategies for slow-moving products. This role is critical to our company's profitability as we transition to a lean, cost-effective inventory strategy that aligns with our business goals.

Key Responsibilities:
Analyze and optimize Amazon storage strategy to minimize long-term storage fees and prevent overspending on inventory holding costs.
Conduct in-depth assessments of our current Amazon inventory logistics, storage, and fee structures to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement.
Develop actionable strategies to prevent overshipping and overstocking in expensive Amazon warehouses.
Identify slow-moving products and implement promotional deals, such as Lightning Deals, Coupons, and Discount Strategies, to improve sales velocity and reduce storage costs.
Advise the advertising team on running targeted campaigns to sell out slow-moving inventory.
Monitor and forecast inventory needs to balance supply and demand effectively while reducing storage fees.
Maintain a strong communication channel between the ads team and storage manager to align inventory strategies and promotional efforts.
Provide expert advice and solutions to address fee-related issues and drive immediate cost savings.
Deliver weekly reports outlining progress, challenges, and achieved results in reducing fees, storage volume, and promotional deal effectiveness.
Qualifications:
Deep understanding of Amazon storage fee logistics, inventory management, and FBA fee structures.
Proven track record of successfully reducing Amazon storage fees and optimizing inventory turnover.
Experience in Amazon Seller Central, including running promotional deals and coordinating advertising efforts.
Strong analytical skills to assess data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills to handle multiple tasks efficiently.
Ability to work independently, take full responsibility for cost reduction goals, and achieve measurable results.
Strong communication skills for reporting progress and collaborating with internal teams.
Knowledge of Amazon Seller Central tools and inventory management software is a plus.
What We’re Looking For:
A results-oriented professional who thrives on solving complex problems and achieving measurable outcomes.
Someone who is proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of taking ownership of this critical role.
An expert who can quickly understand our business model and implement cost-saving and sales-boosting strategies effectively.
Work Arrangement:
Remote position – EST time zone hours.
Work hours: Monday-Friday, 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM EST.
Compensation: $8/hour, 8 hours per day.
Weekly progress meetings to review results and align on strategies.
Performance-based bonuses for achieving significant cost reductions and successfully implementing promotional strategies.
If you have the expertise to optimize Amazon storage fees, boost slow-moving inventory sales, and enhance overall profitability, we want to hear from you! Apply now with your relevant experience, specific achievements in reducing Amazon fees, and your strategy for tackling this challenge.

title: Data Analyst needed for Excel data analysis and possible website crosswalk (quick turnaround)
description:
Project Requirements & Objective:
Perform data analysis and research and share findings. Use MS Excel, raw data files provided, online resources, and any other tools or resources at contractor's discretion, to identify instances where vendors are delivering similar services to and/or across 2 or more sub-organizations(known as bureaus) within the Department of Commerce(DOC).

The goal is to highlight evidence of such scenarios in a new Excel (.xlsx) output file and provide a summary of findings.

The purpose and business goal of this exercise is to enable the Department of Commerce to avoid duplicative costs via negotiation with vendors for a more competitive rate, or the removal of redundant contracts/services.

Objective Context/Background:

• If the vendor "Thundercat" is providing AWS brokerage services to MBDA(bureau 1), but providing cyber-security services to EDA(bureau 2) - that's not a significant or value-added analytics finding.........because separate services doesn't present a lot of opportunity for consolidation or cost savings with that one vendor.
• However, if that one/single vendor is providing the SAME exact product or service across 2 or more bureaus - then that's an analytical finding or outcome we want to document and point to in our discussions with our stakeholders

Tasks:
1. Review all data
2. Perform analysis to identify contract overlap across bureaus/organizations
3. Utilize external/public resources as needed to find out exactly which services/products were offered as part of contract
4. Try to realize the most granular levels of contract detail possible to ensure that 2/more bureaus are using the same exact product or service

Timeline:
1. Prefer to receive first draft of results/findings by end of Sunday (at 9PM EST U.S.)
2. This would allow for any updated iterations/revisions by 12Noon Monday (EST U.S.), based on review of Sunday's findings

Resources/Data:
1. DOC_FPDS_IT_Data_FY24_YTD_11142024 Excel - This file includes DOC data extracted from the PFDS system, and useful data inside this file includes, but is not limited to:
a. "vendors by bureau" tab
b. "FPDS filtered for DOC" tab
i. Column AP
ii. Column CH - "master_piid"
iii. Column CN - "naics_code"
iv. Column CO - "naics_description"
v. Column CS - "piid" - this is a code that often times aligns with the "Award ID" that allows you to research more details about the product/services provided
vi. Column DD - "product_or_service_description"
c. "vendors with most bureaus" tab
d. any other data within the files or via external website(s)
2. FPDS website - https://www.fpds.gov/fpdsng_cms/index.php/en/
3. USA Spending website - https://www.usaspending.gov/
4. Supplemental "DOC_Multi-Bureau_Vendor_Contracts" file

Outputs/Deliverables:
1. New/separate .xlsx with the cross-walked results
2. A combination of a written summary and/or report(s) that reflect the findings of the aggregation. I will leave it up to you to choose the most appropriate method for sharing/summarizing findings.
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Data Analysis', 'IBM SPSS', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Senior Recruiter in web3 / crypto space for Technical + Senior roles

### About Chainlabs.ai

Chainlabs is a data startup focused on enabling web3 analytics. We specialize in identifying blockchain address ownership and tracking addresses linked to illicit activities. Our work supports industry leaders like Nansen, Chainalysis, and Arkham in their wallet labeling efforts.

Our primary clients include anti-money laundering (AML) service providers, as well as law enforcement, traders, and academic researchers. Backed by Lunar Rails (200 employees), Chainlabs maintains the agility and independence of a startup while benefiting from financial stability and strong industry connections.

### **About the role**

We're looking for a **Senior Technical Recruiter & HR Specialist** to help us scale our team and hire top talent in the web3 space. This role is critical to our growth and requires someone who understands technical hiring, can manage end-to-end recruitment, and is skilled at evaluating candidates for both technical and leadership positions. There's also potential for a long-term engagement handling various HR management responsibilities.

title: Web Scraping POC
description:
We are currently scrapping 2500+ websites using Mozenda.  This is a POC (proof of concept) to completely reengineer the process by which this data is scrapped, stored, organized (via a data model), and self served to the consumer of the data (possibly via a BI tool).  

The objectives of the POC (phase 1) are as follows:

- Survey the best of breed and cost effective options for scrapping the data
- Run a POC on 5-10 sites.
- Extrapolate the cost of the process over 2500 websites covering
   - Setup (analyst, etc)
   - Maintenance
   - Recurring Costs (measured on a per website basis, quarterly)
- Options for the ETL of the data into a cloud data lake

The allocated time for this POC is 50 hours.  The target date for completion is end of February.

Once the POC is completed, the results are reviewed and additional phases will be up drawn up as standalone projects.

Tech stack can be a service provider (Octoparse, etc) or it can be a complete custom development on any credible technology.

title: Statistical Consultation – Review of Experimental Data Analysis
description:
Job Description:
I am seeking an experienced statistician or data analyst for a one-hour consultation to review the statistical analyses in my experimental study. The study investigates how prosumer vs. non-prosumer service providers impact consumer choices and perceived service quality.

Scope of the Job:
I need expert feedback on the following key aspects of my analysis:

1. Manipulation check: Should we use Chi-square before pairwise comparisons, or is binary logistic regression sufficient?
2. Consumer choice analysis: We used binary logistic regression for choice (between two service providers across three conditions). Would multinomial logistic regression or another approach be more appropriate?
3. Mediation analysis: We used PROCESS Model 4 to examine whether perceived service quality mediates provider type and consumer choice. Is this the correct model for our design?
The study is based on 389 participants from a randomized experiment, and the analysis was conducted in SPSS and PROCESS Macro. More details will be provided upon selection.

Requirements:
. Expertise in SPSS, PROCESS Macro, and logistic regression
. Experience with experimental data analysis and mediation/moderation models
. Ability to provide clear explanations and recommendations
Budget & Duration:
Duration: 1-hour consultation
Budget: Open to proposals based on expertise
Please apply with your relevant experience and availability. Looking forward to your insights!
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Statistics', 'Data Analysis', 'Statistical Analysis', 'IBM SPSS', 'Neo4j', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Real Estate Analyst – Land Valuation / Comping
description:
Senior Real Estate Analyst – Land Valuation (Remote)

Only Apply If You Are the Best at What You Do.

We are looking for an elite land valuation specialist to take full ownership of our comping process. If you are someone who moves fast, thinks critically, and delivers precise, data-driven property valuations, this is your opportunity to join a high-performance real estate team.

This is not a beginner role.
This is not a task-based VA job.
This is an opportunity to be a key decision-maker in a fast-scaling land investment firm where your research directly impacts multi-million-dollar acquisitions.

If you’re looking for just another remote job, this isn’t it.
If you’re an absolute pro at land comping and want a role that rewards speed, accuracy, and ownership—keep reading.

Who We Are & Why This Role Matters

Higher Ground Land Company is not your average real estate business. We specialize in buying and selling vacant land across the U.S. Our acquisitions team moves at an elite speed, executing high-value deals every week.

Your role?
To be the foundation of our buying process.

Without precise comps, we don’t make offers.
Without smart valuations, we don’t close deals.
Without you, we can’t scale.

This is a high-stakes role for someone who thrives under pressure and takes complete ownership of their work.

What Winning Looks Like in This Role

You master the art of land comping using Redfin, Zillow, Land.com, MLS, county GIS maps, and other data tools to determine exact property values—no guessing.
You deliver fast, accurate comps based on sold and active listings—helping us make high-confidence investment decisions.
You analyze every detail that affects land value—road access, flood zones, wetlands, topography, existing structures, and market trends.
You complete 10-15 property comps per day with precision, allowing our acquisitions team to move at full speed.
You present your findings clearly in Google Sheets, making complex data easy to digest.
You own your role. This isn’t about checking off tasks—it’s about driving real business results.

Who You Are

You have direct experience comping land. House comping experience is not enough—you have worked in another land investment business and know how to evaluate vacant land.
You operate at an elite level. You can work fast and accurately under pressure—because you know every comp is a high-stakes decision.
You have a relentless attention to detail. You don’t just “pull data”—you analyze, verify, and refine comps to ensure accuracy.
You are tech-savvy. You’re comfortable with Google Sheets, mapping software, research tools, and high-volume data analysis.
You can explain your findings clearly. Your research makes or breaks a deal, and you know how to present data concisely.
You have the right setup. A fast computer and high-speed internet are non-negotiable—you’ll be working in a high-speed workflow where every second matters.

What We Offer

Competitive Pay: $5-7/hr (based on experience)
Flexible Hours: Full-Time or Part-Time (We want the right person, not just a warm body.)
Fully Remote: Work from anywhere in the world
Growth Potential: Top performers rise fast in our company. If you execute at a high level, there’s long-term opportunity here.

This Role is Not for Everyone.

If you need constant direction, this isn’t for you.
If you’re looking for an easy paycheck, look elsewhere.
If you thrive in high-performance environments and want to play a mission-critical role in a fast-growing company—apply now.

We don’t hire average.
We hire the best.

If that’s you, let’s talk.

**Upwork Job Posting: Freelance Advertising Analyst (Magic Brief Monitoring)**  

🔍 **Looking for a detail-oriented freelancer to conduct weekly ad monitoring on Magic Brief!**  

**📌 Job Overview:**  
We need a freelancer to analyze and document the best-performing **static advertisements (non-video)** every week using Magic Brief. Your role will involve identifying top ads in **Insurance, Real Estate, and Freelancing/Accounting**, capturing screenshots, and organizing them in a shared Google Sheet.

✅ Select **4 ads per industry** (Insurance, Real Estate, Freelancing/Accounting)  
✅ Capture screenshots & name files systematically (e.g., `Brand_Industry_Date.png`)  
✅ Upload data to a Google Sheet with ad details & descriptions  
✅ Ensure accuracy and notify the team once completed  

**💡 Ideal Candidate:**  
🔹 Detail-oriented and **organized**  
🔹 Experienced with ad analysis or marketing research  
🔹 Comfortable using **Magic Brief & Google Sheets**  
🔹 Can work **independently** and meet deadlines  

💰 **Budget: TBD (Competitive rate based on experience)**  
📅 **Long-term opportunity (weekly task)**  

🚀 If you're skilled in ad research & data entry, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now with examples of past research or marketing analysis work.

title: CRE Capital Markets Analyst
description:
CRE Capital Markets Analyst

Job Title: Financial Analyst (Commercial Real Estate)
Reports to: Managing Partner
Employment Status: Part-Time with potential for Full-Time

About the Company:
We are partners in securing the financial backbone for commercial real estate ventures across the United States. We specialize in creating custom financing solutions, navigating through the complexities of debt placement and equity raising with a hands-on approach that has set us apart in the industry. Our extensive network of lenders and diverse loan program options ensures that our clients receive financing that is aligned with their unique loan requirements. From the initial application to the final handshake at closing, our team of mortgage specialists and in-house closing experts streamline the loan process, delivering exceptional service and value. We have secured over $250M in loans for our clients and are dedicated to accelerating the loan acquisition timeline, ensuring they secure favorable mortgage terms efficiently, saving them both time and money.

About the Job Opportunity:
This position is focused on the placement of debt and/or equity for CRE and commercial middle-market businesses. As a CRE Capital Markets Analyst, you will be at the forefront of applying innovative financial strategies and solutions for our diverse portfolio of clients and commercial properties. This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in comprehensive market analysis, financial modeling, and deal structuring to optimize investment returns and asset performance. You will work closely with loan originators to develop and implement customized capital market strategies that align with our client’s objectives and the evolving commercial real estate landscape. This position is ideal for a proactive, analytical thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and is passionate about leveraging financial expertise to create value and drive growth.  Additionally, you will be responsible for identifying potential lenders and reaching out to them to establish and maintain strong financing relationships.

Key Responsibilities:
- Conduct comprehensive financial analysis and develop detailed financial models to support investment decisions, including cash flow projections, IRR calculations, and sensitivity analysis.
- Engage in all stages of transactions, from underwriting and market research to client meetings and closing events.
- Prepare debt and/or equity offering memorandums, leveraging strong financial modeling skills and market intelligence.
- Assist in structuring and negotiating financing terms for debt and equity transactions, ensuring optimal terms and conditions for clients.
- Drive the due diligence process, including financial audits and market analysis, to evaluate the feasibility and risk of investment opportunities.
- Apply technical proficiency in database use to extract valuable trends and data for pitch preparation and client meetings.
- Review and assess real estate documents to proactively identify and address potential issues that may affect positive outcomes of deals.
- Develop innovative financing alternatives and strategies and present these to senior producers.
- Establish and expand a client network through active industry engagement and participation in real estate organizations.
- Maintain strong relationships with clients, lenders, and other stakeholders, acting as a key point of contact and ensuring exceptional service delivery.
- Prepare detailed reports, and presentations for internal and external stakeholders, ensuring accuracy and clarity.
- Collaborate in weekly meetings to discuss deal flow, market conditions, and generate new client leads.

Desired Skills and Experience
- Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Real Estate, Economics, or related field.
- 2-5 years in commercial real estate and capital markets.
- Strong proficiency in financial analysis, modeling, and valuation techniques.
- Understanding of commercial real estate markets and trends.
- Proficiency in Excel
- Excellent analytical and quantitative abilities.
- Strong verbal and written communication skills.
- High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
- Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
skills: ['Financial Planning', 'Financial Modeling', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Business Analysis', 'Financial Analysis', 'Real Estate']

title: Data Visualisation Designer (Storyteller)
description:
We’re looking for a Data Visualisation Designer who can transform complex data into clear, engaging visual stories. You'll use design principles and data storytelling techniques to create dashboards, reports, and interactive visualisations that drive insight and captivate audiences.

This is a new role at Data Kraken, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to shape the position and introduce best practices as we continue evolving our data visualisation processes.

You’ll collaborate closely with analysts, engineers, and stakeholders to ensure visualisations are not just accurate but impactful.

If you're excited about crafting visual stories that make data more accessible and impactful, we'd love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:
-Design and build interactive dashboards, reports, and infographics that clearly communicate insights.

-Translate complex data into compelling visual narratives.

-Work with stakeholders to gather requirements and refine designs based on feedback.

-Collaborate with the Data Kraken team to ensure visualisations are accurate and align with business goals.

-Develop reusable design templates for internal and external projects.

-Ensure best practices for information design are followed, ensuring clarity, accessibility, and user engagement.

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!

- Creative & Tech-Savvy: You know how to take data and turn it into something visually striking. You have experience with BI tools, front-end technologies, and data storytelling.

- Collaborative: You’ll work closely with different teams, so being a strong communicator who can bring both technical and non-technical people on board is key.

-Detail-Oriented: Data accuracy and consistency are important, and you can spot discrepancies.

-Adaptable: You’re open to change and excited about shaping a role as we grow.
Proactive: You don’t just wait for direction—you think ahead, anticipate needs, and take action.

Experience & Skills:
- A strong portfolio showcasing data visualisation and design expertise (Essential).

-Proficiency in front-end web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, with D3.js or similar libraries being a plus) (Desirable).

-Familiarity with UX/UI principles for presenting data (Essential).

-Experience translating complex data sets into intuitive, engaging visuals (Essenial).

-Attention to detail, particularly when it comes to data accuracy (Essential).

-Ability to communicate design choices to both technical and non-technical audiences (Essential).

-Familiarity with motion graphics or animation for enhanced data storytelling (Desirable).

-Knowledge of accessibility standards for data visualisation (Desirable).

Send us your CV along with a portfolio or examples of your data visualisation work. We need to see what you can do, but it doesn’t have to be a formal portfolio—just something clean & easy to review that showcases your skills.

title: AI Web Search + Scrape + Analysis
description:
I'm looking for a [python?] script that will work with AI to:

1. Load in a .csv

2. Open websites listed in the .csv one-by-one
(ex. https://www.vairix.com/)

3. Find the "projects / case studies / success stories"  or equivalent page on that site
(ex. https://www.vairix.com/case-studies)

4. Open required sub-pages to gather more information on each project when necessary
(ex. https://www.vairix.com/case-studies/seekr)

5. Scrape the information listed on the page
(ex. Seekr Technologies Inc., an AI-driven company focused on delivering unbiased news, faced several challenges as they expanded:
Developing a front-end capable of delivering impartial news using AI
Creating tools to reduce sensationalized headlines and clickbait
Implementing political bias analysis in news content
Building AI solutions to analyze and categorize text and audio content
Assisting data analysts in categorizing information and building custom models
Maintaining high-quality software standards with reusable front-end tools
Ensuring product quality through robust QA processes
To address these challenges, Seekr enlisted VAIRIX to reinforce their development and QA teams.)

6. Have AI run analysis on this scraped information [analysis specs to be laid-out later]
(ex COMPANY SERVED: Seekr, INDUSTRY: mobile news platform, INDUSTRY GROWTH: 5/10, PROJECT REPEATABILITY: 1/10 )

7. Add parts of the analysis to a new columnn of the .csv

title: Motion Capture Data Extraction and Processing
description:
I am looking for an experienced data analyst with a strong background in biomechanics and motion capture data processing. The task involves extracting kinematic data from .CSV or .MAT files, computing Continuous Relative Phase (CRP) and Deviation Phase (DP), and delivering tables and visualizations of the results.

Scope of Work
1. Data Extraction:
Extract kinematic data for the following segments (labels will be provided):
Lx (Lumbar region)
Pelvis
Hip (Left and Right)
Knee (Left and Right)
Ankle (Left and Right)
Provide the extracted data in CSV or MATLAB format with clear labels.

2. CRP & DP Calculation
Compute Continuous Relative Phase (CRP) and Deviation Phase (DP) using formulas I provide.
Ensure correct phase angle calculations and data alignment.

3. Data Presentation
Deliver tables and charts for CRP and DP analysis.
Specify the format for tables and visualizations (e.g., Excel, Python plots, MATLAB figures).

Requirements
Experience with motion capture data processing.
Proficiency in MATLAB, Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas), or R.
Strong background in biomechanics and kinematic data analysis.
Familiarity with CSV and MAT file formats.
Ability to compute phase angles and apply vector coding techniques.

Deliverables
✅ Extracted motion capture data (CSV/MAT format)
✅ CRP & DP calculations (Excel or structured table format)
✅ Visualizations (MATLAB figures, Python plots, or Excel charts)
✅ Documentation on methodology used
skills: ['Data Integration', 'List Building', 'Data Extraction', 'Lead Generation', 'pandas', 'Data Scraping', 'Motion Capture Analysis']

title: Business Process Analyst and Documentation Specialist
description:
At DIGI Search, we specialize in delivering innovative, data-driven solutions in the dental marketing and advertising space.  
As we continue to grow, we’re looking for a highly skilled professional to help document and streamline our internal operations, ensuring our processes are clear, efficient, and scalable.

Key Skills & Experience for This Role
Here are the key qualifications and experiences to look for in candidates:

1. Documentation & Writing Experience
Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs): Experience in documenting internal workflows, business operations, and step-by-step guides.
Process Documentation: Ability to create flowcharts, process maps, and structured documentation that outlines business processes.
Knowledge Base Writing: Familiarity with documenting FAQs, troubleshooting guides, and instructional content for employees or customers.
Strategy & Business Guides: Ability to write business playbooks, operational strategies, and strategic business guides.
2. Technical & Business Understanding
Business Process Analysis: Experience in analyzing workflows and recommending improvements.
Operations & Systems Knowledge: Understanding of business operations, productivity tools, and remote team management best practices.
Familiarity with Project Management Tools: Knowledge of tools like Notion, Whimsical, Trello, Asana, ClickUp, or Monday.com for organizing documentation.
Technology & SaaS Experience (Preferred): We use SalesForce, WordPress, and a variety of other software to run our company.
3. Communication & Interviewing Skills
Active Listening: Must be able to jump on calls with you, ask clarifying questions, and extract key information.
Summarizing Complex Ideas: Ability to take what you say and turn it into well-structured, easy-to-understand documentation.
Collaborative Writing: Able to work with you iteratively, improving drafts based on feedback.
4. Efficiency & Independent Work
Fast Turnaround Time: Must be able to document information efficiently with minimal back-and-forth.
Autonomous Work Style: Since you’re the only one with this knowledge, they should be proactive in organizing and structuring content.
Detail-Oriented: The ability to document precisely while maintaining clarity.
Ideal Backgrounds for This Role
✔ Technical Writing – Those who have written SOPs, , knowledge bases, or user manuals.
✔ Business Process Analysis – Those who have mapped workflows, improved business processes, or written business documentation.
✔ Operations & Strategy Consulting – Professionals who have worked on business strategy guides, playbooks, or operational handbooks.
✔ Instructional Design or Training Development – Those who have created training manuals, onboarding documents, or employee handbooks.

title: Tableau Expert for E-Commerce Investment Due Diligence Optimization
description:
Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Tableau developer and data analyst to optimize our internal due diligence tool for evaluating prospective e-commerce investments. The existing Tableau file models e-commerce data, calculates key performance metrics, and visualizes insights but is currently inefficient, prone to errors, and difficult to troubleshoot. We need a freelancer who can refine the tool to enhance performance, usability, and long-term maintainability.

Key Responsibilities:
• Optimize and streamline the current Tableau file to improve speed and reduce errors.
• Improve data modeling and calculation efficiency to ensure accuracy and scalability involving cohort waterfall calculations, date/time data processing, table calculations, calculated fields etc.
• Enhance usability by making the tool more intuitive for future edits and modifications.
• Identify and fix performance bottlenecks, such as slow-loading dashboards and complex calculations.
• Provide clear documentation on how the Tableau file is structured and how to maintain it going forward.
• (Optional) Advise on best practices for integrating external data sources and automating updates.

Ideal Candidate:
• Expert-level proficiency in Tableau, including data modeling, calculated fields, and dashboard performance optimization.
• Strong understanding of e-commerce analytics, including sales metrics, conversion rates, and customer behavior.
• Experience working with large datasets and optimizing for performance.
• Ability to troubleshoot and simplify complex Tableau workflows.
• Strong communication skills to provide clear documentation and recommendations.

Project Scope & Timeline:
• This is a one-time project with the potential for ongoing work if further enhancements are needed.
• Expected timeline: 2-4 weeks, depending on the level of optimization required.

If you have experience optimizing Tableau files for investment analysis, e-commerce data, or similar use cases, we’d love to hear from you. Please include relevant examples of past work in your application.

title: Land Research & Analysis Specialist for Development Potential
description:
Description:
I’m looking for a detail-oriented researcher/analyst to help identify properties that are prime for future development. The ideal candidate will be skilled in using GIS tools, county websites, or other public databases to locate land that aligns with future land use maps, has access to utilities (especially sewer), and is near or within growing development corridors.

Responsibilities:

Property Identification

Use public records, GIS platforms, and future land use maps to find properties suitable for residential or commercial development.
Identify parcels that are in—or near—areas designated for higher-density or mixed-use zoning changes.

Utility & Infrastructure Review

Confirm access to utilities, especially sewer lines.
Check proximity to roads, water lines, and other infrastructure based on county/municipality data.

Location & Zoning Analysis

Assess property zoning and any publicly available information on planned rezoning or land use changes.
Compile a list of key zoning regulations or restrictions that could impact development.

Data Compilation & Reporting

Create organized spreadsheets or databases of identified properties, including addresses, parcel IDs, and relevant notes on zoning, potential usage, and feasibility.
Provide maps, screenshots, or relevant documentation to support recommendations.
Communication & Updates

Keep me updated on progress at agreed intervals (e.g., weekly).
Flag any high-potential leads immediately.

Qualifications & Skills:

Proven experience in land research, real estate analysis, or GIS (please highlight relevant projects).
Familiarity with future land use maps, zoning regulations, and municipal planning resources.
Ability to interpret parcel maps, tax assessor websites, and other public databases.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail—must be able to present data in a clear, concise format.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Preferred Tools or Platforms (not mandatory, but nice to have):

GIS software such as ArcGIS, QGIS, or similar.
Online land databases (county GIS, LandVision, Regrid, etc.).
Familiarity with local zoning codes, planning commission documents, or municipality websites.
Project Scope & Deliverables:

A list of X potential properties (we can set the target number together based on your research).
A spreadsheet with essential property details:
Parcel ID
Address or Coordinates
Current Zoning
Future Land Use / Zoning Potential
Proximity to Sewer or Utilities
Any Known Restrictions
Supporting Links/Documentation
Brief written summaries for each property explaining its development potential.
Budget & Timeline:

This will be an ongoing project as we evaluate multiple regions.
Ideal timeframe for first deliverables: within 1–2 weeks from project start.
skills: ['Contact List', 'Market Research', 'Automotive', 'Lead Generation', 'AI Fact-Checking', 'Online Research', 'Market Analysis', 'Data Entry']

title: GIS Specialist Needed for Renewable Energy Project
description:
We’re looking for an experienced GIS Analyst to assist with mapping utility projects in the United States, with a focus on electrical transmission systems and data center site suitability. If you have a strong background in these areas and are familiar with U.S. utility infrastructure, we’d love to hear from you!

What We’re Looking For

We’ll need help creating maps and GIS analyses that include:
• Transmission substations
• Transmission lines.
• Land parcels.
• Areas of suitable land near substations and transmission lines.
• Layers relevant to data center suitability, such as proximity to fiber optic networks, floodplain data, and cooling resources.
• Additional data layers to be discussed during the project.

3. Data Center Suitability Layers:
Research and add layers that evaluate site suitability for data centers, including fiber access, power capacity, and environmental factors.
4. Additional Layers and Analysis:
Collaborate on identifying and integrating other relevant data layers.

title: Remote Deal Originator for M&A Sourcing
description:
Job Posting: Deal Originator (Remote, Full-Time) | Private Equity Firm | TEEDUP

Overview

TEEDUP is a private equity firm focused on strategic acquisitions. With a goal of closing four deals by the end of 2025, we need to keep our pipeline full and efficient. As a Deal Originator, you will be responsible for sourcing and managing deals at the top of the funnel, ensuring a steady stream of opportunities for our Senior Analysts.

This role is critical in ensuring that deals progress through the pipeline efficiently so that our Senior Analyst can focus on high-value tasks. If you are detail-oriented, highly organized, and enjoy researching and identifying acquisition opportunities, this is a great opportunity to work in the private equity space.

Role & Responsibilities

The Deal Originator will focus on sourcing and qualifying deals based on TEEDUP’s acquisition criteria. Key responsibilities include:
• Deal Sourcing & Management
• Identify and source potential acquisition opportunities from brokers, deal scouts, online marketplaces, and direct outreach.
• Register and track new deals in TEEDUP’s CRM (GoHighLevel).
• Ensure each deal meets TEEDUP’s minimum deal criteria before passing it to the Senior Analyst.
• Work within the Pacific Standard Time (PST) schedule to coordinate with brokers and analysts.
• Pipeline Management & Qualification
• Enter 43 new deals per week into the pipeline.
• Move 22 deals per week to the Pre-Qualification stage.
• Progress 4 deals per week to the Discovery stage.
• Sign and manage NDAs (MNDAs), ensuring confidentiality agreements are in place.
• Attach and organize Confidential Information Memorandums (CIMs) to the CRM.
• Create deal folders in SharePoint and organize relevant documents.
• Conduct an initial CIM review to assess viability.
• Identify and filter out non-starters (e.g., deals outside the U.S., EBITDA below $1MM).
• Broker & Platform Outreach
• Engage with brokers via email to request CIMs and deal details.
• Search deal marketplaces (BizBuySell, BusinessBroker.net, BizQuest, DealStream, Transworld, Sunbelt, etc.).
• Use standard messaging templates to request deal information.
• Maintain organized communication logs with brokers and sellers.

Qualifications & Skills

To be successful in this role, you should have:
✔ Strong research and data entry skills – ability to accurately track and log deal information.
✔ Experience with CRMs (preferably GoHighLevel) or similar deal-tracking software.
✔ Attention to detail – ability to assess basic financials and key deal criteria.
✔ Ability to work independently – must be proactive in sourcing and tracking new deals.
✔ Strong written communication skills – professional email outreach and follow-ups.
✔ Basic understanding of financials – familiarity with EBITDA, revenue, and acquisition metrics.
✔ Previous experience in deal origination, private equity, investment banking, or M&A is a plus.

Compensation & Work Schedule

💰 Hourly Rate: $5 - $10 per hour (Based on experience)
⏳ Hours: Full-time (40 hours per week)
🌍 Location: Remote (Must be available during Pacific Standard Time (PST))
📈 Growth Opportunity: Potential to move into higher roles within TEEDUP as experience grows.

Why Join TEEDUP?
• Gain experience in private equity and deal origination.
• Work with an experienced acquisition team.
• Flexible remote work environment.
• Training and resources provided (CRM access, deal criteria, platform walkthroughs).
• Opportunity for long-term work based on performance.

Onboarding Process

You’ll receive:
✅ TEEDUP email & CRM access (GoHighLevel)
✅ Training on deal sourcing platforms (BizBuySell, BusinessBroker.net, etc.)
✅ Introduction to broker email lists & newsletters
✅ Access to SharePoint & deal-tracking systems
✅ Walkthrough of deal origination processes & messaging templates

Application Process

Interested candidates should apply with:
📄 Resume highlighting relevant experience
📧 A brief cover letter or message explaining why you’re a good fit
🔍 Any past experience with CRM systems, deal sourcing, or financial analysis

Join TEEDUP and help us close four deals by the end of 2025!

title: Experienced data analyst to help me understand my businesses data
description:
Experienced data analyst to help me understand my businesses data

I’m looking for an experienced data consultant or analyst to help me understand my data.

I’ve been running YouTube ads for my digital product, for over a year.

I have dozens of ad campaigns, each with multiple variations of sales pages, pricing, VSLs, designs, and copy.

Over time, I kept pausing campaigns as they became unprofitable and kept testing new variations.

I track my main stats in ClickMagick, which tells me the earnings per ad, but it doesn’t track which sales page, VSL, or price the traffic went to since I kept changing things live without setting up new tracking links.

As a result, my data is a complete mess—I can’t clearly see which ads, sales pages, pricing, or VSL versions actually worked best.

I have pages of clickmagick data, Adwords campaigns and data, various split tests I’ve run etc and I need someone to help me understand it all and create a google sheet to clearly use going forward to see what the data is actually telling me

title: Senior Technical Business Analyst – Healthcare & FHIR Integration
description:
Location: REMOTE - 6 month contract
Working hours: Mon through Fri, 8hours/day, 40 hours/week, US Business hours (Central time zone)
***YOU MUST UPLOAD YOUR RESUME IN MICROSOFT WORD***


JOB DESCRIPTION
Our client is seeking a Senior Technical Business Analyst with extensive experience in FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) implementation and troubleshooting, to support healthcare data exchange across multiple systems and clients. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Healthcare interoperability, HL7 FHIR standards, API integrations, and regulatory compliance (HIPAA, ONC, CMS Interoperability Rules).  

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
- Lead FHIR-based integration projects, ensuring seamless data exchange between EHRs, HIEs, payers, and third-party systems.  
- Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, map workflows, and define FHIR API specifications.  
- Troubleshoot and optimize FHIR data exchange, ensuring complixance with US Core, SMART on FHIR, and industry standards.  
- Perform FHIR conformance testing, validating API responses using Postman, HAPI FHIR, and Touchstone  
- Ensure compliance with HIPAA, ONC Cures Act, and CMS interoperability mandates for healthcare data access.  
- Document business and technical requirements, user stories, and integration workflows for multiple clients.  
- Support FHIR transformation and migration initiatives, mapping legacy data (HL7 v2, CCDAs, SQL) to FHIR resources.  

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
- 5+ years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst in healthcare IT.  
- Expertise in FHIR standards (R4, US Core, SMART on FHIR) and healthcare interoperability.  
- Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, OAuth 2.0, and FHIR-based authentication mechanisms.  
- Technical background in SQL, JSON, XML, and healthcare data standards
- Experience with EHR systems (Epic, Cerner, Meditech), HIEs, and payer-provider integrations.  
- Proficiency in data mapping, HL7 v2 to FHIR transformations, and FHIR profiling.  
- Hands-on experience with FHIR tools (Postman, HAPI FHIR, Redox, Azure API for FHIR, Mirth Connect).  
- Strong analytical, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills.  
- Knowledge of healthcare regulations (HIPAA, ONC, CMS).
- Strong communication skills (written and verbal)

PREFERRED -
- Familiarity with FHIR validation and conformance testing tools.

***YOU MUST UPLOAD YOUR RESUME IN MICROSOFT WORD, OTHERWISE YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED***

Key Responsibilities:

- Data Analysis: Review and analyze financial data, including bank statements and reservation software, to track revenue, expenses, and key performance indicators (KPIs) over the last two years.

title: Data Analytics
description:
Data Analytics is the process of examining and interpreting data to help organizations make informed decisions. Unlike data entry, which focuses on collecting and entering data into systems, data analytics involves analyzing that data to extract useful insights, identify patterns, and provide actionable recommendations.

Here's a breakdown of what the role typically entails:

Key Responsibilities:
Data Collection & Cleaning: Gathering data from various sources and ensuring it's accurate and usable. This often involves cleaning and transforming data to remove any inconsistencies or errors.

Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Analyzing data using statistical and visualization techniques to understand the relationships and patterns within it. This can include summary statistics, distributions, and identifying outliers.

Data Modeling & Analysis: Using techniques such as regression, classification, or clustering to build models that can predict outcomes or classify data. The goal is to create actionable insights that guide decision-making.

Visualization: Creating charts, graphs, and dashboards to present findings in a clear, visual way. This helps stakeholders understand complex data and makes it easier for decision-makers to act on the information.

Reporting & Communication: Presenting insights and recommendations to management or other stakeholders. This often involves writing reports or giving presentations to explain the results of analyses.

Tool Proficiency: Data analysts typically use software and tools like Excel, SQL, R, Python, Tableau, Power BI, or other data visualization and analysis platforms to perform their tasks.

Skills and Qualifications:
Analytical Thinking: Ability to look at data from different perspectives and extract meaningful insights.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages (like Python or R), data visualization tools (like Tableau), and data manipulation tools (like SQL).
Attention to Detail: Ensuring accuracy and consistency in analysis, as even small errors can lead to misleading conclusions.
Communication Skills: Presenting data and complex findings in a clear and understandable manner.
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Data Analysis', 'Google Analytics', 'IBM SPSS', 'Neo4j', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Data Analyst Needed for Mixpanel Experiment Analysis
description:
Objective:

We need a data analyst to perform an in-depth analysis of A/B tests results in Mixpanel (8 experiments). The goal is to identify clear user segments for which one variant performs better than the other and uncover how different user attributes (including combinations) influence test outcomes.




Key Tasks:

A/B Test Segmentation Analysis:

For each A/B test, determine the exact conditions under which one variant should be chosen over the other.

Provide a cohort breakdown, identifying which combinations of user attributes lead to better results for each variant.

If segments are too small, provide two versions of the segmentation:

A more granular segmentation.

A slightly broader segmentation with larger cohorts.

Influence of User Characteristics on A/B Test Results:

Analyze how each user characteristic (e.g., age, weight, goals, etc.) influences the test outcome.

Identify combinations of characteristics that significantly affect which variant performs better.

Provide statistical justification for findings (e.g., confidence levels, effect size).





Expected Deliverables:

Detailed breakdown per A/B test: When to use each variant, based on user characteristics.

Two segmentation models (if necessary): granular and broader segmentation.

Analysis of characteristic influence, including combined factors.







Requirements:

Strong experience in A/B test analysis, data analysis, and segmentation.

Expertise in statistical modeling and cohort analysis.

Ability to present insights in a structured and actionable way.

If you have experience in user segmentation and data analysis, we’d love to hear from you!
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Statistics', 'Data Analysis', 'IBM SPSS', 'Neo4j', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Data Analyst & Excel Automation Expert for Price Comparison (Python & Excel)
description:
Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst with expertise in Excel, Python, and data automation to help us refine our price comparison system between our platform and a competitor.

We retrieve competitor pricing data using a Python web scraping script, and your role will be to clean, structure, and automate the comparison process—adjusting for condition differences, club set variations, and pricing trends.

🔹 Key Challenge: Product names often do not match 1:1 between our data and the competitor’s. A model name in one source may contain an extension (e.g., shaft type, flex, special edition, etc.) that is missing in the other. We need intelligent matching techniques (such as fuzzy matching) to improve the comparison accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:
Process and clean pricing data retrieved via Python web scraping.
Match comparable products within the same category, ensuring accurate category-based comparisons.
Solve model name discrepancies using fuzzy matching, normalization techniques, or rule-based logic.
Adjust competitor prices based on condition differences and iron set composition (club count).
Develop an Excel-based model with automation for ongoing price comparisons.
Provide insights on pricing discrepancies and optimization opportunities.
Ideal Skills & Experience:
Strong Excel skills (XLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, conditional logic, VBA optional).
Python expertise, especially in data cleaning (Pandas), automation, and fuzzy matching (FuzzyWuzzy or similar libraries).
Experience in pricing analysis and competitor comparisons.
Familiarity with web scraping (you won’t build the scraper, but you must handle scraped data).
Data normalization techniques to handle naming inconsistencies.
Ability to work with CSV, Excel, and automate workflows.
Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver accurate and structured data insights.
Deliverables:
✅ A structured Excel file with price comparisons, automated matching, and adjustments.
✅ A robust methodology for updating pricing periodically.
✅ A refined price comparison model based on data insights.
✅ Suggestions for improving the model name matching process for better accuracy.

Budget & Timeline:
💰 Budget: $250-$500 (depending on experience and scope).
⏳ Timeline: Expected completion within 5-7 days.

Beyond goal-oriented, must be self-driven and personable. This can lead to a full-time, salary position. It will begin as part-time with about 20-30 hours per week.

Tax

General Ledger & Misc. Duties

- Prepare and post journal entries

- Maintain all files and records in accordance with policies and procedures in an organized manner

**Depending on background and experience, we may have alternative roles that incorporate controller and or financial analyst skills and tasks. If skills match, opportunity to work on:

Finance

title: Salesforce Administrator & Business Analyst
description:
Salesforce Administrator & Business Analyst

Company: Tasting Kitchen (TK) Media Group

About Us

Tasting Kitchen (TK) Media Group is a leading media brand renowned for our premium content across multiple channels: a high-end print magazine, a global website, dynamic social media platforms, a custom publishing division, a private events space in Hong Kong, and a creative agency. We connect audiences with the best of food, drink, travel, and luxury living.

We’re seeking a Salesforce Administrator & Business Analyst to own the day-to-day management of our Salesforce environment, focus on data integrity, and create insightful business reports. While some Salesforce development or coding experience is welcome, our primary need is someone who excels at administrative tasks, reporting, and overall CRM optimization.

Role Overview

As our Salesforce Administrator & Business Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring that Salesforce serves as a single source of truth for all client, prospect, and opportunity data. You will maintain clean records, build and update dashboards, and provide regular reports on sales activities, revenues, and costs. You’ll collaborate with leadership to analyze trends and recommend improvements in our sales and marketing processes.

Key Responsibilities
1. Salesforce Administration
• Manage all aspects of user setup (profiles, permissions, roles, and licenses).
• Configure standard Salesforce functionality (page layouts, list views, validation rules, flows).
• Import new leads and contacts from external sources (e.g., ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CamCard).
• Perform data cleanup and deduplication on a regular basis to ensure accuracy and reliability.
2. Data Analysis & Reporting
• Design and maintain custom reports and dashboards to track KPIs such as pipeline status, revenue forecasts, and campaign ROI.
• Generate weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports for leadership—focusing on sales trends, revenue by product line, event sponsorships, and other critical metrics.
• Proactively analyze Salesforce data to identify patterns, opportunities, or areas for improvement.
3. Process Optimization
• Partner with sales, marketing, and finance teams to streamline workflows and ensure Salesforce aligns with our business objectives.
• Identify inefficiencies in lead management, opportunity tracking, and reporting; propose solutions for continuous improvement.
• Maintain documentation of processes and best practices to ensure consistent usage across the organization.
4. User Training & Support
• Provide day-to-day user support, including basic troubleshooting, password resets, and guidance on best practices.
• Conduct periodic training sessions or create how-to guides to enhance user proficiency and adoption.
5. Collaboration & Cross-Functional Support
• Work closely with the finance team to align Salesforce data with cost and revenue reporting.
• Coordinate with event managers and editorial teams to ensure seamless tracking of event sponsorships and media partnerships.
• If applicable, assist with or oversee minor system enhancements, integrations, or automations (e.g., custom objects, flows) to improve efficiency.
6. Optional: Salesforce Development (Nice-to-Have, Not Required)
• If capable and interested, help with minor Apex or Lightning customizations.
• Partner with external developers (if needed) for more complex or specialized programming tasks.

Qualifications & Skills
• Essential
• Proven experience as a Salesforce Administrator (Salesforce Admin certification preferred).
• Strong skills in report building, dashboard creation, and data management.
• Familiarity with Sales Cloud features: leads, contacts, opportunities, forecasting, etc.
• Analytical mindset, capable of turning raw data into actionable insights.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in English.
• Preferred
• Salesforce Advanced Administrator certification or additional Salesforce certs.
• Basic familiarity with Apex/Lightning Components or willingness to learn (but coding is not the main focus).
• Previous experience working in media, publishing, or events industries.
• Exposure to marketing automation tools (e.g., Pardot, Marketing Cloud) or financial software integrations.
• Soft Skills
• Highly organized and detail-oriented, with an ability to multitask and prioritize effectively.
• Problem-solver who can suggest creative solutions to improve data quality and business processes.
• Self-driven, with the capacity to work independently or in a small team environment.

Engagement & Reporting Structure
• Work Arrangement: Flexible, ongoing freelance or contract role (with potential for a longer-term engagement).
• Reporting: You’ll report directly to the Publisher and collaborate with sales, marketing, finance, and events teams.
• Location: Remote work is acceptable, but availability for real-time communication and regular updates is required.

How to Apply
• Submit your CV or résumé detailing relevant Salesforce Admin/Analyst experience.
• Include specific examples of reports or dashboards you have created, if available.
• Provide a brief cover letter or summary explaining why you’re a good fit for a Salesforce Admin-focused role rather than a purely development-based one.
• If you have certifications, please list them and include any verification links.

Why Join Tasting Kitchen (TK) Media Group?
• Influence & Impact: You’ll shape our core CRM processes, ensuring data-driven decisions and a high-performing sales operation.
• Collaboration: Work closely with a dynamic team of creatives, event planners, and executives bringing some of the most exciting culinary and lifestyle experiences to life.
• Growth Opportunity: We value personal and professional growth—whether it’s through additional certifications or cross-functional projects in media and events.

Ready to Take Our Salesforce to the Next Level?
Apply now and help us create best-in-class sales processes and data-driven insights at Tasting Kitchen Media Group!

title: Data Scientist Engineer Needed for Innovative Projects
description:
**Job Description: Data Scientist Engineer**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist Engineer to join our dynamic and innovative team. In this pivotal role, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of exciting projects that focus on advanced data analysis and machine learning techniques. Our organization values creativity and collaboration, and we are looking for someone who shares our passion for leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and solutions.

The ideal candidate will possess a robust background in statistics, mathematics, and computer science, coupled with hands-on experience in building and deploying predictive models. You should be proficient in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL, and have experience with data visualization tools and libraries. Familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch will be highly advantageous as you develop algorithms that can learn from and make predictions based on complex data sets.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with a team of talented data analysts and software engineers to develop comprehensive, data-driven solutions that enhance our products and services. You will be responsible for understanding and interpreting complex data structures, identifying patterns and trends, and translating your findings into actionable insights. Your work will directly contribute to improving our decision-making processes and driving business outcomes.

As a Data Scientist Engineer, you will also be expected to stay current with the latest advancements in the field of data science and machine learning. This includes keeping up with emerging technologies, best practices, and industry trends. You will have the opportunity to participate in research and development initiatives, allowing you to experiment with new methodologies and approaches to analyze data and solve problems.

In addition to your technical skills, we value strong communication and collaboration abilities. You will be required to present your findings and recommendations to stakeholders at various levels within the organization. Therefore, the ability to convey complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner is essential.

If you are passionate about data science, driven to make a significant impact, and eager to contribute to a forward-thinking organization, we would love to hear from you! Join us in our mission to harness the power of data and unlock new possibilities for our business and our customers. Apply today to become an integral part of our team and help us shape the future through data-driven innovation.

title: Report Analyst/Designer for PowerBI Report Development and Training
description:
We are seeking an experienced Power BI Consultant to help us transition and build Power BI reports and dashboards based on existing SSRS report templates. Our organization operates on a SQL Server 2019 backend with databases supporting three distinct operating companies. These databases are integral to our use of Microsoft Dynamics GP 2022 as our ERP system, supplemented by Cavallo SalesPad, which integrates directly with Dynamics GP and adds its own tables.

Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop Power BI reports and dashboards using existing SSRS reports as templates.
Optimize connections between our Azure-hosted Windows Server 2022 VM and Power BI Cloud via the On-Premises Data Gateway.
Train our accounting team on the effective use of Power BI, including filtering, customizing views, and exporting data for executive reports.
Provide recommendations for best practices in Power BI, ensuring seamless integration with our current SQL databases.
Prepare the organization for future reporting needs as we transition from Dynamics GP/SalesPad to NetSuite over the next 4–6 months.
(Optional) If experienced, assist in Tableau integration for broader data visualization options.
Skills and Expertise Required:

Proven expertise in Power BI development, deployment, and training.
Strong understanding of SQL, especially within Microsoft SQL Server 2019 environments.
Familiarity with SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) and converting SSRS reports to Power BI.
Experience with Dynamics GP 2022 and Cavallo SalesPad is highly desirable.
Knowledge of cloud infrastructure, particularly Azure, and setting up On-Premises Data Gateways.
Excellent communication skills to provide training and documentation for non-technical users.
Optional: Experience with Tableau for comparative or supplementary reporting solutions.


Additional Details:

This project will focus on the interim use of Power BI to replaces SSRS reports that are pulling data from a SQL Virtual Machine hosted in Azure.  Later, we will need to update these dashboard to connect to the NetSuite environment via API.

Applicants should be able to create robust, scalable immediate solution that connects with our Dynamics ERP while offering flexibility for the change to NetSuite in the next 6 months.

Work will include regular virtual sessions for training and support.

If you are a Power BI expert with a strong SQL background and experience training teams through data visualization, and are able to begin immediately, please submit a proposal.
